loans.name: Mouhammad

texts.en:
Mouhammad is a 41-year-old Iraqi married man, who has 6 children. Mouhammad is a grocer and he works hard to provide for his family.
In his grocery store, Mouhammad sells shampoo, detergent, dairy products, soft drinks and snacks. In 2000, he took over his father’s business and since then he has been working at this business and providing his living from it. He has experience in this field and is well known in his neighborhood.
Mouhammad is requesting a loan of $3,000. He will use this loan to renovate his shop to attract more customers. He hopes, through this renovation, that his business will grow more so he will be able to satisfy his children’s needs and pay their school fees.

loans.use: to renovate his shop

loans.name: Zaher

texts.en: Zaher is from Iraq. He is 52 years old, married, and the father of five children. Zaher and his wife run a grocery store together. They have various products to offer, such as snacks, detergents, drinks and dairy products. He has been in this field since 2009 and has gained a good reputation;  he is the only grocer in the neighborhood. Zaher is applying for a loan of 3,000 USD. He will use this loan to install a display window and also to buy a motor generator. He aims to increase his food inventory and also his income, so that he may provide his family better with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to install a display window and buy a motor generator for his grocery store.

loans.name: Mainor Danilo

texts.es:
Mainor  tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su madre y hermanos en El Municipio de Taulabe, Comayagua.
Mainor  se dedica desde hace 4 años a la agricultura, específicamente al  cultivo del café. El café lo vende en pergamino en el mercado local, este negocio le es rentable, el precio del café se mantiene y le da los ingresos necesarios para aportar con los gastos del hogar.
Esta solicitando el tercer préstamo de 15,000 lempiras que lo invertirá para comprar fertilizante. Con esta inversión ayudara a mantener sus cultivos con buena asistencia  libres de toda plaga. Así podrá seguir vendiendo y ofreciendo el café de buena calidad.
Su meta es mantener la finca de café en buen estado y mantener una buena producción en las cosechas.
texts.en:
Mainor is 22 years old and single. He lives with his mother and siblings in the Taulabe municipality in Comayagua.

Mainor has worked for four years in agriculture, specifically the cultivation of coffee. He sells the pergamino coffee in the local market. This business is profitable. The price of coffee remains steady and provides him the necessary income to contribute to home expenses.

He is requesting his third loan of 15,000 Lempiras, which he will invest in the purchase of fertilizer. With this investment, he will help to maintain his crops with good assistance free from all plagues. Thus, he will be able to continue selling and offering good-quality coffee.

His goal is to maintain the coffee farm in good condition and maintain a good crop production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for coffee cultivation.

loans.name: Feride

texts.en: Feride is a 53-year-old married woman with seven grown children. She lives in the south. Her husband is a pensioner, and Feride works in agriculture to earn a living and provide for family needs. Because there is demand in the neighborhood, she has started to sell milk and milk products to others in her community. She has been selling fresh milk to the local dairy farm and has made a good living, and profits, from this so far. To generate even more income, she has applied for a loan to buy another cow. In the future, she plans to add more cows and to increase her business and milk production. She is aware that without Kiva’s, support her goal will be difficult to achieve. She appreciates all the support from the Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to buy another cow for her dairy business.

loans.name: Kiminu 2 (2) Group

texts.en: Kalixe, age 38, is married and has three children, ages 7 to 15. All of his children are attending school. He is representing the Kiminu 2 (2) group. Kalixe has two different small businesses, which he has had for two years. He makes and sells foufou (a traditional African food) and peanut butter. He also has a small pharmacy where he sells various medicines. He will use this loan to buy medicine to stock his pharmacy. His business strategy is to provide friendly customer service and treat his customers well. This is Kalixe's first loan from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. HOPE and Kalixe’s group are confident in his ability to pay back the loan. He hopes his children will continue with their education and progress in life.

loans.use: to pay for medicine to stock his pharmacy.

loans.name: Darlyn Marleny

texts.es:
Darlyn tiene24 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con sus hijo en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Barbará.
Darlyn atiende su negocio de pulpería. Ella vende productos alimenticios como harina, maseca, frijoles, azúcar, carnes, y productos de abarrotería. Ha trabajado desde pequeña y creció con la convicción de ten tener su su propio negocio.
Solicito un préstamo de 7,000 lempiras para invertir en compra de productos alimenticios para surtir la pulpería y ofrecer variedad de producto.
La meta que tiene es incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la vida de su hijo.
texts.en:
Darlyn is 24 years old, is a single mother and lives with her son in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Barbará.

Darlyn attends to her grocery store.  She sells food products like flour, corn flour, sugar, meats and other grocery products.  She has worked since she was young and grew up with the goal of having her own business.

She requested a loan of 7,000 lempiras to invest in buying food products to supply her grocery store and offer a variety of products.

The goal she has is to to increase her income and improve her son's life.

loans.use: to buy food products to supply her business

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: Adjovi  est mariée à un employé au Port Autonome de Lomé. Elle est âgée de 33 ans. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus, la vente de charbons de bois, des ignames, du haricot et autres. Elle a démarré ses activités en 2002 et s’approvisionne au Nord du pays. Elle demande un troisième prêt pour acheter de nouveaux sacs de charbons de bois et les autres produits. Madame Adjovi espère avec les profits porter une aide aux enfants de ses frères et se prendre en charge.
texts.en:
Adjovi, age 33, is married to an employee of the Autonomous Port of Lomé. Her business consists in selling charcoal, yams, beans, and other products.

She started her business in 2002, and gets her supplies in the north of the country. She's seeking her third loan to buy sacks of charcoal and other products.

With her profits, Mrs. Adjovi hopes to provide for herself and help the children of her brothers.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal, yams, and tapioca

loans.name: Fadel

texts.en:
Fadel is a 33-year-old Iraqi client who is married and has three children. Fadel is the sole provider of the family.

Fadel is a grocer. He offers to sell various products like shampoos, detergents, snacks, dairy products, and drinks. He has been in this field since 2010 and has good experience in what he practices since he previously worked in a similar shop, as an employee. Fadel is well-known in his surroundings, thanks to his good behavior with his clients.

Fadel is requesting a loan of USD 1,200. He will use this loan to install a second ceiling and a new floor and increase his inventory. With this loan, he aims to grow his business and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to install a second ceiling and a new floor and increase his inventory.

loans.name: Zahide

texts.en:
Zahide is 54 years old and married with seven children. She lives in the southern part of Kosovo. Her husband is a pensioner and for more than ten years Zahide has been raising cows, which is the main source of income for her family. She started this business by selling milk in her neighborhood and she is very satisfied with her business.

Zahide is requesting a loan to buy a cow and calf. This loan will help her to reduce her costs and to increase her income by selling milk and milk products. In the future she hopes to expand her business and save for her youngest child’s university expenses. She is aware that without Kiva lenders, her goal would be difficult to achieve. She appreciates the help!

loans.use: To buy a cow and calf

loans.name: Hamzeh

texts.en: Hamzeh is married, 31 years old, and the father of three children. He also shares his home with his parents and his brother, and he and his brother are the family's breadwinners. Hamzeh works hard at a bakery which he opened last year. He has wide experience in this field because he used to work in a bakery before he went into business on his own. His business grew fast and his reputation spread all over the neighborhood. He now has three employees who work for him. He is requesting a loan for $2,400 to renovate his bakery, install a new rolling shutter and new signs. Hamzeh believes that this loan will help him improve his financial situation.

loans.use: to renovate his bakery.

loans.name: Flor De Canela 2 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE CANELA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por doce  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marciala es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de dulces, venta de chamarras, venta de comida, venta de papa, venta de arroz.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Marciala es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una Jefa de Centro de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió de un trabajo anterior, donde apoyaba en la cocina, posteriormente con mayor experiencia y con los recursos decide emprender su propio negocio en el rubro de la comida.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de máquina broster) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de trabajo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene ocho hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Flor de Canela” will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Regional Office. It is made up of twelve members and is directed by a board of directors of which Marciala is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal association pursue are varied. Included among them are: a neighborhood store, and various sales in sweets, coats, food, potatoes, and rice.

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small micro-businesses of which Marciala is a member. She indicates that this is the first time that she has joined Pro Mujer, joining through the invitation of a Central Manager of the institution. Currently, she has a food-sales business. She states that she launched this business from a previous job where she provided support in the kitchen. Subsequently, with greater experience and with the resources she decided to start her own business in the food industry.

The loan that she will now take out is for the increase of capital (to purchase a Broaster roasting machine) that she will acquire from the wholesale merchants in the city of La Paz and subsequently install it in her workspace. This type of work permits her to generate an income to maintain her home in all possible ways; she is married and has eight children.

When consulted about what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health and loan trainings.

loans.use: to buy a Broaster roasting machine.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina, de 34 años de edad es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Fortunato, con quien tiene 3 hijos a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 10 años. Desde muy joven comenzó a trabajar en los terrenos agrícolas, aprendió a producir la tierra y tiene mucho conocimiento sobre los temas agrícolas, pero según comenta se estableció en el pueblo y dejó de sembrar de manera constante, “Siembro alimentos para mi consumo, de esa forma me alimento de manera natural”, afirma.  Pero comenzó con el negocio de compra y venta de ganado como: vacas, cerdos y ovejas, las cuales engorda para ensebarlos posteriormente, “no solo los engordo, también los nutro con buen pasto y comida balanceada para que tengan buena carne y cuesten más”, es por eso que siembra alfalfa en sus terrenos agrícolas de mayor extensión, donde produce pastos naturales para el consumo de sus animales. Este es el primer crédito con KIVA y promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Faustina, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos, ya que dentro de poco comenzará la temporada de escasez de alfalfa.
texts.en:
Faustina, who is 34 years old, is an unassuming woman. She lives with her husband, Fortunato, with whom she has three children, whom she cares for in the house that they bought 10 years ago. She began to work on the agricultural lands when she was very young. She learned to cultivate the land, and she has a lot of knowledge of agricultural subjects, but as she commented, she settled in the town and stopped planting continually. "I plant food for my use. In this way I feed myself in a natural manner," she states. But she began a business of buying and selling animals such as cows, pigs, and sheep, which she fattens to sell later. "I not only fatten them, I also nourish them with good grass and balanced feed so that they have good meat and sell for more." It is for this reason that she plants alfalfa on her largest areas of agricultural land, where she produces natural pasturelands for the consumption of her animals.

This is her first loan with Kiva, and she promises to be punctual in making her payments. Faustina will invest the 500 PEN in the purchase of organic compost to nourish her plantings, since the season when alfalfa is scarce will begin soon.

loans.use: to buy organic compost for her pasturelands.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda earns a living through her sari-sari store (variety store) by selling various goods and items to the people in her town of Antequera, Bohol. She has been in the business for more than eight years now and she works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family.

Leonarda is applying for a loan to buy additional stocks of goods like canned food, rice, noodles, snacks, beverages, detergents and toiletries. With her loan, she will be able to attract and cater for more customers, thus improving her sales and income. In the future, Leonarda hopes to make her business a profitable success.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell, such as canned goods, rice, noodles, biscuits and snack foods

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 43, years old and lives in GMA, Cavite, Philippines with her husband and three children. She earns a living by selling herbal products from a company known as Vita Plus. She pays for her inventory in cash and then gives her customers one month to pay her back for the products they buy. People like to buy from her because she charges less than the company's catalog. She sells to neighbors and people in her community, and earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week. She is requesting a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. Marcelina hopes that her business will continue to grow, and to help make that happen she meets with co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who meet weekly to study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy herbal products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Alae

texts.en:
Alae is a single Iraqi client who is 33 years old and lives with his family, consisting of 4 members. Alae and his brother provide the income for the family together.

Alae owns a grocery store. In his grocery store he sells all types of daily necessities like canned food, snacks, detergents, shampoos, and dairy. He has been in this field for more than 15 years and has been gaining much experience in what he does. In 2003, Alae established his own business, and now he has hired an employee. He has gained an excellent reputation in his area.

Alae is requesting a sum of $2,500 to buy a medium-sized motor generator and to increase his grocery inventory. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he may be able to not only take care of his parents but also his own future family.

loans.use: to buy a medium-sized motor generator and to increase his grocery inventory

loans.name: Kiminu 2 (3) Group

texts.en:
Flavienne, age 32, is married with 3 children, ages 1 to 18 years old. The oldest 2 kids are currently attending school. She is representing the Kiminu 2 (3) group. Flavienne has a small food stall where she sells a variety of food products. She has had this business for 3 years. She will use the loan to buy food, such as rice, in bulk from her supplier. Her business strategy is to sell her merchandise at competitive prices.

This is Flavienne's first loan from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. HOPE and her group are confident she will pay back the loan. She wants to continue to expand her business and begin offering more products.

loans.use: to pay for food products in bulk

loans.name: Amir

texts.en:
Amir is a married Iraqi youth client, who is 25 years old. 

Amir is a grocer. He offers various products for his customers, like detergents, canned food, shampoos, cigarettes, ice cream, and dairy products. He established his business in 2010. Amir gained good experience through his continuous hard work, in order to provide extra income for his family. He now has hired an employee and has gained a good reputation in his area.

Amir is requesting a youth loan of $2,400. He will use this loan to install a rolling shutter, roof, and display window for his grocery store. Through this loan, he aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he may provide a good future for his family.

loans.use: to install a rolling shutter, roof, and a display window for his grocery store

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi vit avec son conjoint et leurs 02 enfants de 15 et 13ans à Lomé. Elle est âgée de 45ans. Pour porter main forte à son conjoint dans les charges du foyer, elle a démarré en 2000 la vente des pagnes et des tissus dans un marché de la ville de Lomé. Afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients, elle fait un troisième prêt à WAGES pour acheter des pagnes et tissus pour revendre. A l’avenir, elle espère renforcer son activité tout en assurant les besoins primaires de la famille.
texts.en:
Afi, age 45, lives in Lomé with her spouse and their two children, age 15 and 13. In 2002, she started selling pagnes (colorful African cloth) and fabrics in one of Lomé's markets, in order to help her spouse cover the household expenses.

To better meet customer demand, she's seeking her third loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy pagnes and fabrics to resell.

In the future, she hopes to bolster her business, while at the same time ensuring her family's primary needs are covered.

loans.use: to buy pagnes (colorful African cloth) and fabrics

loans.name: Alae

texts.en:
Alae is a married, 37-year-old, Iraqi client who owns a small shop for selling mobile phones and their accessories. He offers to sell mobile phones with affordable and competitive prices and he provides all the needed mobile phone accessories for his clients. He established his business in 2011. He is gradually gaining his experience through his practice and he is gaining a good reputation in the neighborhood.

Alae is requesting a loan of USD 3,000 to pay the annual rent of his shop and to increase his mobile phone inventory. He aims to grow his business and increase his revenues, so that he may provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop and to increase his mobile phone inventory.

loans.name: Sajad

texts.en:
Sajad is a married Iraqi client who is 41 years old and has 4 children. Sajad is the sole provider in the family. He owns a small shop and specializes in selling rolls of textiles. He offers to sell textiles for various purposes. These textiles are used to make clothes, curtains, and covers. He established his business in 2011. Sajad is the only textile seller in his neighborhood, which helped him to grow and gain a good reputation.
 
Sajad is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to renovate his shop and increase his textile inventory. This loan will help him to grow his business and increase his profits. By increasing his profits, Sajad will be able to pay his children’s school fees and provide them a good future.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and increase his textile inventory

loans.name: Alexandre

texts.fr: Alexandre est un homme de 37 ans, fiançé, père de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 5 mois et 12 ans. Deux d'ntre eux vont à l'école. Il est commerçant et a ouvert un petit restaurant qu'il gère depuis 2 ans dans un quartier de la capitale. Son activité fonctione bien et c'est grace à elle qu'il subvient aux besoins de sa famille. Il a un problème du à la petitesse de son capital qu'il l'empêche de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle qui augmente au fil du temps. D'ou la necessité de ce crédit pour lui qui lui permettra d'augmenter le stock de ses denrées alimentaires (casiers de boissons, palettes de poisson, viande, poulet). Celui augmentera non seulement ses ventes, mais aussi sa marge bénéficiaire. Les bénéfices générés seront réinvestis dans l'activité pour l'agrandir.
texts.en: Alexandre is 37 years old. He is engaged to be married and has three children ranging from five months to 12 years of age. Two of the children are in school. He is an entrepreneur. He has opened a small restaurant in one of the districts of the capital city and has been managing it for two years. His business is going well and allows him to provide for his family. His challenge is his small capital, which prevents him from better meeting the needs of his growing customer base. This is why he needs a loan to expand the stock of food times (cases of beverages; crates of fish, meat, and poultry). This will allow him to increase not only his sales volume but also his profit margin. The revenues earned will be reinvested in his business for further expansion.

loans.use: to increase his stock of food items.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en: Ma. Teresa earns a living through her sari-sari (variety store) business where she sells various goods to the people in her area. Ma. Teresa works hard to support her husband and the needs of the family. She is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks of items like canned goods, noodles, rice, soap, toiletries, soda, and other beverages to sell. With this loan, Ma. Teresa hopes to make her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of items like canned goods, noodles, rice, soap, toiletries, soda, and other beverages to sell

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
This is Elvie. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more products for her variety store. She has had this business for three years now. She and her husband, who is a driver, work hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Elvie dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, when she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Abdul Hussain

texts.en: Abdul Hussain is 58 years old and lives in Iraq with his wife and five children. He is the family's sole breadwinner and works hard as a blacksmith. After taking courses many years ago in this field, he gained good experience by making doors and windows. In 1990, he established his own business and now employs two people. He has an excellent reputation in his surrounding area, and is requesting a loan for $2,500 to buy equipment for his shop. He wants to grow his business and increase his profits so that he can provide a bright future for each of his children.

loans.use: to buy equipment for his blacksmith shop.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en: Primitiva is a fish vendor from the town of Antequera, Bohol. She has been in the business for more than 15 years and is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell. With this loan, she will be able to increase her sales and thereby augment her sales and income. In the future, Primitiva hopes to make her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Teodola

texts.en: Teodola is a basket weaver from the town of Maribojoc, Bohol. She is married and has been in business for more than 30 years. She works hard in order to augment her income so that she can help her husband meet the needs of their family. Teodola is asking for a loan to buy more materials for basket weaving such as bamboo, rattan and wicker. With this loan, she will be able weave more baskets and sell more to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more materials for basket weaving.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy organic manure

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Doña Reyna madre soltera de tres hijos, mujer trabajadora quien se ganaba la vida a diario vendiendo comida de manera ambulante, pero ahora desea incursionar con el negocio de gas liquido y continuar con la venta de frutas que ya había empezado, con este crédito desea comprar 3 barriles para almacenar el gas en liquido y venderlo, también desea invertir en variedades de frutas y gaseosas, negocio que le permite vender más rápido y obtener mejores ganancias para seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en: Reyna’s a single mother of three children; she’s a hardworking woman who earns her living selling food from place to place every day but she now wants to go into the liquid gas business and continue with the fruit selling business she’s already started.  She will use this loan to buy three liquid gas storage barrels to store it and then sell it; she also wants to invest in a variety of fruit and soft-drinks, a business that makes it possible for her to make quick sales and earn better profits to continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy three liquid gas storage containers and a variety of fruit and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es: Don jacinto vive en casa propia junto con su esposa y sus hijos, es un hombre muy responsable honesto y trabajador, tiene muchos años con el cultivo de cereales, ademas posee un molino y cria de pollos y cerdos, con los ingresos que el obtiene le permite cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar ya que sus ventas son variadas, el solicita un credito para comprar mas insumos agricolas y poder seguirle dando lo necesario a su familia y seguir cubriendo todos los gastos que se le presentan.
texts.en: Jacinto lives in his own house with his wife and children.  He’s a very responsible, honest, hardworking man who has been growing grain for many years.  He also owns a mill and raises chickens and pigs.  With income earned he’s able to cover some of the household expenses since his sales vary.  He’s requesting a loan to buy more farm supplies to continue providing for his family’s needs and continue covering expenses that come up.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Denia Suyapa

texts.es:
Denia tiene 26 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo y vive en la ciudad de San Pedro Sula.
Hace 5 años que Dunia con sus propios esfuerzos estableció su negocio de venta de ropa, como camisas, pantalones, vestidos, ropa interior etc. Atiende todo el día a sus clientes, las ventas son rentables y de las ganancias obtenidas obtenidas y los créditos ha podido mantener el negocio.
Esta solicitando su tercer préstamo de 15000 lempiras y es para surtir de ropa interior para la venta. 
La meta es aumentar la clientela y tener el producto necesario para satisfacer a sus clientes.
texts.en: Denia, 26, is married and has a son; she lives in the city of San Pedro Sula.  She started her own business selling clothes like shirts, pants, dresses, underwear, etc. five years ago.  She tends to customers all day and her sales are profitable; she’s been able to stay in business thanks to profits earned and loans received.  She’s requesting her third loan for 15,000 Lempiras to stock up on underwear to sell.  Her goal is to increase her clientele and to have product on hand to meet demand.

loans.use: to buy underwear to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her working capital.

loans.name: La Puissance 2 (2) Group

texts.en:
Ange, age 40, is single, with no children. He is representing the group, La Puissance 2 (2). Ange has a game room where he provides video game consoles, TVs, and DVD players for people to use. In Congo, many people do not have their own game consoles, so they pay to go to a game room. He has had this business for seven years. 

Ange will use the loan to pay for a machine that plays and burns CDs. His business strategy is to offer good prices for the use of his machines. He encourages his customers to buy more use by, for example, charging XAF 100 for one soccer match, but XAF 150 for two soccer matches. 

Ange has received one previous loan from HOPE Congo S.A., Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record with HOPE Congo S.A. In the future, he hopes to buy a computer for his business.

loans.use: to pay for a machine that plays and burns CDs.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is 55 years old. She lives in a small village of Kareli District, with her husband. Manana requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is their the agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milking cow, whose milk is used in cheese production. Besides, they have 0.7 hectare of agricultural land, where apple, plum and cherry trees are grown. They sell the harvested products locally. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Recently, Manana requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved, in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits, with soft conditions, to rural poor people, who do not have access to other credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

With the received credit Manana will open a new bakery. She will install natural gas and purchase all the needed equipment and supplies for the bakery. After opening a bakery, she and her husband will work hard to increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open a new bakery

loans.name: Ayde

texts.es:
Ayde, de 33 años de edad es una mujer independiente. Vive en compañía de su esposo en la casa que heredó de sus padres.Se caracteriza por ser una mujer tímida, pero trabajadora ,su principal ingreso económico se centra en la comercialización de menestras y maiz , los cuales le otorgan un ingreso semanal y constante. Antes gustaba de la siembra, comenta que no deja de hacerlo pero solo para su propio consumo y es en temporada de maíz donde tiene buenos ingresos vendiendo su propia cosecha. Actualmente existen varias personas que se dedican a ser solamente agricultores, ella no quiere ser una más, por eso emprendió el negocio de vender menestras y maiz el cual le da ganancias estables , ahora desea comprar un lugar estable en una zona de comercio para poder negociar sus menestras a buen precio y proyectarse a ser una empresaria mayorista. “Esa es mi meta, espero conseguirlo con el apoyo de mi esposo y familia, sobre todo porque mis hijos son pequeños y necesitarán de nosotros”, afirma. Este es el segundo crédito con KIVA, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues agradece el apoyo financiero que le permite mejorar sus sembríos.
Ayde, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos, pues dentro de poco cosechará menestras y maiz.
texts.en:
Ayde, 33, is an independent woman. She lives with her husband in the house which she inherited from her parents. She is characterized as a timid yet hardworking woman. 

Her main financial income comes from the sale of legumes and corn, which gives her a constant weekly income. She used to like sowing crops, which she says that she still does, but only for her own consumption. It is during the corn season that she has a good income selling her own harvest.

There are currently many people who make a living just by being farmers, but she does not want to be one of them. Therefore, she learned the business of selling legumes and corn, which gives her a stable income. She would now like to buy a place in a commercial area so she can sell her legumes at a good price and grow into a wholesale entrepreneur. "That is my goal, which I hope to accomplish with the support of my husband and my family, especially because my children are young and they will need us," she says.

This is her second loan with Kiva. She promises to be punctual with her payments, as she is grateful for the financial support which will allow her to improve her fields. Ayde will invest these 2,000 Peruvian soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer to nourish her crops, because soon she will harvest the legumes and corn.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina continúa en el banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS”  Marina continua con la crianza de animales como cuyes, pollos y gallinas. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar pollos y cuyes. Marina  está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Marina is still a member of the "Reyna de los Ángeles de Urquillos" communal bank. She continues to raise animals, such as guinea pigs, chickens, and hens. On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy chickens and guinea pigs. Marina is happy with this loan and committed to complying with her payments.

loans.use: to buy chickens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is 28 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school.  He lives in Gbarnga, the capital city of Bong County. Eric is a high school graduate and has been involved in business for the past six years, selling phone accessories and artificial flowers.  Eric started this business  by helping his father run his shop, and later he open his own shop.

Eric has less capital to meet his customers' needs. He is requesting a loan, which he will use to purchase more phone accessories, artificial flowers, and others items.  His business has make him know many people and he is popular in this county. His plan is to educate his children to college level.

loans.use: to purchase phone accessories, artificial flowers, and others items.

loans.name: Odonchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Odonchimeg, 37 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. Her elder son studies at university, while her younger son goes to high school. She and her husband have been running a building materials sales business for eight years. She used her previous loan in order to increase her inventory, and she paid each installment on schedule without delay.

This time, she is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT, which she will use to pay her elder son's tuition and fees. Not paying the tuition for a long time has caused her son to be blamed by the university director. So paying the tuition will relieve her son and it won't affect his academic performance. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who deeply cares for her son.

loans.use: To pay university tuition and fees for her elder son

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is a 51-year-old, married woman and mother of four children, from Loon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a distilled water retailing business for more than 10 years. This is the source of her income.

Teofila has hopes of expanding her business, but she lacks the financial resources to do so. Therefore, she is asking for a loan, which she will use to buy more 3-gallon bottles for her water refilling business. Teofila dreams of making her business a success and sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more 3-gallon bottles for her clean water refilling business

loans.name: Jessica Alexandra

texts.es: Nació en un núcleo familiar conformado por su padre, madre y su hermanito menos, inicio sus estudios a los cinco años en un colegio público, allí le fue muy bien pudo crecer tanto física como mentalmente, esto le proporciono las herramientas para pensar en estudiar una carrera, pero aun no tenia definido que era lo que la hacía apasionar, un día caminando se encontró con la institución CAMPOALTO donde recibió la información y despertó un interés en es uno de sus programas, Administración en Salud, estudiando esto su ha podido dar cuenta que la apasiona hacer esto que su anhelo es poder desarrollarse profesionalmente y así entregarle a su familia una colaboración para devolver así sea en pequeñas cantidades todo lo que han hecho por ella.
texts.en: She was born into a nuclear family composed of her father, mother and younger brother.  She started school at the age of five in a public school.  She did very well there and she was able to develop both physically and mentally.  This gave her the tools to consider a career but she still wasn’t sure what she was passionate about.  One day while out walking she came across the Campoalto Institution where she got information that awakened an interest in her for one of its programs: Health Administration.  By studying this, she’s been able to discover what she’s passionate about and her dream now is to develop professionally to collaborate with her family and return to them, even if only in small amounts, all they’ve done for her.

loans.use: to complete her degree in health administration.

loans.name: Nayelly Josselyn

texts.es:
Nayelly tine 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive con su abuela en la ciudad de San Pedro Sula.
Ella tiene un negocio de venta de novedades. Lo inicio hace 3 años con iniciativa y capital propio, ofrece cosmeticos, articulos para regalos y ropa juvenil. Desde muy pequeña soño con tener su propio negocio y esta muy contenta, sus ventas son buenas y de alli solventa los gastos incurridos en el hogar. 
Esta solicitando un prestamo de 14000 lempiras para invertir en su negocio, comprara mercaderia como ropa, cosmeticos y otros productos que le demandan. Con esta inversion piensa aumentar las ganancias las cuales tiene destinadas a comprar mas variedad. la meta que tiene crecer aun mas en su negocio y seguir atendiendo a los clientes.
texts.en:
Nayelly, 21, is single and lives with her grandmother in the city of San Pedro Sula.

She has a business selling novelty items, which she started three years ago with her own initiative and capital. She sells cosmetics, gift items, and children's clothing. From a very young age, she dreamed of having her own business, and she is very happy. Her sales are good and she is able to cover the household expenses.

She has applied for a loan of 14,000 Honduran lempiras to invest in her business. She will buy merchandise such as clothing, cosmetics, and other products which her clients ask for. With this investment, she hopes to increase her earnings, which she will then use to buy a greater variety of products. Her goal is to grow her business even more and to continue serving her clients.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Maria Camila

texts.es:
Maria Camila Tiene la edad más bonita que ha podido experimentar en la que ha, siente que sus sueños se cumplen, tiene la ilusión de terminar su programa en CAMPOALTO en cocina, se dedica a su trabajo y a su estudio, sus papas le ayudan con algunos pagos, pero la situación económica que pasan no es la mejor, por esto ella se esmera para cada día mejorar y mejorar.
Además de ayudarle a ella  económicamente le ayudan a su hermano quien por cuestiones un poco incomodas de comentar se encuentra en centro de reclusión. 
Tiene grandes aspiraciones, entre ellas poder seguir estudiando, desempeñarse como profesional en su campo, colaborar en su casa con los gastos y saber que todo lo que tiene y ha hecho es por merito de todos.
texts.en:
Maria Camila is at the most beautiful age which she has been able to experience. She feels like her dreams are coming true, and she hopes to finish her culinary program at CampoAlto. She is dedicated to her work and her studies. 

Her parents help her with some expenses, but they are not in the best financial situation. Therefore, she makes an effort to improve every day. Besides giving her financial support, they also help her brother who, for reasons which would be uncomfortable to mention, is in a detention center.

She has great aspirations, among them the opportunity to continue studying and to develop herself as a professional in her field. She hopes to help with her household expenses and to know that everything that she has and has done is to everyone's credit.

loans.use: to finish her CampoAlto culinary program.

loans.name: Kiwissa 2 (2) Group

texts.en:
Abraham, age 42, is married and has three children between the ages of 9 and 20. All three of his children are attending school. He is representing the Kiwissa 2 (2) group. Abraham sells farming products and has been doing this for 10 years. He will use the loans to buy more supplies, including bean and peanut seeds. His business strategy is to only sell good quality seeds and products.
 
Abraham has received two previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. He hopes to continue to pursue his business goals and have a successful business.

loans.use: to pay for farming supplies, such as bean and peanut seeds

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia's previous loan was a big help to her business. She was able to buy all the needed grocery items for her variety store, which she has run for 15 years. The loan also helped with her everyday expenses. She and her husband are working hard for their family's future. They also have a motorcycle for rental for additional income.

Letecia is requesting another loan for 50,000 PHP, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits, which will help her to sustain her daily needs. .

Letecia hopes that they her whole family including her grandchildren will have a better future. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages.

loans.name: Sevil

texts.en:
Sevil lives with her son, whose age is 26. She is a farmer with 13 years experience. Her sphere of activity is husbandry. Surely her son helps her and earns the experience and income from farming together with her. 

With the seasonal fluctuations in prices, now is an advantageous time to buy up cattle feed and additional cattle. She is relying on help and assistance, and she thanks you in advance.

Sevil is grateful to those who supported her previous loan, the income from which allowed her to significantly improve her family's welfare and also to realize her plans to expand her farm.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed and additional cattle.

loans.name: Kiwissa 2 (3) Group

texts.en:
Germain, age 31, runs a butcher shop in the local market. He has two children, ages two and nine years old. The eldest is attending school and the youngest goes to a nursery. Germain is representing the Kiwissa 2 (3) group. He has had this business for eight years. His business strategy is to work hard and increase production. 

Germain has received and repaid two previous loans from Kiva partner HOPE Congo and has a good repayment record. He will use his loan funds to buy more meat to stock his shop, including beef, fish, and chicken.

In the future, Germain would like to buy a large freezer for storing meat. His goal is for his children to become educated and well-informed people.

loans.use: to buy more meat to stock his shop, including beef, fish, and chicken

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa está en su ciclo número 10 del programa de comité, dos de estas mujeres han mostrado en su encuesta de eliminación de pobreza que están por debajo de la línea de la pobreza. Son mujeres jefas de familia que se esfuerzan por salir adelante.
La Sra. Antonia se encuentra dentro del nivel dos y cuenta que se dedica a la venta de carbón, ella comenta que gracias a este trabajo esta saliendo adelante y ayuda a su familia con todo lo que ella puede. Antonia es muy trabajadora y emprendedora, y tiene como meta la de seguir creciendo como microempresaria y crecer en su negocio.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de madera para convertirlas en carbón, ya que quiere seguir con su trabajo y que no le falte su principal producto.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa group is in their 10th loan cycle with the organization. In a poverty elimination survey, two of these women showed that they are below the poverty line.  These women are heads of their families who struggle to get ahead.  

Antonia is in level two and has a business selling charcoal.  She says that thanks to this work she is succeeding and helping her family with everything she can.  Antonia is very hardworking and enterprising.  She has a goal of growing as a small business owner and growing her business.

She is requesting this loan to purchase wood to convert into charcoal since she wants to continue with her work and not run out of her main product.

loans.use: to purchase wood to make charcoal.

loans.name: Las Tejedoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS TEJEDORAS”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Laura es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: taller de carpintería, elaboración de macramé, venta de frutas, tejido de mantas, tejido de polainas, elaboración de prendas en lana de alpaca, tejido de chompas de lana, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Laura es integrante, ella indica que es el segundo año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de carpintería; mismo que decidieron abrir conjuntamente con su concubino, ya que él conoce el oficio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de madera) que adquirirá de las barracas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The communal bank “LAS TEJEDORAS” [“THE WEAVERS”] will begin its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer Bolivia through the regional office of Juan Pablo. The communal bank is made up of eight members and is directed by a governing board, of which Laura is the president. The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied and include a carpentry workshop, making macramé, fruit sales, blanket weaving, knitting leggings, making alpaca wool clothing, knitting wool sweaters, and a neighborhood corner store.

The loan they are requesting will benefit small micro entrepreneurs such as Laura, who is in her second year as a member of Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of a promoter of Pro Mujer that came to visit her in her home. Laura currently has a carpentry workshop, which she decided to open with her partner because he knows the trade.

Laura will use the loan to increase the capital of her business by buying wood. She will buy the wood in the lumberyards of the city of La Paz. She will then sell their carpentry products in the markets of the city of El Alto. This business generates income to support her family, which consists of herself, her husband and her two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Laura answers that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to buy wood for her carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Aleksi

texts.en:
Aleksi is 32 years old. He lives in the small village of Telavi District with his wife, two-year-old son, and parents. Several times, Aleksi requested a loan from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a vineyard. They produce wine and sell it locally. In addition, his mother works as a cook and gets a small, monthly income. It is hardly enough money for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the 'subsistence poor' category. 

Aleksi requested loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as 'high risk borrowers' because of low income. 

With the received credit, Aleksi will purchase a minibus. After purchasing the minibus, Aleksi will begin trading in livestock. He plans to purchase the livestock at wholesale prices and then resell it to his villagers with the price marked up. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus and begin to trade in livestock.

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en: Rogelia is a 59-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Antequera, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari or variety store where she sells various goods and commodities to the people in her area. Rogelia is asking for a loan to buy more items to sell like canned goods, soda, noodles, rice, beverages, and soap.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, soda, noodles, rice, beverages, and soap

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida, age 33, is a tailor. She has operated her business for three years in order to help her husband to support the family. They have five children, and she started her business because she realized that they would not be able to meet the expenses of the household and support the educational needs of the children on her husband's income alone. Zubaida and her husband manage their household together. 

At this time, Zubaida is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses. She has requested a loan in the amount of Rs. 25,000, which she will use to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons, laces, and zippers in various colors. With this investment, she will be able to meet the increasing demand of her regular customers, who are her neighbors and members of the local community, as well as to attract new ones.

Zubaida hopes to grow her business and dreams of being able to provide a high-quality education to her children through her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons, laces, and zippers in various colors

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Ms. Safia is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. She has been running a cosmetics sales business for the past two years. Due to her husband's low income she is working hard to contribute to the family income. In order to increase her sales she needs to purchase more cosmetics, so she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase more cosmetics such as cleansers, lotions, shampoos, and makeup kits. She expects a boost in her net income and dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics such as cleansers, lotions, shampoos, and makeup kits.

loans.name: Kiwissa 2 (4) Group

texts.en:
Basile, age 59, is married and has two children, ages 15 and 17. They are both currently attending school. He is representing the Kiwissa 2 (4) group. Basile sells drinks in a local market. He has had this business for six years. He will use the loan to buy more drinks to replenish his stock. His business strategy is to give friendly and consistent customer service. He is nice to his customers and tries to cheer them up.
 
Basile has received two previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. He hopes his children will succeed in life and be happy.

loans.use: to buy drinks for resale.

loans.name: Costa Pucu Group

texts.es:
Las 12 integrantes cuentan con actividades variadas, cada una de ellas trabajan y se esfuerzan por salir adelante, ya que ellas quieren poder ayudar a sus familias por medio de ese esfuerzo y evitar que tengan que pasar por necesidades como las que ellas tuvieron que pasar.
La Sra. Pablina es parte de este grupo, ella es la presidenta de este grupo, y comenta que siempre trata de ayudar a sus compañeras del grupo a salir adelante y que no se desanimen. Ella por su parte se dedica a la venta y elaboración de chipas (alimento típico paraguayo), y con ello ayuda a su familia y está saliendo adelante.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de harina de maíz, queso, condimentos, y demás con lo que podrá seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The twelve members of this group have various businesses. All of the women work hard to get ahead because they want to be able to help their families through their efforts and avoid having to experience the difficulties of the past.

Sra. Pablina is part of this group and serves as its president. She notes that she always tries to encourage other members of the group and help them  get ahead. She, herself, earns a living by making and selling “chipas,” (traditional Paraguayan food). Her business enables her to help her family and to get ahead. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase corn flour, cheese, condiments and other ingredients so that she can continue to work and to serve her customers

loans.use: to purchase corn flour, cheese, condiments and other ingredients.

loans.name: Mujeres En Progreso Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres en Progreso  está en su ciclo número 11º , están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde una de ellas está por debajo de la línea de ingresos mínimo. Ella es Maria, quien pese a ello se esfuerza para ir creciendo y día a día mejorar.
Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas y calzados, y está tratando de mejorar su economía por medio de su esfuerzo y dedicación. Además de eso las capacitaciones que recibe le han sido de mucha ayuda para aplicarlo a sus negocios.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de ropa y calzados de temporada lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called "Mujeres en Progreso" (Women in Progress) is in its 11th loan cycle. The group has participated in a survey related to the elimination of poverty, and the results of the survey found that one of the group members, Maria, falls below the poverty line. Despite her meager income, Maria works very hard to grow and improve her condition day by day. 

Maria works selling clothing and footwear, and she is trying to improve her economic situation through her hard work and dedication. Additionally, the trainings she has received as part of the microfinance lending group she belongs to have been very helpful for her as she applies what she has learned to her business. 

At this time, Maria is asking for a loan in order to buy clothing and footwear of the season, which will help her to finalize her business plan and improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas De Fernando Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas de Fernando  es un grupo muy trabajador y antiguo, que gracias al esfuerzo de todas las miembros ya están en el ciclo 19, lo cual es muestra del gran esmero de todas. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde una de las miembros esta en el nivel uno, con bajos ingresos.
Ella es Maria, quien es una persona muy entusiasta y trabajadora, tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y ayudar a s familia por medio del trabajo que hace. Ella vende todo tipo de ropas y calzados, y cuenta que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela y eso la ayuda mucho.
Está solicitando el crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas y calzados de distinta variedad, para poder surtirse y seguir dando buena variedad a sus clientes y a la vez que la ayude en su plan de negocios.
texts.en:
The group called "Mujeres Unidas de Fernando" is a very hardworking group, that thanks to the efforts of all of its members is in its 19th loan cycle. This group has participated in a survey to measure and eliminate poverty, and it was found that one of the members classifies as "level 1", or below the poverty line. 

This bower is Maria. She is a very hardworking and enthusiastic person, who has a great desire to get ahead and help her family through her work. She sells all types of clothing and footwear, and has a very strong clientele who help her out a lot. Maria is currently asking for this loan in order to invest it in the purchase of various types of clothing and footwear, in order to stock her store and continue to provide a good selection of items to her clients.

loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria has been running a shop where she sells artificial hair, fashion clothes, and cosmetics. She started this business with help from her husband and learned this way of selling from her friends.

Victoria is a seventh grade student, 35 years old, and married with two children, aged 13 and 16.The children are in school, and both of them live at home. Victoria lives in the area of Gbarnga, the capital city of Bong County.

Presently, the problem Victoria faces is fewer commodities, since she has a big shop. She is requesting a loan to increase the quantity of her commodities (artificial hair, fashion clothes, and cosmetics), since she has more customers and a big shop. She enjoys her business because it keeps her busy. 

Victoria’s dream is to expand her business even more and see all her children out of college.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of her commodities (artificial hair, fashion clothes, and cosmetics).

loans.name: Munkhjargal

texts.en:
Mr. Munkhjargal, 51 years old, lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. All his children live on their own, separate from him. 

Munkhjargal has been rendering taxi services to local people for nine years and has accumulated a vast amount of experience in this service. Before his taxi service, he had been working as a utilization manager at one of the state-funded commissions. His wife has retired from work and gets a state pension. 

He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase spare parts, such as brake disks, air intake housing, fan blade, and airbag sensor. Using those materials, he can repair his automobile, which he uses for the taxi service, his only income source. 

Munkhjargal is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Kishwar

texts.en: Ms. Kishwar is a 44-year-old married woman who is living with her husband and three children. For about 10 years she has been doing hand embroidery work. She is successfully running her business with the support of her husband; the man shown in the photo is Kishwar’s husband. Both are working together and make beautiful patterns for the people of their community. Their designs are much in demand and they have enough customers that they are able to manage their household expenses. Her daughter also assists them in completing orders on time. To help her to continue her operations, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins, and stones for embellishing her designs. In this way she will be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to increase her income by targeting more customers. She is in her fifth loan cycle, has good repayment history, and is very thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support. Kishwar dreams for her children's bright future and desires to build her own house, as she is living in a rented house with her family.

loans.use: to buy threads and packs of beads, sequins, and stones

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora, age 45, has operated a sari-sari (variety store) business for more than nine years now. She and her husband, who is a carpenter, have six children and live in Loboc, Bohol.

Flora is asking for a loan in order to buy additional stocks to sell in her store, such as canned goods and noodles as well as soda and other beverages. With this investment, she will be able to attract more customers to her store, thus increasing her sales and profits. 

In the future, Flora hopes to expand her store and save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods and noodles as well as soda and other beverages to sell in her store

loans.name: San Blas Group

texts.es:
Las 23 integrantes de este grupo son mujeres muy trabajadoras que vieron una gran oportunidad de progreso en el programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación. El grupo se llama San Blas y ellas están agradecidas por la gran oportunidad que han recibido, ya que les será de mucha ayuda.
Nidia es parte de este grupo, ella cuenta que formar parte del programa la ha ayudado mucho a salir adelante y crecer. Nidia se dedica a la venta de bebidas de todo tipo, y cuenta que siempre tiene muchas ventas, en especial los fines de semana. Comenta que el esfuerzo que hace es por ayudar a su familia y darles todo lo que necesitan y evitar que pasen por necesidades.
Ella solicita este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de bebidas en general, como ser vinos, whiskys, gaseosas y demás, ya que son los que más vende y la ayuda a tener los medios para seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The 23 members of this lending group are all very hardworking women who saw the possibility of a loan with this institution as a great opportunity to get ahead. The group is called "San Blas", and its members are very grateful for the great opportunity they have received, as all of them have benefitted from their participation in the group. 

Nidia, one of the members, reports that being part of the group has enabled her to get ahead and grow her business. Nidia works in a liquor store, and she has been very fortunate to have good sales, especially during the weekends. She tells us that the work that she does is to help her family and give them everything that they need. 

She is asking for this loan in order to buy drinks such as wine, whisky, sodas and more, as these are the items she sells most and stocking her store will enable her to continue to help her family.

loans.use: To buy wine, whisky, soda and more

loans.name: Boqueron 2 Group

texts.es:
Boqueron 2 es un grupo de Ciudad del Este están en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, gracias al esfuerzo que todas juntas han hecho ninguna de las integrantes está por debajo de la línea de la pobreza, pero trabajar para seguir creciendo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, comenta que día a día empieza su jornada muy temprano ya que ella vende todo tipo de comidas y desde temprano que empieza con su trabajo. Comenta que le va muy bien, ya que tiene muy buena mano para las comidas y sus clientes siempre quedan muy satisfechos. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que le será de gran ayuda.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de mas ingredientes para preparar las comidas, como ser verduras, carnes, condimentos y demás, ya que con ello seguirá deleitando a sus clientes con sus delicias.
texts.en:
"Boqueron 2" is a group in Ciudad del Este that is in its 4th loan cycle. Thanks to the effort of all of the group members, none of the women report income below the poverty line - their work has allowed them to grow their businesses and get ahead. 

One of the group members is Maria, who in the last poverty survey reported a poverty level of "2". She tells us that every day she begins her work very early, selling all types of foods. She tells us that business is going well, as she is skilled at making food and her clients are always satisfied. She really appreciates the opportunity she has received by being part of this lending group, as it has helped her very much with her business. 

Maria is currently asking for this loan in order to buy more ingredients for food preparation - vegetables, meat, condiments, and more. This way, she will be able to continue providing her clients with the food they enjoy.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments and more

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras 2 Group

texts.es:
El Grupo las emprendedoras 2 está en su noveno ciclo gracias al trabajo que todas hacen, son mujeres muy capaces que demuestran las ganas que tienen de crecer por medio de su esfuerzo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Claudia quien cuenta que hace productos de limpieza, los cuales vende a sus vecinos y también a ocasionales clientes. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y todo el esfuerzo que hace es por ayudar a su familia a tener un mejor futuro.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de microfranquicia de productos de limpieza que ofrece la fundación, y de esa forma seguir haciendo sus productos de limpieza que son muy aceptados por sus clientes.
texts.en:
The "Las Emprendadoras 2" group is on its ninth loan cycle, thanks to the work all the women do.  They are all very capable and have shown a desire to progress through their own efforts.

One of the group's members is Claudia, who makes cleaning products that she sells to her neighbours and other customers.  She is a very hard-working person and all the effort she puts in is to help her family to have a better future.

She is applying for a loan to pay for the rights to a microfranchise for cleaning products that the foundation is offering.  Through this Claudia will be able to continue making the cleaning products that her customers so like.

loans.use: to pay for the rights to a microfranchise to make cleaning products.

loans.name: Zola 1 Group

texts.en:
Raphael, age 48, owns a cement depot where he sells cement to construction companies and individuals. He has run this business since 2008. As part of his business strategy, he runs a supplementary business selling drinks. If one business is slow, usually the other one carries him through the rough patch. 

He has five children between the ages 12 and 29 years old. The four younger children are currently attending school. 

Raphael is representing the Zola 1 group and is shown with his hand raised. He has received and repaid one loan from Kiva partner HOPE Congo and has a good repayment record. He will use his loan funds to buy more cement to replenish his stock. 

Raphael's goal is to start more businesses in the future and continue to diversify himself.

loans.use: to buy cement

loans.name: Aman

texts.en:
Aman, age 37, sells fashion slippers to earn an income. She started her venture 10 years ago with start-up money given to her by her boyfriend, and she learned the business from friends. 

As a single mother, Aman is glad for her business because it allows her to support her three children, who are between the ages of eight and 18 years old. All her children attend school and live at home. The family lives in Paynesville South, one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County.

Aman is requesting a loan in order to purchase more fashion slippers for her business. 

Her goal for the future is to build a house for the family.

loans.use: to purchase fashion slippers to offer for sale

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta earns a living through her hog-raising business. She lives with her family in the town of Loboc, Bohol. 

Vicenta needs a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and feed. With this loan, she will be able to improve her hog-raising business and make it sustainable. Vicenta hopes of expanding her business, so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feed.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El Sr. Jose es soltero, tiene 2 hijos pequeños que aún están cursando la escuela primaria, y por quienes se esfuerza para  sacarlos adelante. Él empezó trabajando con su papá como ayudante de un transporte escolar, luego tuvo que viajar a España, regreso hace cuatro años y logro montar un pequeña tienda de comidas, donde vende hamburguesas, lomitos y demás, que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación está funcionando muy bien.
Gracias al trabajo que está  realizando educa a sus hijos, y compra todas las necesidades que puedan llegar a tener. Jose desea seguir trabajando e invirtiendo en su trabajo para así poder tener los medios para ayudar a sus hijos, además comenta que con su trabajo también ayuda a dos familias dándoles empleo.
Solicita este crédito para utilizarlo en la compra de insumos para su local, como ser carne, huevos, etc. y también lo quiere invertir en la compra  de  mesas con sillas. Agradece por la a oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Jose is single and has 2 small children who are still in primary school, and he is dedicating his efforts to advance them. He began working with his father as an assistant on a school bus. Later, he had to travel to Spain.  He returned some 4 years ago and managed to open a small stand selling meals. He sells hamburgers, steaks, and more, and the business, due to his considerable effort, is doing very well. 

Thanks to his hard work, Jose is educating his children, and purchasing all the necessities that he could hope for. Jose wishes to continue working and investing in his work so that he can have the means to continue helping his children. In addition, he comments that through his labors, he also helps 2 other families by providing them with work.

Jose is soliciting this loan for use in buying merchandise for his stand, including meat, eggs, etc. Also, he wishes to invest in purchasing tables and chairs. He is grateful for the opportunity he is receiving, since it will be of so much help.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his stand, including meat, eggs, etc., and also, to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Las 18 integrantes de este grupo trabajan arduamente por poder crecer hacen actividades juntas para poder mejorar su compañerismo y también así poder tener un pequeño ahorro para poder afrontar cualquier inconveniente.
La Sra. Rosana es parte de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de plantas ya que tiene un vivero bien surtido con todo tipo de flores, árboles frutales, plantas ornamentales y demás. Comenta que tiene una muy variada clientela y que gracias a su trabajo a su familia no le falta nada.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de abonos, semillas, fertilizantes y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus ventas y dar a su clientela lo que busca.
texts.en:
The eighteen members of this group work hard in order to grow their businesses.  They work together to strengthen the cohesiveness of the group. By the same token they are able to put a little money into savings that they can use when the need arises.

Rosana is a member of this group.  She sells plants and has a nursery well-stocked with all types of flowers, fruit trees, ornamental plants and more.  She mentions that she has a diverse customer base and that thanks to her work her family has everything they need.

She is seeking this loan in order to buy fertilizer, seeds, compost and other supplies.  This will enable her to keep making sales and give her customers what they want.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, compost and other supplies.

loans.name: Cerafina

texts.es: Cerafina continua en el banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS y con la crianza de animales como gallinas, chanchos y cuyes.  En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes pero también alimento como pasto y alfalfa. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en: Cerafina continues to belong to the community bank “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS” [“Queen of the Angels of Urquillos”] and continues to work raising animals such as chickens, pigs and guinea pigs. She is requesting this loan to buy small animals such as guinea pigs and to buy feed such as hay and alfalfa. Cerafina has worked at this business for a number of years now, and she says it does well for her because of the effort and determination she puts into her work. She says that the loan makes her happy and she promises to comply with its payments.

loans.use: to buy small animals such as guinea pigs and to buy feed such as hay and alfalfa.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишер житель района Джиликуль, который расположился в южной части Хатлонской области Таджикистана. Ему 43 года. У него жена и двое детей. Алишер уже три года как занимается предоставлением услуги такси. Он возит пассажиров по маршруту района Дж.Руми-Джиликуль. Одновременно он занимается земледелием и животноводством. Алишер хочет отремонтировать свою машину, чтобы улучшить качество предоставляемой услуги. Поэтому он обратился за кредитом. Алишер берет кредит для приобретения запчастей и покрышек с целью ремонта своей автомашины.
texts.en: Alisher lives in the Jilikul region, which is in the southern part of Tajikistan's Khaltonskaya region.  He is 43 years old and he has two children.  For three years, Alisher has been working as a taxi driver.  He drives passengers on a route through the region of Rumi-Jilikul.  He also works raising crops and animals.  Alisher wants to make repairs to his car, so he can improve the quality of his services, which is why he has applied for a loan.  He is asking for a loan to buy auto parts and tires to make repairs on his car.

loans.use: to buy auto parts and tires to repair his car.

loans.name: Aljmaia Alhadhrmia Group

texts.en: This group is called Aljmaia Alhadhrmia. This group consists of two ladies and one man, who live in Aden, Yemen. Dhakra is the group's president. The members have developed business activities and applied for a loan of 140,000 YER. Dhakra is a 28-year-old, married woman, and she has one child. She currently has a business selling perfumes and cosmetic materials. She learned the trade and has been in this line work for many years. The loan of 40,000 YER from AMB she is receiving now (as her part of the group loan) will be used to increase her capital by buying perfumes and cosmetic materials. These items will eventually be sold from her retail space. Working in this manner allows her to help her family move forward.

loans.use: to increase her capital by buying perfumes and cosmetic materials.

loans.name: Zola 2 Group

texts.en:
Brigitte, age 51, is married and has two children, ages 17 and 21 years. They are both attending school now. She is representing the Zola 2 group. Brigitte buys squash seeds, pays for someone to plant and harvest them, and then sells the squash in a local market. She has had this business for 10 years. Essentially she is her own squash supplier.

She will use the loan to buy squash seeds with which to begin another crop. Her business strategy is to sell a lot of squash at the time of harvest. Brigitte has received one previous loan from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. She has a good repayment record. Her goal is to open a restaurant and bakery in the future.

loans.use: to pay for squash seeds.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Esi did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Even at 60 years of age, Esi still prepares and sells kenkey, which is a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and wrapped in banana leaves. She operates her business in Emissa Kro, near Cape Coast, and has been doing so for about two years. As a single woman, Esi uses all her income to support herself.
