Esi will use the loan to purchase an increased quantity of maize, which will help her to produce more of her tasty kenkey. 

Esi intends to use the expected profits from her expanded business to develop her kenkey enterprise further and be able to save for a rainy day.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of maize so that she can prepare and sell more of her tasty kenkey

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy, age 30, earns an income by selling palm oil at the local market. She has been engaged in this business for the past three years, and she has been able to make a profit and attract regular customers.

Mercy lives with her husband, who runs his own business, and their two children in the Paynesville South area, which is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County. The children are five and 11 years old. They are both enrolled in school and live at home.

Mercy is requesting a loan in order to purchase more palm oil for her business.

Her goal is eventually to build a house for the family.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil to offer for sale

loans.name: Nueva Estrella Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Nueva Estrella está en su ciclo número 1, donde cada una trabaja y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 11  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, y están poniendo todo de si para mejorar sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Silvia, quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, por esto es que ella se esta esforzando el doble por ayudar a su familia. Cuenta Silvia que se dedica a la venta ambulante de prendas, sabanas, frazadas y demás, y de esta forma está tratando de mejorar sus vidas. Ella es consciente que esforzándose es la única forma en la que podrá mejorar su vida y la de su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de ropas, como ser pantalones, camisas, remeras, camisillas y demás. Con eso podrá invertir en su negocio, lo que le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group is called "Nueva Estrella" and is on its first loan cycle.  Everyone in the groups works hard and helps each other to move forward.  They are currently undertaking the poverty elimination survey and 11 of the members are living under the poverty line.  They are all putting in everything they have to improve their lives.

One of the group's members is Silvia who, at the last survey, was on level one of the poverty scale and so she is working twice as hard in order to help her family.  Silvia tells us that she is a street vendor, selling, clothes, bed sheets, blankets and other items and through this work she is trying to improve her and her family's lives.  Silvia knows that only with a lot of effort will she be able to improve their lives.

She is applying for this loan to buy clothes, such as trousers, shirts, tank-tops, t-shirts and more.  With this she will be able to invest in her business and this will help increase her income.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts, tank-tops, t-shirts and more.

loans.name: Ruvicha Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Ruvicha  está creciendo y gracias al trabajo de sus integrantes ya están en su sexto ciclo. Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rosa, quien es la presidenta de este grupo. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y que siempre se ha esforzado para ayudar a su familia.
Rosa tiene como tarea poder guiar a sus compañeras y que estas no se desanimen en miras a cumplir con su meta. Ella vende comestibles y cuenta que gracias a que todo le sale muy rico está creciendo y le va bien. Su sueño es poder tener un puesto de comidas para poder seguir haciendo los comestibles que vende.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para hacer sus alimentos, como ser carnes, pollo, jamón, queso, condimentos y demás, ya que son los que más usa pata poder hacer sus comidas.
texts.en:
The Ruvicha group is growing and they're in their sixth loan cycle, thanks to the work of the members.

One of the members is Rosa, the president of the group.  She's a very hardworking person who has always made the effort to help her family.  Rosa's task is to be able to lead her colleagues so they don't get discouraged when carrying out their goals.

She sells food, and she says she's growing and it's going well for her because everything she makes comes out delicious.  Her dream is to be able to have a food stand to continue making the food she sells.

She's requesting this loan to buy the supplies she uses the most to make her dishes, such as meat, chicken, ham, cheese, condiments, and others.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, ham, cheese, condiments, and other supplies

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Renacer está en su ciclo 14, y todas ellas demuestran que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, son 16 mujeres muy trabajadoras, que vieron una gran oportunidad para ella y sus familias en el programa de la fundación.
La Sra. Isabel es la presidenta del comité, ella hace muchos años tiene una cantina ubicada dentro de una escuelita, allí ofrece a los alumnos minutas, golosinas, helados, gaseosas entre otros, y es gracias a su negocio que tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia. Ella es muy trabajadora y tiene muchas ansias de crecer y salir adelante. 
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de golosinas, lácteos, insumos para hacer sus minutas y demás. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que le ayuda no solo a ella, sino también a su familia, quienes dependen de ella.
texts.en:
The group called Renacer is in its 14th cycle and all of them demonstrate that they want to work and get ahead. They are 16 very hardworking women who saw a great opportunity for them and their families in Fundación’s program. 

Isabel is the president of the committee. For many years she has had a small cafe located in a little school, selling  short-order food to the students, sweets, ice cream, and sodas among others and it is thanks to her business that she has the means to help her family. She is very hardworking and has many yearnings to grow and get ahead.

She is asking for this loan to buy sweets, dairy products, and supplies to make her fast food and more. She is thankful for the opportunity that she is receiving as it helps not only her, but also her family, who depend on her.

loans.use: to buy sweets, dairy products, and supplies to make her fast food and more

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel de 31 años de edad vive con su esposa y la vivienda donde residen es alquilada, su nivel educativo es bachillerato, se dedica a la elaboracion de hamacas desde hace varios años tambien tiene un pizzeria desde hace 15 años es reconocido como una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta solicita credito para comprar materia prima y poder seguir elaborando sus hamacas con la ayuda de su esposa y asi poder solventar los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Daniel is 31 years old and lives with his wife. The home they live in is rented and he has a high school education. He has made a living by making hammocks for various years. He has also had a pizzeria for 15 years. 

He is known as a responsible, hard-working and honest person. He asks for a loan to buy raw material so that he can keep making hammocks with the help of his wife and thus cover their living expenses.

loans.use: to buy raw material

loans.name: Annie G.

texts.en: Annie lives in Paynesville South, one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County. She is 46 years old, unmarried, and has nine children between the ages of 27 and 31 years old. Her children are currently in college and living on their own. For the past ten years she has been selling soft drinks in the market. She started this business with a little amount received from her fiancee. Annie says she enjoys the buying from her customers and the money that she generates from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase a greater quantity of soft drinks, to enlarge her business. She plans to build a house one day.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, to enlarge her business,

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy, age 42, sells soft drinks at the local market to earn an income. She has operated her business for the past 13 years. During that time, she has made her business profitable and has attracted many customers. She works nine hours per day.

Nancy is a single mother. She lives with her two children, ages 15 and 19, in the Paynesville South area, which is one of the populated areas of Montserrado County. Both children are enrolled in school and live at home.

Nancy is requesting a loan in order to purchase more soft drinks for her business. 

Her goals are to build a house and to ensure the continued education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks to offer for sale

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is married and has two children.  Even though she grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Aba sells limes in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast), which she has been doing for 10 years. Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began. 

Aba has identified that there are growing demands among consumers’ for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more bags of lime to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba wants to ensure that her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of lime to sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Ekua did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Ekua sells fried doughnuts in Emissakrom, near Cape Coast. She has been engaged in this business for about five years. 

As a divorcée with four children, Ekua uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Ekua will use the loan to purchase an increased quantity of flour, sugar, and cooking oil. This investment will aid her in improving her overall sales by being able to prepare more doughnuts to offer for sale. 

Ekua intends to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of flour, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 48 years old and a charcoal seller. She resides at Dansoman. She joined ID Ghana in 2007, when she was in need of capital to expand her business. She has been in the charcoal trade for the past six years and is still doing very excellent business in the Dansoman community. She is hardworking and industrious.
 
This is her 12th loan, and she needs a loan in the amount of GHS 1,500. She will use it to buy more charcoal, to meet her customers' demand.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Macutzio Group

texts.es: Llenmi es madre de dos niños pequeños, y es parte de un grupo llamado Macutzio, dice que le pusieron ese nombre porque asi se llama una comunidad del estado de Michoacán. Esta es la primera vez que sacan un crédito ella y las otras cuatro integrantes y que abrieron el grupo porque una amiga le recomendó trabajar con VisionFund México para mejorar sus negocios, dice que ella desde hace 6 años se dedica al cultivo de flores de ornato y hiervas de olor y que las vende en su localidad y también se va a vender a la central de abastos de la población de Zitacuaro y en la temporada de invierno para ella es la temporada alta ya que también vende flores de noche buena. Dice que ella está pidiendo un crédito para comprar semilla y maceta ya que quiere hacer crecer su negocio, ella dice “donde vendo mas mis flores y mis plantitas es en las rancherías ya que la gente es mas cuidadosas con este tipo de flores”, dice que ella espera que le vaya bien en la venta ya  que así podrá darle a sus niños una mejor calidad de vida, agradece a VisionFund por hacerle el préstamo. Las demás integrantes del grupo se llaman Maria Luisa, Martha, Maria de Lourdes y Elizabeth ellas invertirán en sus negocios de bordado de prendas artesanales, en la compra y venta de frutas y legumbres de temporada.
texts.en: Llenmi is the mother of two small children, and she is part of the Macutzio group. She says that they call it that because it is the name of a town in the state of Michoacán. This is the first time that she and the other four group members are taking out a loan. They started the group because a friend recommended that they work with VisionFund México to improve their businesses. She says that for the past six years, she has sold decorative flowers and fragrant herbs. She sells them in her town and also goes to the central market in Zitacuaro to sell them. Winter is a very busy season for her because she sells Christmas Eve flowers. She says that she is asking for a loan to buy seeds and flowerpots, because she wants to expand her business. She says "The small, rural towns are where I sell the most flowers and plants, because people are more careful with that kind of flower." She says that she hopes sales are good so that she can give her children a better quality of life. She is thankful to VisionFund for the loan. The other group members are Maria Luisa, Martha, Maria de Lourdes, and Elizabeth. They will invest in their businesses: embroidering artisan garments,and buying and selling seasonal fruits and legumes.

loans.use: to buy flowerpots, seeds, and fertilizer to grow decorative flowers.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es: Felicitas pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS“, ella tiene 40 años edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de chicha y tiene una pequeña picantería donde expende la bebida(Chicha). En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar jora. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en: Felicitas belongs to the community bank “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS” [“Queen of the Angels of Urquillos”]. She is 40 years old and is in a common law marriage with five children. She works selling chicha [an alcoholic drink made from fermented maize] and she has a small restaurant from which she also sells chicha. She is requesting this loan to buy fermented maize. Felicitas has worked at this business for a number of years now, and she says it does well for her because of the effort and determination she puts into her work. She says that the loan makes her happy and she promises to comply with its payments.

loans.use: to buy fermented maize.

loans.name: Miatta D.

texts.en:
Miatta is 32 years old and lives in Paynesville South, one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. She is unmarried and has two children, who were born on the same day, ages 12 and 12. They are currently in school and live at home. Since 2012, Miatta has been selling cosmetics in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has more customers. She spends eight hours on her business, and most of the time she uses taxis to get to her business at her selling-table. 

Miatta is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more cosmetics for her business. Her plans are to build a house, expand her business, and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics to sell at her business

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Ama is an entrepreneur with multiple businesses. She sells used clothing and also prepares and sells gari, a traditional Ghanaian snack better known to the rest of the world as cuscus. She operates these businesses in Emissakrom, near Cape Coast, and has been involved in both enterprises for about four years. 

Ama and her husband, who is a farmer, have five children. The proceeds from her businesses go toward helping her husband to cover the family’s general expenses and to pay their children’s school fees. 

Ama plans to use her loan funds to increase her current inventory levels of both clothing items and gari ingredients, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of both used clothing and gari. 

In the long term, Ama plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to buy clothing items and gari ingredients

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, age 32, has applied for his fourth loan after successfully repaying his previous loan. He is in need of farm inputs like fertilizers and also wants to buy sheep to add to his livestock.

His goals for the future are to improve the living standards of his family and to ensure the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and sheep

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: Rubén pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS“, él tiene22 años edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, él tiene un bar y restaurante y tambien se dedica a brindar servicio de transportes. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para implementar el restaurante desea comprar sillas y mesas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en: Rubén belongs to the community bank “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS” [“Queen of the Angels of Urquillos”]. He is 22 years old and is in a common law marriage with two children. He has a bar and a restaurant, and he also works providing transportation services. He is requesting this loan to furnish his restaurant, for which he would like to buy tables and chairs. Rubén has worked at this business for a number of years now, and he says it does well for him because of the effort and determination he puts into his work. He says that the loan makes him happy and he promises to comply with its payments.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Vincentia

texts.en:
Vincentia is a 39-year-old seller of provisions (e.g., sugar, rice, milo, bread, milk, toffee, canned tomatoes). She resides in the Dansoman community. She has been in business for the past five years and is still doing very well. She is very good and discreet when it comes to her business. 

This is her fourth loan, and she needs to borrow GHS 1,400. She will use it to expand her business, buying more goods to enable her to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell to her customers, like sugar, rice, milo, bread, milk, toffee, and canned tomatoes

loans.name: Jannet

texts.en:
Jannet, age 34, is a coal vendor, selling coal at the local market to earn an income. She has been engaged in her business for the past eight years. During that time, she has made her business profitable and has gained many regular customers.

Jannet lives with her husband and their four children in the Paynesville South area, one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County. Her husband is a farmer. The children, aged between nine and 13 years old, live at home and are enrolled in school.

Jannet is requesting a loan in order to purchase more bags of charcoal for her business.

Her goals are to build a house for the family and to ensure the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal to offer for sale

loans.name: Essoyomewè

texts.fr: Revendeuse de boissons au marché depuis 2008, essoyomewè  sollicite son second crédit pour le renforcement de son activité. Elle est âgée de 27ans, célibataire et sans enfant. Elle espère assurer ses moindres besoins tout en rendant pérenne son activité.
texts.en: She has been a drinks saleswoman at the market since 2008, and now Essoyomewè requests her second loan to strengthen her business. She is 27 years old, single and has no children. She hopes to provide for her modest needs at the same time as making her business durable.

loans.use: To buy drinks.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS y se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas y también a la venta de verduras. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar verduras como cebollas, zanahorias, lechugas, alverjitas, habas, tomates y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en: Maritza belongs to the "Reyna de los Angeles de Urquillos" community bank and makes a living raising small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens and selling vegetables. On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy produce such as onions, carrots, lettuces, peas, beans, tomatoes and others. She has been in this business for several years and it is going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Maritza is happy about the loan and is committed to making her repayments.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as onions, carrots, lettuces, peas, beans, tomatoes and others.

loans.name: Gogi

texts.en:
Gogi is 58 years old. He lives in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia, with his wife, son and grandson. Gogi requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Nowadays, the family is out of source. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Gogi requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to the country’s rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Gogi will modify his car to use natural gas. He plans to serve local people as a taxi driver with his car. As natural gas is much cheaper than other kinds of fuel, he decided on the installation of it. This will decrease the costs, and the income of the family will gradually increase. 

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to modify his car to use natural gas and start working as a taxi driver.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia, age 45, is a farmer. She lives with her husband and their three children, who are between the ages of 11 and 18 years old, in Ndunyu Njeru.

Emilia has applied for her first loan from KADET Ltd. She requested the loan in order to enable herself to buy fertilizers and maize seedlings to use on her farm. She is optimistic that her business will do better as a result of receiving this loan.

She hopes to see her business expand in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and maize seedlings

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria, age 52, sells diapers and soft drinks to earn a living. The beverages she offers include Coca-Cola, Fanta, Sprite, Malta Guinness, and fruit drinks. She has been engaged in this business for the past six years and is doing very well. Her business is located in the Mpoase community in Dansoman. She is a very dedicated and hard-working individual.

Victoria joined ID Ghana in 2008 after hearing about it from another beneficiary of the organization. She has since borrowed and repaid 12 loans. She has been able to repay all her loans on time and without default. 

She is now applying for her thirteenth loan. She has requested GHS 1,500 in order to buy more diapers and soft drinks to offer for sale to her customers.

loans.use: to buy diapers and soft drinks to offer for sale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 54 years old and lives in Paynesville, one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. She is married and has 4 children between the ages of 23 to 33 years old, they all live on their own and only two attend school. She was unfortunately unable to attend school, but she is good at managing her business. Her husband is a businessman. 

For the past three years she has been selling dry fish in the local market, now she faces no problems, she sells every day and spends 9 hours with her business. She started this business with a little income she received from her husband. For her mother, she is requesting a loan to purchase more dry fish for her business. She hopes to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more dry fish for her business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther sells rice, beans and salted fish in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been educated till the end of junior secondary school.  She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a mason. Esther has been working in this enterprise for 8 years now. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to increase her current stock levels. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her rice, beans and fish selling enterprise and increase her capital base. In the long run she wants to expand her business into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of rice, beans and salted fish to sell

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: Irene  continúa en el banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS” y la elaboración de artesanía y continua llevando sus productos al poblado de Pisac, Ollantaytambo y otras ciudades, ella continua realizando mantas muñecas, pantalones, chompas, porta lapiceros entre otros pequeños trabajos. Ella también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como gallinas y pollos. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar comida para pollos.  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en: Irene is still a member of the Reyna de Los Angelos de Urquillos Communal Bank and makes handicrafts, which she takes to Pisac, Ollantaytambo and other cities. She continues to make blankets, dolls, pants, sweaters, pencil holders, and other small items.She also makes a living raising small animals such as chickens. On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy chicken feed. She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her repayments.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua prepares and sells both banku & accra kenkey, (two traditional Ghanaian staple dishes made primarily from cassava and maize, respectively). Normally, she can be found selling in the town of Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been involved with this business for the past five years. Her husband is a farmer. Efua uses her income to help her husband pay for the general household expenses. 

Efua will use the loan to purchase more maize and cassava, which will help her prepare more banku and kenkey to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to continue to support her husband in providing for themselves.

loans.use: to purchase more maize and cassava, which will help her prepare more banku and kenkey to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 41-year-old mother from Kakamega County, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married to James, who is a farmer, and she is blessed with three children who are 18, 16 and 10 years old.

She sells secondhand clothes, a business she has been doing for the last seven years, and makes a monthly income of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). She is applying for her third loan with KADET Ltd., which she will use to purchase more bales of secondhand clothes. She will put the anticipated profits back into the business.

She has a dream of becoming a successful business lady and also to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes

loans.name: Aloyce

texts.en:
Aloyce is 31 years old, from Nakuru, and is married with a child who is one and a half years old.

Aloyce has a welding business and has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to allow him buy some welding machines to enable him work better.

He hopes to see his business expand in the near future and be able to buy a piece of land which he will use to build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy welding machines

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba earns an income by preparing and selling "banku," a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn or cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth, whitish, consistent paste. She normally sells her banku in Emissakrom, near Cape Coast, where she lives with her husband and their three children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Araba has been engaged in her business for about six years, and she uses her income to help her husband to support the family's basic expenses and to pay the children's school fees. Araba has had some form of formal education as she is a junior secondary school graduate, and she is determined to ensure that all her children receive an education.

She plans on using her loan funds to purchase an increased quantity of cassava and maize, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand. 

She intends to use the expected profits from her enterprise to develop her business further and to support her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of cassava and maize

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi est une jeune dame de 29ans. Elle est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants en charge. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente des pagnes. Son premier crédit lui permet de s’approvisionner en marchandises. Comme perspectives d’avenir, elle espère devenir grossiste et se marier plus tard.
texts.en: Akouvi is a young woman of 29. She is single and does not have children. As an income generating activity she sells textiles (traditional cloth). Her first loan will enable her to buy merchandise. For the future, she hopes to become a wholesaler and subsequently to get married.

loans.use: To buy fabrics.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 53 años de edad es una mujer alegre. Vive desde hace 25 años en la casa de sus padres, junto a su esposo Aquiles y sus 4 hijos.  Su principal ingreso económico se centra en la crianza de vacas, actualmente cuenta con 5 ejemplares. Comenzó hace algunos años solo con una vaca, ahí aprendió que tenía que cuidarlas muy bien para que produzcan buena leche, tenía que sembrar ella misma el pasto que comen, además de alimentarlas para que den buena leche, poco a poco fue comprando una por una, de acuerdo a sus ahorros y su ganancia. Ahora sus 5 vacas le producen 12 litros de leche; cada una. Comenta que  una parte de ellas las comercializa a la empresa procesadora de leche en tarro y la otra parte lo utiliza para la elaboración de queso, que comercializa a sus vecinos, quienes compran todos los días. Ahora María, sueña con poseer más ganando, y de esa manera obtener más ganancias.Este es el segundo crédito con KIVA, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues agradece el apoyo financiero que le ayuda a mejorar sus sembríos .María invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos de alfalfa, ya que de esto se alimentan sus vacas.
texts.en:
María is 53 years old and is a happy woman. For 25 years she has lived in her parents' house with her husband Aquiles and their 4 children. Her primary financial income is centered around raising cattle. Currently she has 5 cows. 

A few years ago she got started with just one cow. From there she learned that she had to care for the cows well so that they produce good milk. She had to plant the grass that they eat herself. In addition to feeding them well so that they give good milk, little by little she has been buying cows one by one, as permitted by her savings and her earnings.

Her 5 cows now produce 12 liters of milk each. She says that she sells part of the milk to the milk processing company in Tarro and she uses the other part to make cheese. She sells this cheese to her neighbors, who buy from her every day. María now dreams of possessing more cows and thus having greater earnings. 

This is her second loan with Kiva. She promises to be punctual with her payments, as she is grateful for the financial support that helps her improve her crops. María will invest the 1,000 Peruvian nuevos soles in buying organic fertilizer to nurture her alfalfa crops, as her cows eat the alfalfa.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Abdulbaqy

texts.en:
Abdulbaqy is a 35-year-old married man who lives in Taiz, Yemen with his family. He makes a living managing his restaurant, where he offers a variety of food. He is a very successful entrepreneur and skilled person who has ten years' experience in this business and has some regular customers who give excellent references. 

His biggest dream is to improve his and his family's quality of life. Day by day, he thinks of ways to make his business grow, as it is his main source of income and this is the only way he can improve his and his family's living conditions. 

Because of this, he has made the decision to request a loan of 200,000 Yemeni Rials (YER) from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank to invest in his business by buying food products, such as eggs, rice, beans, flour, oil and soft drinks. He fully trusts in God and that his work will produce favorable results in order to fulfill his dream.

loans.use: to invest in his business by buying food products, such as eggs, rice, beans, flour, oil and soft drinks.

loans.name: Amoussou

texts.fr: Jeune célibataire sans enfant, Amoussou pour subvenir à ses besoins revend depuis 2011 des accessoires de portables et des portables dans un baraque à Lomé. Il s’approvisionne chez les grossistes venus de la CHINE. Afin de réinvestir dans son activité et se lancer dans la vie maritale, Amoussou sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des portables. Le profit tiré de la vente lui permettra d’atteindre ses objectifs.
texts.en: Amoussou is a young bachelor without any children. To support himself, he has been selling mobile phones and mobile accessories in a shack in Lome since 2011. He buys his stock from wholesalers coming from China. In order to reinvest in his business and prepare for married life, Amoussou requests a first loan from Wages to buy mobile phones. The profit he will make from selling them will enable him to reach his goals.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones and their accessories.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es: Natalia, de 54 años de edad es una mujer alegre y feliz. Vive en compañía de su esposo Bernardino con quien tiene 2 hijos mayores e independientes ,ahora ellos viven solos en la casa que compraron hace 30 años. Natalia se dedica al servicio de copias, impresiones y llamadas telefónicas a diversos lugares del país y el extranjero. Tiene 12 años dedicándose a este negocio, “fui la primera en brindar este servicio innovador, pues en el pueblo soy la única, no tengo competencia”, afirma muy alegre. Además de sentir el apoyo de su esposo quien siempre se encuentra actualizándose en las herramientas tecnológicas, es así que ahora está pensando en comprar una impresora para poder hacer servicios de impresión mediante la computadora y otros trabajos que requieran. Se encuentra segura de poder mejorar sus ingresos pues ya muchos clientes solicitan la impresión de documentos, ya que su negocio se ubica en la plaza del pueblo, donde se encuentra la zona comercial.Este es el primer crédito con KIVA, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues agradece el apoyo financiero que le ayuda a mejorar sus ingresos .Natalia, invertirá los S/.4000 soles en la compra de una máquina impresora de papeles y una fotocopiadora más, para poder mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Natalia is 54 years old and is a  cheerful, happy lady. She lives with her husband Bernardino, with whom she has two grown-up, independent children. They now live on their own in the home they bought 30 years ago. Natalia makes a living making copies, prints, and telephone calls to different places nationally and internationally. She has been in this business for 12 years, and says happily, “I was the first to offer this innovative service, and I'm the only one in the town who does, I don't have any competition”. In addition, she enjoys the support of her husband, who is always getting to grips with the latest technological tools. For this reason, she now wants to buy a printer to provide printing services with the computer and other jobs she requires. 

She is certain she can increase her profits as many already customers ask for documents to be printed, and her business is located in the town square, in the commercial district.

This is her first loan with Kiva, she promises to make her loan repayments on time and is grateful for the financial help that is helping her to boost her profits. Natalia will invest the 4000 soles in buying another photocopier and printer in order to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy a printer and photocopier.

loans.name: Maria Cleofe

texts.es: Maria Cleofe continúa en el banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS” y con la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, pan, gaseosas, condimentos, sal y otras cosas más. Ella también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, pollos y gallinas. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar comida para pollos.  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en: Maria Cleofe is still a member of the Reyna de los Angeles de Urquillos Community Bank, and sells basic items such as rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, bread, soda, condiments, salt and other products. She also makes a living raising small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy chicken feed. She is grateful for the loan and promises to meet her loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Гулчехре 40 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Ее муж таксист. Дети Гулчехры еще не совершеннолетние. Гулчехра хорошая жена, мать. Она имеет древнее ремесло таджикских женщин, то есть шитье женских одежд. Она всегда шила одежды своим детям, близким и родным, и теперь она планирует воплотить свое ремесло в бизнес. Она обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и научилась, как создать бизнес. Она будет предоставлять услуги портнихи у себя дома. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Gulchehra is 40 years old. She is married and raising two children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Gulchehra's children are still not adults. 

Gulchehra is a good wife and mother. She knows the ancient craft of the Tajik women, which is to sew women's clothing. She always sewed clothing for her children, friends and relatives, and currently she plans to make her craft into a business. She attended the training "To get ahead", organized by the Association of Business Women, and learned how to establish a business. She will offer dressmaking services at her home. 

She requests a loan in the amount of 2,000 somoni for the purchase of a sewing machine. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for setting up a new business

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Afin d’acheter des ignames et des céréales madame Adjo sollicite son quatrième crédit à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises. Elle exerce son activité depuis 2003 et a pour mari un revendeur. Ils sont bénis de DIEU et ont 04 enfants dont 03 à l’école. L’ainé a 16 et le dernier 06ans. Elle espère devenir grossiste et contribuer à l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en: In order to buy  yams and cereals, Madam Adjo requests a fourth loan from Wages for the purchase of stock. She has been running her business since 2003 and is married to a reseller. God has  blessed  them with four children of which three go to school. The oldest is 16 and the youngest six years old. She hopes to become a wholesaler and to contribute to the fulfilment  of  her family.

loans.use: To buy yams and cereals.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es: Clotilde continua con el banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS y con la venta de verduras y la crianza de animales como gallinas, chanchos y cuyes ,ella tambien continua con la pequeña tienda de venta de comestibles. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar verdura como cebollas, zanahorias, repollo, lechuga y otras cosas más.   Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Clotilde is still with the "Reyna de los Angeles de Urquillos" communal bank and is still selling vegetables and raising animals like hens, pigs and guinea pigs. She also still has her small grocery store. 

At this time she needs the loan to buy vegetables like onions, carrots, cabbage, lettuce and other things. She has made a living from this business for many years and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. The partner is happy with the loan and is committed to complying with the payments.

loans.use: to buy vegetables like onions, carrots, cabbage, lettuce and other things

loans.name: Santos Sofia

texts.es: Doña Sofia de 55 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, es una persona trabajadora y responsable con sus obligaciones se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tamales en su lugar de residencia y con lo que saca de sus ganancias solventa algunos gastos de su hogar con la ayuda de su esposo, Doña Sofia solicita un credito para comprar mas materiales(hojas para tamales, maiz, verdura, etc) para la elaboracion de dicha venta y seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en: Sofia is 55 years old and lives with her husband and three children. She is a hard-working and responsible individual. She works making and selling tamales, a traditional corn-based food wrapped in a leaf. She does this at home, and uses her earnings to pay some household expenses and help her husband. Sofia is requesting a loan to buy more materials (leaves for the tamales, corn, vegetables, etc.) to make this food and continue supporting her family.

loans.use: with working capital.

loans.name: Mukaddamkhon

texts.ru: Мукаддамхон молодая и добрая женщина. Ей 21 года. Она не замужем и не имеет детей. Мукаддамхон выросла на сельской местности и с детства упорно работала на поле. Она научилась у портнихи  шить женские одежды и теперь хочет организовать свой бизнес шитьем женской одежды. Она обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 500 сомони для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mukaddamkhon is a young and good woman. She is 21 years old. She is not married and does not have children. Mukaddamkhon grew up in a rural area and since childhood worked hard in the field. She learned to sew women's clothing from a dressmaker, and currently would like to set up her business of sewing women's clothing. 

Mukaddamkhon attended the course "To get ahead", organized by the Association of Business Women, and received a certificate. She requests a loan in the amount of 500 somoni for the purchase of a sewing machine. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for setting up a new business

loans.name: Robiya

texts.ru: Робия женщина с прекрасной душой и добрым сердцем. Ей 57 года. Она вдова и имеет 6 детей и 5 внуков. Несмотря на свой возраст, она энергичная и старается к новшеству. Она работает в местном управлении своего района и получает маленькую зарплату. Она хочет организовать свой бизнес купле продажей скота и таким образом найти источник дополнительного дохода. Из полученного дохода она хочет улучшить условию проживания и купить своим внукам новые технологии. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 долларов США для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Robiya is a woman with a beautiful soul and a good heart. She is 57 years old. She is a widow and has six children and five grandchildren. Despite her age, she is energetic and strives for innovation. She works in the local government of her region, and receives a small pay. 

Robiya would like to set up a business of buying and reselling livestock and this way find a source for an additional income. From the income received she would like to improve her living conditions and buy new technology for her grandchildren. She requests a loan in the amount of 2,000 US dollar for the purchase of livestock. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for setting up a new business

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita runs a sari-sari or variety store business in her place in Loboc, Bohol. She has been engaged in the business for more than nine years now. Tita works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family.

Tita is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy additional groceries to sell like canned goods, rice, biscuits and snack foods, soda and beverages.

In the future, Tita dreams of expanding her store so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell like canned goods, rice, biscuits and snack foods, soda and beverages.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is 61 years old. He lives in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia, with his wife and daughter. Solomon requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is Solomon’s daughter’s monthly income. She works as a nurse at a local hospital. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Solomon requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to the country’s rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Solomon will purchase a car and start working as a taxi driver. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start working as a taxi driver.

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.ru: Гулнозе 25 лет. Она за мужем, но не имеет детей. Гулноза более 3 лет работает в мелькомбинате. Она очень честная и трудолюбивая женщина. Ее сестра скоро выходит замуж, но ее родители не имеют денег для проведения свадебного мероприятия. Они надеяться на помощь Гулнозы. Гулноза тратит свою зарплату для покупки продуктов питания и остальных не обходимых средства для проживания. Она очень хочет помочь своим родителям и сестре и поэтому она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для проведения свадебного мероприятия. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Gulnoza is 25 years old. She is married, but does not have any children. Gulnoza has worked at a flour mill for more than three years. She is a very honest and hardworking woman. Her sister is getting married, but their parents do not have money for holding a wedding celebration. They need Gulnoza's help. 

Gulnoza uses her salary to purchase food products and the remaining money is needed for living expenses. She would very much like to help her parents and sister and therefore she requests a loan in the amount of 1,500 somoni for holding a wedding party. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To hold a wedding party for her lovely sister

loans.name: Manase Lemi

texts.en:
Manase Lemi is a 48-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He has five children between the ages of 4 and 20.

Manase Lemi runs a general store and has been in business for the last ten years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through other clients, and he is taking a 3,500 SSP loan to purchase maize flour, sugar, and many other items. 

In five years, Manase Lemi would like to expand his business and open other branches. His main challenges include high transportation costs. Manase Lemi says he is happy for the loans given to him by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like maize flour, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is 53 years old and lives in Paynesville, which is one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. She is married, and her husband is a plumber. Both of them have four children between 18 and 28 years old. They are currently in school, and only two live at home.

For the past twenty-three years, Viola has been selling rice, oil, pepper, beans, Vita (juice drink), onions, etc. in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has many customers. 

Viola is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, beans, Vita, onions, etc. for her business. Her plans are to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, beans, Vita, onions, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a 35-year-old, second-hand clothing seller. She is married to Richard, a 42-year-old driver. They have three children. 

In 2012, Diana needed to expand her business and, through a friend, she was introduced to ID Ghana. She has been doing her business for the past six years. She is a hard-working, industrious, and committed individual, ready to go the extra mile. 

This is her third loan and she needs GHS 700 to buy second-hand clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 48 years old and married, with six children who are all in school.

Peter has been in farming activity, and the business is doing well. He has applied for a loan of KES 65,000 from KADET LTD to enable him to buy iron sheets for roofing his brick house, and also to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

He hopes to be self-sufficient financially in the near future.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets, fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is happy that his previous loan helped him a lot in getting another place for his quarry business. He was able to run his business well and got a lot of profit.

Henry is applying for another loan to enable him to buy more stones to use in the quarry, and also to be able to pay for labor. He is optimistic that his business will do better after the loan. 

He hopes to build a permanent house in the near future.

loans.use: to buy stones to use in the quarry.

loans.name: Kiwissa 2 (1) Group

texts.en:
Marie, age 46, is single, with two children, ages 12 and 20. They are both attending school. 

She is representing the Kiwissa 2 (1) Group. Marie owns a restaurant that she has operated for three years. She will use the loan to buy food and drinks to serve in her restaurant. Her business strategy is to offer quick and friendly customer service. 

Marie has received three previous loans from HOPE Congo S.A., Kiva's partner, and she has a good payment record. 

In the future, she would like to open a hotel. She hopes her children will succeed and be happy in life.

loans.use: to buy food and drinks for her restaurant.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocio continua con el banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS” y con el negocio de panadería, restaurante y bar. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para implementar el restaurante pues desea comprar sillas y mesas.  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rocio is continuing her participation in the communal bank "Reyna de Los Angeles de Urquillos" and continues to run her bakery, restaurant and bar.  She has had this business for many years, and things are going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  

She is currently seeking a loan to purchase tables and chairs for her restaurant.  She is grateful for this opportunity and promises to repay her loan on schedule.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Nemesio De Jesus

texts.es: Don Nemesio, habita junto a su esposa quien se encarga del orden del hogar, hoy en día sus esfuerzos han valido la pena, sus hijos ahora son independientes y ayudan a sus padres, la mayor parte de los ingresos de don Nemesio como conductor son para continuar con la construcción de su casa que aún le falta puertas, verjas y embaldosar el piso, terminando con estos últimos detalles se sentirá mejor y le llena de alegría ya que es un gran logro para él y la familia vivir en buenas condiciones, es por eso que acude a solicitar un octavo crédito con la esperanza de poder cubrir todos estos gastos de un solo.
texts.en:
Nemesio lives with his wife, who is in charge of keeping the household in order.  His past work has been worth the effort, as his children are now independent and helping their parents.

The majority of his income as a driver goes toward the construction of his home, which still does not have doors, steel gates or tile flooring.  When he finishes these final details he will feel better. He will be full of joy since this is a great achievement -- he and his family will be able to live under good conditions.

For this reason he is seeking his eighth loan.  He hopes to be able to cover all of these expenses with this loan.

loans.use: to buy steel gates, cement, sand and concrete blocks.

loans.name: Martha Beatriz

texts.es:
Martha tiene 30 años de edad estado civil madre soltera vive con su familia vive en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

La V.R.C Mushuc Pakari está conformada por 10 socios se dedica a la agricultura a 40 minutos de la oficina.

Martha se dedica a vender papas y queso. Se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de papas, habas, avena y queso. Además se dedica a la crianza de animales como son vacas, cerdos. Utilizara el dinero del crédito para comprar fertilizantes, vacuna apara los cerdos, polvillos. 

Con el crédito que le otorga la cooperativa mejorar en la ganadería. 

En donde  realiza sus compras en el cantón Guaranda. El sueño es tener una casa propia. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es superar las siembras para tener mejores ingresos. En el timepo libre le gusta pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Martha, age 30, is a single mother.  She lives with her family in the Guaranda canton in the Bolívar province.  

The Mushuc Pakari communal bank, which is 40 minutes from the office, is comprised of ten members, and they are farmers.

Martha sells potatoes and cheese.  She devotes herself to growing potatoes, beans, oats and to cheese.  She also raises animals like cows and pigs.

She will use the loan to buy fertilizers, vaccine for the pigs, and rice bran.  The loan that is granted by the cooperative will improve the livestock.

She makes her purchases in the Guaranda canton.  Her dream is to have her own house.

The challenges she faces are to be successful with the crops in order to have better income.

She likes to spend her free time with her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, vaccine for the pigs, and rice bran.

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en:
Memuna is single and has received schooling up to senior high school. She was unable to continue, due to financial constraints. 

Memuna sells mother care products and toiletries in her locality, in Hohoe, which she has done for the past five years to support herself. Memuna uses her income for all her financial needs. 

Memuna will use the loan to purchase toiletries and pampers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Memuna plans to save, to continue her education.

loans.use: to purchase toiletries and pampers to sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 61-year-old married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in firewood and timber.

Charles is applying for a 1,000,000 UGX loan from HOFOKAM to buy more firewood and timber to sell. He is hoping to expand his business into areas with more need for wood.

As a good father, Charles desires to educate his children to university level. He would also like to build rental houses so as to have a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more fire wood and timber to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 52 years old and is from Olkalou.  She is married and has two children who are in school.

Alice is a farmer and has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy fertilizers and maize seedlings to use on her farm.  She hopes to be able to improve her family's standard of living in the near future.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances Ama did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Ama prepares and sells Banku (a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish consistent paste). She is usually found selling in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 5 years. 

Ama is married to a farmer and together they have 5 children.  She uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Ama will use this loan to purchase a larger amount of maize and cassava, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Ama wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: buy maize and cassava

loans.name: Issah

texts.en:
Issah is a small trader from Hohoe.  Issah has received her education to junior high school level.  She is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a butcher.  

Issah has been a small trader since 6 years. She supports the husband with the feeding of the family and other basic needs of the home. Her loan will be used to buy bags of onions, cartons of tin tomatoes and tin fish. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to enlarge her business so she can continue supporting her family.

loans.use: buy food items to resell

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is 34 years old and is from Ndunyu Njeru.  She is married and has three children who are aged between 10 years old and two years old.

Sabina is a farmer and has applied for a loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy maize seedlings for planting. She is optimistic that her business will do better after the loan, as she will be able to meet the demands of her clients.  She hopes that her business will expand in the near future.

loans.use: buy maize seedling

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Sarah is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling cosmetic products in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 12 years. 

Sarah is married and has 5 children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Sarah will use the loan to purchase larger amounts of cosmetic goods, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sarah plans to further diversify the types of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: buy cosmetics to resell

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is 33 years old, married, and has one child, who is aged one and a half years. He lives in Nakuru. Samwel has a clothing business that he has been running. He applied for a loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy more clothes, to add to his stock for sale.

He hopes to be able to open up a boutique in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell in his business

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa, 52, is married to a farmer, and together they have seven children. The family lives in Emissa Krom near Cape Coast.

Due to difficult circumstances Yaa received no formal education, yet this has not stopped her from becoming a businesswoman. For the past five years she has prepared and sold kenkey, a traditional Ghanaian dish made from fermented corn dough that is wrapped in banana leaves. She uses all of her income to feed and provide for her entire family.

Yaa is applying for a 1200 GHS loan from CRAN to buy additional maize so she can make more of her tasty kenkey. Yaa wants to use future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all of her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize which will help her produce more of her tasty Kenkey.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es: Felicitas tiene 43 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tienes tres hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Urquillos y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS” y su actividad económica principal es la crianza de animales menores como pollos. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar pollos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
Felicitas, 43, is in a common-law marriage from which she has three children.  She was born in the city of Urquillos and lives in the same city.  She belongs to Reyna de los Angeles de Urquillos Communal Bank and her main job is raising small animals such as chickens.

She needs this loan to buy chickens.  She has worked in this business for several years now and it's going very well for her because of the effort she puts into her work.

She's happy about the loan and pledges to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Santa Catalina De Sillacancha Group

texts.es:
La socia Gabriela pertenece al banco comunal "Santa catalina de Sillacancha", la socia Gabriela tanto como sus demás compañeras del grupo tienen varias actividades económicas en común como por ejemplo la venta de verduras, venta de frutas, venta de comida, crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo gallinas, cuyes y cerdos. 
La socia Gabriela como el resto de sus compañeras del grupo están solicitando su préstamo para invertirlo en el capital del negocio como por ejemplo para comprar semillas para sus cultivos y también comprar animales menores como cuyes, gallinas, y cerdos. Todos los socios están muy agradecidas con  KIVA, por ayudarlas a fortalecer y hacer crecer sus actividades económica.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a member of the "Santa Catalina de Sillacancha" communal bank. Gabriela and her fellow group members have various business activities in common, such as selling vegetables and fruit, selling food, and raising small livestock such as chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs.

Gabriela, along with the other members of her group, has applied for a loan to invest in business capital, such as to buy seeds for crops and to buy small livestock such as guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs. All of the members are very grateful to Kiva for helping them to strengthen and grow their financial activities.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu is 42 years old and a jewelry seller. She is married to Issaka, a 46-year-old security provider. They have two children. 

In 2012, she needed capital to expand her business and through a friend, she joined ID Ghana. She is hardworking, industrious, and a committed individual ready to go the extra mile to better the lot of those who come across her path. 

This is her 2nd loan, and she needs GHS 400. She will use it to buy more jewelry to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more jewelry to sell to her customers

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph used his previous loan well by buying a dairy cow and sheep. These animals enabled his business to do better, because he was able to sell a lot of milk to his customers, thus making good profits.

Joseph has applied for another loan, to enable him to buy small calves, which he will raise and then sell later. He is optimistic that his business will do even better after the loan.

He hopes to enlarge his farm in the near future. He wants to be able to educate his children well, and also to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy small calves to raise and sell

loans.name: Clement Mogga

texts.en:
Clement Mogga is a 35-year-old business man who lives in Juba. He has three children between the ages of 3 and 9. He runs a general store and has been in this business for four years. He has no employees. 

Clement Mogga heard about Finance Sudan through a promotion by the loan officer and he is taking a loan of 3,000 SSP to purchase soap, tea leaves, and many other items. In five years, he would like to expand his business. His main challenge is the high prices in the market. Clement Mogga says he is happy for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more items, like soap and tea leaves.

loans.name: Asphod

texts.en:
Asphod has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him to boost his general shop, which is his secondary business. This loan will be used to buy soft drinks, milk, bread, etc. to add to his stock. He used his previous loan well as it boosted his farming business and he was able to get a good harvest.

Asphod hopes to see both his businesses do better and he hopes to be able to employ people to help assist him in running the businesses in the near future.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, milk, bread, etc.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Esi did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Aged 29, Esi prepares and sells Kenkey (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough that is wrapped in banana leaves) in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been doing this for about 10 years. 

Esi is married to a carpenter and together they have three children. She uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Esi will use this loan to purchase an increased amount of maize which will help her produce more of her tasty Kenkey. Esi wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize which will help her produce more of her tasty Kenkey.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is happy that his previous loan helped him a lot in improving his dairy business. The cow he bought enabled him to get enough milk to sell. 

John is applying for another loan from KADET LTD to enable him to boost his snow pea business which is a secondary business. He is optimistic that his business will do better after this loan. He hopes to see his businesses expand in the near future.

loans.use: To boost his snow pea business

loans.name: Manuel Prado Group

texts.es:
El señor Pedro nació en la ciudad del Cusco del departamento de Cusco, Actualmente, él vive en la misma ciudad donde nació.  

El señor Pedro tiene 40 años de edad  y es casado fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene un hijo, él es un padre trabajador pues saca adelante su hijo, él es mecánico y tiene un pequeño taller donde atiende a sus clientes. Ya son dos años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio.   

El señor Pedro pertenece al banco comunal “Manuel Prado” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar repuesto como tuertas, pistones, inyectores, aceite, grasa, radiadores, motores y entre otras cosas más. 

Las reuniones de las socias del Banco Comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad del Cusco. El banco Comunal está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y sus actividades económicas de los demás socios son por ejemplo venta de útiles escolares, venta de ropa, venta de comestibles y los demás trabajan como asistente administrativo, confección de ropa y enseñando educación.  

Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Pedro was born in the city of Cusco, in the department of Cusco. He currently lives in the same city where he was born.

Pedro is 40 years old and married. From this beautiful relationship he has one son. He is a hardworking father who provides for his son. He is a mechanic and has a small workshop where he serves his clients. He has had this business for two years, and it is going very well thanks to the effort that he puts into the business.

Pedro belongs to the "Manuel Prado" communal bank. On this occasion, he needs this loan to buy spare parts such as pistons, fuel injectors, oil, grease, radiators, and engines, among other parts.

The communal bank's members have meetings every thirty days in the city of Cusco. The communal bank is made up of hardworking, enterprising people who constantly search for opportunities to get ahead and to give a better future to their children through their efforts. The majority of the members live in the city of Cusco. The business activities of the other members include selling school supplies, selling clothing, and selling groceries. The other members work as administrative assistants, clothes makers, and teachers.

Cusco is known for being a very touristic and commercial area, as well as for its traditional Inti Raymi festival. One of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu, is also located here.

loans.use: to buy spare parts such as pistons, fuel injectors, oil, grease, radiators, and engines, among others.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Although Esi grew up in poverty and without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life, for herself and her family. Currently, Esi is an entrepreneur. She sells limes in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began, seven years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their six children.

Esi has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs, due to limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more bags of limes to sell.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of limes to sell.

loans.name: Zola 3 Group

texts.en:
Horcia, age 26, is single with no children. He is representing the Zola 3 group. Horcia sells drinks in a local market. He also has a secondary business where he sells cells phones and phone cards. He has had these businesses for three years. He will use this loan to pay for more drinks to replenish his stock. His business strategy is to offer great customer service so that people will want to return to his shop.

Horcia has received one previous loan from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. He wants to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: to pay for drinks.

loans.name: Assemblee Des Saints 1 Group

texts.en:
Gustave, age 49, is single and has five children, ages 11 to 28 years old. Three of his children are currently attending school. He is representing the Assemblee des Saints 1 group. Gustave has a hardware store and has been operating since 1989! He has gained a valuable reputation in his community and has many loyal customers. He will use this loan to buy merchandise for his shop. His business strategy is to be nice and helpful to all his customers.

Gustave has received three previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. He wants to continue to progress in life and become a great businessman. He hopes his children will succeed in their studies.

loans.use: to pay for hardware store supplies.

loans.name: Lily  Pilar

texts.es: Lily continúa con el banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS” y con el negocio de cosmetología entonces ella tiene un pequeño salón de belleza donde atiende a sus clientes.  Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como champús y acondicionadores. La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Lily continues with Reyna de los Angeles de Urquillos communal bank and with her cosmetology business.  She has a small beauty salon where she attends to her customers.  She has made a living in this business for several years now and it's going very well for her because of the effort she puts into her work.

She needs this loan to buy materials for work such as shampoo and conditioner.

She's happy about the loan and promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy shampoo and conditioner

loans.name: Maria Ofelia

texts.es: Doña Maria de 36 años, vive con su 4 hijos(18, 17, 14 y 12 años), tiene mas de 16 años de ser comerciante de frutas y verduras, sale a vender de martes a sabado cerca de su lugar de residencia ha resibido buenos ingresos con los que ha podido sacar adelante todos los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Doña Maria solicita un credito para poder comprar mas frutas y verduras y asi obtener mejores ganacias para darle un mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María, 36, lives with her four children, ages 18, 17, 14, and 12.  She has sold fruits and vegetables for more than 16 years.  She goes out to sell near her house from Tuesday through Saturday.  She has earned a good income with which she has been able to get ahead with all the household expenses that come up.

María's requesting a loan to be able to buy more fruits and vegetables to earn more profit and give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Appolo

texts.en:
Appolo is a 31-year-old married man with one child. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. The responsibility of caring for his family rests solely on him.

For the last six years Appolo has been running a computer business with assistance from his family. Because electricity can be sporadic in his area, he used a previous loan to buy a generator so as to provide reliable service.

Now Appolo is applying for a 1,200,000 UGX loan from HOFOKAM to open an internet cafe and buy more computers. His ambition is to see his business grow, build his family a home and educate his child to university level.

loans.use: to open an internet cafe and buy more computers.

loans.name: Debora

texts.en:
Debora is 30 years old and comes from Nyandarua South. She is married and has two children, who are aged seven and two years.

Debora owns a second-hand clothing sales business that she has been running. She has applied for a loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy second-hand clothes to add to her business inventory. She is optimistic that her business will do better after the loan.

She hopes to buy a piece of land in the future, and to be able to build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes to add to her stock for sale

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is divorced and has four children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Ekua is a successful businesswoman. She owns and runs a chop bar (a small roadside stall specializing in Ghanaian dishes) in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about two years. As the sole breadwinner for her family, Ekua uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Ekua will use this loan to purchase more ingredients that go into making the dishes at her chop bar, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to further diversify the type of food that she sells, adapting to her customers' changing preferences.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients that go into making the dishes at her chop bar

loans.name: Assemblee Des Saints 2 Group

texts.en:
Jean, age 53, is single and has three children, ages 6 to 22 years old. He has one child currently attending school. He is representing the Assemblee des Saints 2 group. Jean is a carpenter and has been in this business for 30 years. He has gained valuable experience and many loyal customers over the years. He recently started a grocery stand five years ago as a supplemental business. He will use this loan to buy a machine he needs in his carpentry work. His business strategy is to consistently do good for his customers.

Jean has received four previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. He hopes to continue his businesses into the future. He hopes his children will have a good life and can be supported by his businesses.

loans.use: to pay for a carpentry machine.

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en:
Adwowa is married to a plumber. She has four children. She uses her income to help her husband pay for the household expenses, as well as to save for a rainy day. As a primary school graduate, Adwowa currently sells used clothing and fish in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). 

With over five years of experience in these trades, Adwowa sees an opportunity to expand her enterprises further. However, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of both fish and clothing stock. Thus, she will use this loan to buy more fish and used clothing, which will help her boost her overall sales. Adwowa wants to make her businesses self-sustainable as soon as possible. She plans to channel the new profits from her expanded businesses back into both her fish and used clothing enterprises.

loans.use: to buy more fish and used clothing, which will help her boost her overall sales.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en: Mariya produces and sells groundnut paste in the Hohoe main market. Mariya has never been to school. She is married and has three children with her husband, who is a butcher. Mariya has been producing and selling groundnut paste since 2007. She helps out with the basic needs of the family and also with the payment of her children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of groundnuts. She hopes to save and use the new profits from her business to increase her working capital.
