Imelda makes a living by caring for and selling hogs. She has been in this business for eight years, and is very dedicated to her work because this is how she supports her family. 

Her dream is to improve their living standards. To improve her life, she is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs.

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en:
Eyad is from Iraq.  He is 33 years old, married, and has 2 children.  Eyad and one of his children provide the income for the family.
Eyad is a cowman and has a small farm.  He raises cows to sell dairy products such as milk, yogurt, and cheese.  He has been practicing this business since 2008 and he now he has an employee.  Eyad has gained an excellent reputation in his surrounding area thanks to the fresh products that he offers.

Eyad is requesting a $3,000 loan which he will use to buy 2 extra cows and to install a fence around his farm.  By buying these 2 new cows, he aims to increase his production and increase his profits.  This will help him to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy 2 cows and install a fence around his farm.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en: Liza is 40 years old and married with five children.  She manages a vegetable production business in which she planted eggplant, squash, string beans, and tomatoes.  She has been in this business for almost 20 years, with a daily net income of 500 PHP.  She would like a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase vegetable seedlings, fertilizers, and to pay for the land preparation.  She is hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can utilize it immediately to gain more income.

loans.use: to pay for vegetable seedlings, fertilizers, and land preparation.

loans.name: Murodoy

texts.ru: Муродой 46 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Ее муж водитель. Дети Комрон, Робар, Обидджон и Собирджон совершеннолетние. Она много лет занималась домашними делами и воспитанием детей. Она очень нуждалась в деньгах, так как доход ее мужа маленький. Теперь дети выросли, и она имеет много свободной времени. Она хочет организовать бизнес скотоводством, так как она помогала родителям скотоводством и имеет опыт по данному бизнесу. Она имеет у себя дома условию для скотоводства. Она будет покупать скот, присматривать несколько месяцев и перепродавать на местном рынке. Ее старший сын будет помогать ей введение бизнеса, так как он очень аккуратный и хозяйственный. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3500 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Murodoy is 46 years old.  She is married and has raised four children.  Her husband is a driver.  Her children (Komron, Robar, Obidjon and Sobirdjon) are all adults now.  Murodoy spent many years taking care of her home and raising her children.  During those years she always needed money, since her husband makes only a small salary.  

Now that her children are grown, Murodoy has a lot of free time.  She wants to start her own business raising livestock.  She has some experience in animal husbandry since she used to help her parents with this type of work. Her home offers the right conditions to raise livestock.  She intends to buy some livestock, keep it for a few months and then resell it at the local market.  Her oldest son, who is very detail-oriented and has a good sense of business, will be helping her to manage this new business.

Murodoy is requesting a loan of 3,500 somoni to buy some livestock.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy some cattle to start her new business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 65 years old and married with 4 children.  She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur.  She sells fish in the local community to earn a living.  She has been in her business for over 8 years and earns 10,000 PHP every month.  Rebecca has been with GDMPC since 2009, and she has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell.  Her wants and hopes in life are to have a better future and to improve her living situation.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Abdel Jalil

texts.en:
Abdel Jalil is a married Iraqi client.  He is 53 years old and has 5 children.  He and 3 of his children work to provide the family living.
Abdel Jalil runs a small business as a grocer.  He offers to sell all of the basic daily needs, such as snacks, soft drinks, dairy products, detergents, toothpastes, and canned food.  He has been in this field since 2008 and he now has an employee.  Abdel Jalil gained an excellent reputation in his surroundings, thanks to the quality of goods that he sells. 

Abdel Jalil is requesting a sum of 3,000 USD.  He will use this loan to renovate his grocery store by installing an external ceiling and signage.  He will also use this loan to buy 2 new refrigerators.  Abdel Jalil aims to grow his business so he will be able to provide his children a good future.

loans.use: to buy signage, 2 refrigerators and install an external ceiling.

loans.name: Las Flores Group

texts.es:
La señora Eyra Elizabeth es una persona comerciante que reside en uno de los barrios periféricos de la ciudad de pueblo nuevo ubicada al norte de Estelí a unos 45 km de distancia y reside en su propia casa de habitación junto a su esposo el que se dedica a la venta de carne fresca de cerdo y sus derivados, también reside junto a sus hijos los cuales están estudiando la primaria.

la señora Eyra Elizabeth es miembro del grupo solidario las flores, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas a base de maíz, ella diaria mente elabora unas 200 a 250 tortillas las que vende ahí mismo en su casa de habitación, cabe mencionar que ella tiene su clientela establecida la que son sus mismo vecinos. 

Ella diariamente trabaja en su negocio desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 del medio día de lunes a domingo ya que este es un producto de consumo diario. Este es su principal ingreso familiar y su sostén diario de la familia ya que ella asume parte de los gastos familiares así como de los estudio de sus hijos entre otras cosas.

 Ella tiene unos 12 años de dedicarse a la elaboración de tortillas, también elabora la comida típica que es el nacatamal, este solo los elaboran los fines de semana y tiene buena demanda por ser un alimento mus gustoso.

 una joven integrante de este grupo es la señora Elizabeth del socorro que también se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas a base de maíz la que también las vende en su casa de habitación y sus clientes son sus vecinos, también integra este grupo la señora Ivania que ella se dedica a la elaboración de helados de frutas, paletas, y helados de bananos cubiertos con chocolate llamado choco banano.

La señora Eyra se presentó junto a las otras dos miembros del grupo la flores, a la oficina de ceprodel a solicitar un financiamiento para poder ampliar su negocio. 

Si el crédito les fuese aprobado ellas comprarían más materia prima y de eta manera aumentar sus producción y por ende sus ventas, ya que tiene la suficiente demanda y por eso surge la necesidad de solicitar financiamiento y así mejorar sus ingresos y su nivel de vida familiar.
texts.en: Eyra Elizabeth is a merchant who lives in a barrio on the outskirts of the city of Pueblo Nuevo, about 45 kilometers from the city of Estelí. She lives in her own home along with her husband, who makes a living selling fresh pork and its derivatives, and their children, who are in elementary school. Eyra Elizabeth is a member of Las Flores loan group, and she makes a living making and selling corn tortillas. She makes between 200 and 250 tortillas a day and sells them herself out of her home to a regular customer base consisting of her neighbors. She works from 6 a.m. until 10 a.m. every day, since tortillas are eaten on a daily basis. This is the main source of income for her family, and she assumes part of the household expenses, such as her children's education. She has dedicated herself to the tortilla business for 12 years, and she also makes other traditional foods like tamales, which she only makes on the weekends and are in high demand because of their great taste. A young member of this group is Elizabeth Del Socorro, who also makes and sells corn tortillas out of her home. The other member of the group is Ivania, who makes fruit ice creams, popsicles, and a banana ice cream dish covered with chocolate that is called choco banano. The three are requesting a loan to expand their businesses by purchasing more supplies and in this way increase their production and, in turn, their sales, since they have sufficient demand. In this way they will increase their income and the quality of life for their families.

loans.use: to purchase supplies like corn and firewood.

loans.name: Eulalio

texts.es:
Eulalio un hombre humilde con gran visión de trabajo toda estas buenas cualidades caracterizan a este varón originario de la bella Ciudad Darío ubicada en la parte norte de Nicaragua. Eulalio es casado y tiene un hijo en edad escolar cursando la secundaria.

En la actualidad se desempeña como fontanero o plomero de una empresa de servicio de acueducto y alcantarillado por más de 15 años  esta antigüedad laboral demuestra la responsabilidad laboral.

Eulalio está construyendo un cuarto de habitación en su vivienda el ya cuenta con algunos materiales de construcción solicita un crédito a kiva por medio de ceprodel para la compra de cemento, hierro y pago de mano de obra por la construcción del cuarto de habitación.

Agradece a ceprodel y kiva por brindarle el apoyo ya que de esta manera ha venido realizando mejoras en su vivienda y dándole una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Eulalio is an unassuming man who has a great vision for his work.  All of these qualities are embodied in this man, who is from the beautiful city of Dario, which is located in the northern part of Nicaragua.  Eulalio is married and has a son who is in secondary school.

At this time, he works as a plumber in a water and sewage system company.  After 15 years of service, he has exhibited responsibility in his job.  

Eulalio is currently adding a room a room to his house.  He already has some construction materials, but he is requesting a Kiva loan through CEPRODEL to buy cement and steel, and to pay for some workers to add a room to his house.  He thanks CEPRODEL and KIVA for providing this support, because in this way he will be able to improve his house and provide better living conditions to his family.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies, such as cement and steel, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 37 años de edad casada, luchadora y emprendedora que de su matrimonio tiene 4 hijos los cuales viven bajo su mismo techo y dependen de ella 3 están estudiando en primaria en diferentes grados de educación y el mayor solo pudo cursar hasta el 6 grado por lo cual en familia se dedican a trabajar en su cultivo de café. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria no completado cursado hasta el primer curso y no pudo continuar por la falta de apoyo económico ya que sus padres son de bajos recursos económicos. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra desde muy pequeña por lo cual esta actividad ha sido el único medio de ingreso para su familia y en la actualidad no deja de serlo ya que dicha actividad la ejerce junto a su esposo hace más de 8 años. Su producto es comercializado y vendido con los intermediarios que a la zona llegan por su adquisición y el terreno que ellos trabajan es propio gracias a una herencia que sus suegros le dieron a su esposo el cual está ubicado a 500 metros de distancia de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan a pie diariamente.           

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos y otros productos que mantendrán sus cultivos libres de plagas y de enfermedades como la roya. 

Su sueño es poder aumentar su cultivo para que de esa manera obtener más ingresos para ayudar a sus hijos con sus estudios, que ellos tengan una mejor calidad de vida y sean personas preparadas a nivel universitario y se puedan defender en la vida con una carrera de provecho.
texts.en: María is a 37-year-old, fighting, enterprising woman who is married and has four children, all of whom live under the same roof and depend on her. Three of the children are in different grades of elementary school, and the youngest only went until the sixth grade before helping the family grow coffee. María went to school for a year but didn't complete it because of a lack of economic resources for her parents, who were poor. It was them who taught her how to work off the land since she was very young, and this activity has been the only source of income for the family. She has never stopped working, and now she has done the activity alongside her husband for more than eight years. She sells her products to agents who come to the area to make their purchases, and the land that they work on is their own thanks to an inheritance left by her in-laws for her husband. The land is located 500 meters from their home, and she and her husband walk there daily. She is requesting the loan to purchase fertilizers, manure and other products to keep her crops free of plagues and diseases. Her dream is to expand her crops so she can earn more income to help her children with their education, so that they have a better quality of life and can be prepared to go to college so they can go through life with the benefit of a degree.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and manure for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Anna Marie

texts.en:
Anna Marie is 27 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail store in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over three years and earns 40,000 PHP every month.

She has been a member of GDMPC since the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP. She will use it to purchase additional cellphone load to sell, such as Smart and Globe Prepaid, and other products. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional cellphone load to sell, such as Smart and Globe Prepaid, and other products

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La socia Gloria continúa en el banco comunal  “Vamos Juntas” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, ella continúa con el negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad pero también se dedica con la venta de comida pues tiene un pequeño restaurante. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como sacos de arroz y sacos de azúcar. 

La socia Gloria está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Gloria is continuing with the "Vamos Juntas" community bank and Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco, and continues to work selling products of basic need, but also makes a living selling food at a small restaurant. She has had this business for a number of years and it is going very well thanks to the hard work she puts into her work. She is requesting the loan to purchase supplies like sacks of rice and sugar. Gloria is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase supplies like sacks of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Shukrona

texts.ru: Шукроне 23 года. Она умная и трудолюбивая женщина. Шукрона не замужем и живет с родителями. Она умелая женщина и имеет «золотые руки». Шукрона шьет красивые платья. Она научилась у портнихи этому ремеслу. Она несколько лет практиковалась и теперь она уверена в себе, что может воплотить свое ремесло в бизнес. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и научилась, как правильно организовать бизнес. Она будет преподнести услуги швеи у себя дома. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки и ткани для организации бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует купить все не обходимые вещи для себя и родителей. С бизнесом она будет справляться сама. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Shukrona, aged 23, is a bright and hardworking woman.  She is not married and still lives with her parents.  She is also very skillful and possesses "golden hands" (she sews beautiful dresses).  

Shukrona learned her trade from a seamstress.  After practicing for several years, she is now confident that she can turn her skills into a business.  With this goal in mind, she has taken a course sponsored by the Association of Business Women and entitled "Achieving Success", which taught her how to efficiently start a business.  

Shukroma intends to offer sewing services from home.  She is requesting a loan of 2,000 somoni for the purchase of a sewing machine and some fabrics, in order to start her new business.  

She plans to use her income to buy all the necessities that she and her parents need.  Thanks to her new business, she will be able to support herself.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and some fabrics to start her new business.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: This loan will help Juanita grow her party supplies retail store. Juanita opened Party On Us LLC, a party supply and decoration shop, in 2010. The company sells party and holiday supplies and also assists with party planning and setting up events. During the peak season, from spring to late fall, Juanita hires a part-time employee to manage the store while she and her husband set up events and run deliveries. Party On Us is the only party supply store in the area and Juanita is happy that she is contributing to her local community. She hopes that one day her business will become self-sufficient and she will be able to work full-time at her store. Looking to expand her business, Juanita needs a loan to purchase necessary equipment and machines as well as advertising.

loans.use: to purchase equipment, machinery, and advertising.

loans.name: Elida

texts.es: Elida tiene la edad de 50 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Ella el crédito lo quiere para la compra de unos cerdos de engorde y cuando estén grandes venderlos y obtener una ganancia. El negocio de cerdos le ayudará a ella y a su familia a salir adelante. Es la primera vez que Elida se financia con FUDECOSUR, ella manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho y le ha brindaron muchas facilidades. Ella espera que con este proyecto crezca y logre sus objetivos y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Elida is 50 years old, married and has three children. She is requesting the loan to purchase some pigs to fatten and sell when they get bigger to turn a profit. This business will help her and her family make headway. This is her first loan with Kiva partner FUDEOCSUR, and she says the the credit committee has helped a lot and made things easier. She hopes that this project will grow and achieve its objectives, and in this way she can provide her family a better quality of life and more financial stability in the future. Elida has not had a previous loan with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided her this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie, 46, works hard to support her family; she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for more than three years. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase more vegetables and bananas to sell in the village.  

In the future, Julie would like to save for future expenses and needs for her three children. She hopes to grow her business through the loan in order to have a stable source of income.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Anival

texts.es: Carlos  tiene 58 años de edad, es casado y vive con la esposa y un hijo. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de una moto para transportar hortalizas, el se dedica a esta actividad agrícola  y desea la moto para distribuir las verduras y hortalizas. El quiere aumentar un poco las ventas. El se ha dedicado con su familia al cultivo de hortalizas. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Carlos is 58 years old, married and lives with his wife and a son. He is requesting the loan to purchase a motorcycle to transport vegetables. He makes a living in agriculture and wants the motorcycle to distribute the products and increase his sales a little bit. He and his family are dedicated to growing vegetables. This is his first loan with Kiva partner FUDECOSUR. He has not had previous loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR is providing the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to distribute vegetables.

loans.name: Delfia Argely

texts.es: Delfina se dedica al cultivo de maiz, maicillo, loroco y jocotes, vive con su familia en casa propia, tiene algunos años con su familia de trabajar en la agricultura y les ha ido muy bien; han tenido buenas ganancias con sus ventas, ella solicita un credito para la compra de insumos especialmente para el cultivo de jocotes ya que ha tenido muy buena cosecha y asi poder vender mas esa fruta para tener mejores ganancias y ayudar a su familia en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Delfina works farming corn, sorghum, loroco, and jocote fruit. She lives with her family in their own house. She and her family have been working in agriculture for some years, and it has gone very well for them; they’ve had excellent profit from their sales. 

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies, especially for growing jocotes. She has had a very good harvest, and in this way, she will be able to sell more of this fruit in order to have better earnings and help her family with the household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for growing jocote fruit.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 33 years old, and is in a partnership with 1 child. She lives in Tukuran, Zambonga Del Sur. 

Marlyn owns and operates a wholesale cassava business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for more than 4 years, and earns 45,000 PHP every month. 

She joined in GDMPC in 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Her hope and dream is to have a better life and improve her living situation.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Farzona

texts.ru: Трудное условие жизни заставляет человека направлять все свои усилия и мотивировать существующие ресурсы. Фарзона является одним из таких личностей, которая старается улучшить условия жизни и стимулировать экономическое состояние семьи. Она замужем, но не имеет  детей. Ее муж получает маленькую зарплату. Это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами. Фарзона решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей женской одежды, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условию проживания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  15000 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Difficult life circumstances are forcing Farzona to gather all her efforts and to make the best use of existing resources.  She happens to be one of those people who try very hard to improve the living and economic conditions of their family.  

Farzona is married but does not have any children.  Her husband earns a small salary, which is not enough to provide the family with all the necessities of life. This is why she has decided to help her husband, for the sake of her family.

With this goal in mind, Farzona has taken a course entitled "Achieving Success", sponsored by the Association of Business Women, and she has received a certificate.  She can now fully start her own business and become a successful entrepreneur.

Since she already has some experience in buying and selling women's clothes, she wants to start her own business in this field.  

She plans to use her income to improve her living conditions.  She is requesting a loan of 15,000 somoni to buy some merchandise for her new business.  

She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes to start her new business.

loans.name: Greisel Yiseth

texts.es:
Ella nació en un núcleo familiar conformado por siete personas, su mama y sus seis hermanitos que ya son mayores. Su niñez fue normal, compartió todo con su familia, se consideran muy unidos y amorosos.
Inicio sus estudios a los cuatro años, transcurrió mucho tiempo hasta que salió del bachillerato cuando esto sucedió ya tenía dieciocho años, entro a estudiar a CAMPOALTO ya que su anhelo por desarrollar sus habilidades administrativas crecían, cada vez que sueña algo lo comenta con sus familiares los cuales la apoyan y le dan las herramientas dentro de sus posibilidades de seguir adelante.
Espera terminar sus estudios y ser la persona que muchos quisieran ver dentro un establecimiento, poniendo su cara amable y dando a la gente una buena atención.
texts.en:
Greisel was born into a family of seven: her mother and her six little brothers who are now grown up.  Her childhood was normal.  She shared everything with her family and they consider themselves very close and loving.

She started studying when she was 4 years old.  It took a long time for her to complete high school.  She was 18 when this took place.  She started school with CampoAlto, due to her increasing desire to develop her administrative skills.  Whenever she dreams of doing something, she talks about it with her family, who support her and give her the tools they can to help her get ahead.

She hopes to finish her studies and be someone that people like to see in a store: someone with a friendly face and providing good service.

loans.use: finish her health administration degree

loans.name: Luis Angel

texts.es: Don Luis se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 15 años y su principal siembra es el maiz y el frijol es un hombre trabajador y responsable, vive con su esposa y su hijo de 6 años en casa propia, con la venta que hace del maiz ha podido solventar los gastos de su hogar, solicita un credito para la compra de insumos agricolas para poder seguir cultivando sus semillas y asi poder seguir dandole a su familia una mejor.
texts.en:
Don Luis has been farming since he was 15 years old.  His main crops are corn and beans.  He is a hardworking, responsible man.  He lives with his wife and their 6-year-old son in their own house.  With the profits that they make from their corn, his has been able to take care of the household expenses.

He is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies so he can keep growing his seeds and thus continue giving his family the best he can.

loans.use: buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is an Iraqi married client, who is 44 years old and has four children. Haydar and two of his children provide the family income, together. Haydar owns a small shop, where he sells birds and pigeons. Since his childhood, Haydar had a special interest in and love for birds. It became his favorite hobby, to know about birds and learn how to feed and breed them. After learning all he needed about birds, in 2001 Haydar turned his hobby into his business. Now Haydar is being very well-known in his surrounding area and has gained the respect of his neighborhood.

Haydar is requesting a loan of $3,000. He will use this loan to pay the annual rent of his shop, as well as to renovate it. Haydar aims to grow his business and increase his profits, so he may be able to provide for all the needs of his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop, as well as to renovate it

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is from Iraq. He is 43 years old, married, and has four children. Haydar is the sole provider in the family.

Haydar owns a small restaurant, in which he offers to sell all types of middle eastern fast foods. He has been in this field since 2003. Before establishing his own business, Haydar gained long experience in this field through working in many restaurants as an employee. He now has three employees of his own. His restaurant is known as one of the cleanest restaurants in the area.

Haydar is requesting a loan of $2,700, which he will use to renovate his restaurant and to buy a grill. He believes that this loan will successfully improve his business and increase his profits, and he will be able to educate his children and provide for their needs.

loans.use: to renovate his restaurant and to buy a grill

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Margarita  es una socia que ha solicitado Crédito Desarrollo, ella vende ropa nueva, perfumes y accesorios, como carteras y collares. Este negocio lo ha comenzado hace más o menos unos 30 años, antes de casarse, y ha sido intermitente por el hecho de no tener un capital fijo, también cuando tenía un poco de dinero compraba lana y tejía, así vendía y podía armar algo de capital. Con el dinero que ha solicitado comprara más ropa, accesorios y ropa interior para su negocio, y ella piensa que de esa manera le irá muy bien en este periodo porque además ella compra en la medida que sus clientas le han solicitado. Lo que más le ha gustado de trabajar con Fondo Esperanza es que siempre los ayuda a poder desarrollarse en su rubro.
texts.en:
Margarita has asked for a loan from the Crédito Desarrollo (Developing Credit) program.  She sells new clothes, perfume, and accessories such as wallets and necklaces.  She started this business about 30 years ago, before she got married.  

Its success has been variable due to not making regular profits.  In addition, when she had a little bit of money she would bought buy wool and she would knit.  In this way she was able to sell some goods and put together a bit of money.

With the money that she has asked for, she will buy more clothes, accessories, and underwear for her business.  She thinks that this will work well for her at this time because she can buy clothes in the sizes that her customers have asked for.  The thing that she has liked the most in working with Fondo Esperanza (Hope Fund) is that they always help to develop the ventures of others.

loans.use: buy clothes, underwear, and accessories.

loans.name: Jesucristo Es Mi Modelo Group

texts.es: Les presento al grupo “JESUCRISTO ES MI MODELO” grupo integrado por 11 mujeres emprendedoras. Se encuentran pasando el quinto ciclo. Carmen es una de las integrantes del grupo tiene 55 años tiene 2 hijos independientes. Trabaja en su restaurant que puso en su casa hace 40 años. Preparan comida rápida, jugos.  Vende gaseosa, cerveza. El prestamos lo utilizo en la compra de vitrinas grandes. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA. Carmen es la tercera  del lados izquierdo viste con polo verde y pantalón negro.
texts.en:
This is the group "Jesucristo Es Mi Modelo" (Jesus Christ Is My Exemplar).  It is made up of 11 enterprising women.  This is their 5th Kiva loan.

Carmen is one of the members of the group.  She is 55 years old and has 2 grown sons.  She works in a restaurant that she set up in her house 40 years ago.  She makes fast food and juices.  She sells soda and beer.  She will use her loan to buy large display cases.  

The group is thankful for Kiva lenders.  Carmen is the third from the left and is wearing a green shirt and black pants.

loans.use: buy large display cases.

loans.name: Ozodjon

texts.ru: Озодчон мужчина  проживающий не далеко от города, в селе. В своем селе он занимается ремонтом легковых машин. У него нет специального образования, он учился этому ремеслу у своего учителя. Учителем у него был сосед, проживающий не далеко от самого дома  Озодчона. Еще с юности его интересовали машины, сначала он просто помогал соседу, но потом втянулся в это дело.   Уже много лет он в пару работает со своим учителем, они сняли отдельное помещения для ремонта легковых машин.  У Озодчона уже свои ученики и он рад обучать их этому делу. Озодчон в будущем планирует открыть свой собственный сервис в котором будут все услуги обслуживания. Озодчон женат и имеет детей. Жена его нигде не работает, занимается воспитание детей. Друзья Озодчона посоветовали ему взять кредит в  организации Арванд для покупки авто запчастей. На полученный кредит он  планирует приобрести все необходимое для своей работы. Он очень рад, что есть такие организации как МДО «Арванд», которые помогают людям в трудные минуты.
texts.en:
Ozodjon lives in a village located not far from an urban center.  He works in his village, repairing passenger cars.  He does not have any specialized education, but learned his trade from an instructor who happened to be a neighbor.  Ozodjon has always had an interest in cars: in the beginning, he just helped his neighbor, but then he was drawn into the business.  He has been working with his neighbor/instructor for many years.   The two of them rented a commercial space to fix passenger cars.

Ozodjon already has his own apprentices and he is happy to teach them his trade.  In the future, he is planning to open his own shop, where he would provide all car repair services.

Ozodjon is married and has a family.  His wife is not employed, she takes care of the children.

Ozodjon's friends advised him to take a loan with the microfinance institution Arvand, in order to buy auto spare parts.  Ozodjon plans to use his loan to buy everything that he needs for his work.  He is very glad that institutions such as MDO Arvand are here to help people during difficult times.

loans.use: to buy auto spare parts.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
A 35-year-old woman, Analyn is diligent and loving. She comes from the village of Canogan, in the province of Isabela. She has been engaged in hog raising for three years. After four months, she sells the pigs that she has raised, in the market near their place.

To help continue her business, she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000. She will use it to buy pig feed and vitamins for her business. She hopes that someday she can give the good living that she aims for, to her family.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Betheline

texts.en: Betheline, 33 years old, is from the village of Canogan, in the province of Isabela. She manages a transportation business, and her husband is the one who drives the motorcycle. To maintain the good quality of their motorcycle, she needs to repair it and change a tire. That's why she is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000. She will use the loan for the maintenance work, and to buy a new tire for her motorcycle business.

loans.use: to buy a tire and have maintenance work done on her motorcycle.

loans.name: Aura Cristina

texts.es:
Nació en una familia conformada por padres y hermanos, ha corrido con la suerte de que su hogar sea unido y mantenido por todos. Ha estudiado y se ha esforzado por salir a delante por esto opto por ingresar a CAMPOALTO a desarrollar el programa de Administración en Salud, donde espera desarrollarse como profesional, ha tenido el apoyo de sus padres desde el inicio, y aun lo hacen. 
Cada día se enamora más de su carrera ya que con lo que hace se siente realizada, para poder seguir desarrollando lo que se propone trabaja los fines de semana para ayudar  con los gastos y así no representar una carga económica para sus padres. 
Se esfuerza todos los días por progresar y aplicar sus conocimientos en todo lo que encuentra, su sueño está compuesto por tener una familia como la que ella tuvo y no solo eso poder brindar las comodidades y anhelos de los miembros de la suya.
texts.en:
Aura Cristina was born into a family made up of her parents and siblings. She has been very lucky that her home was united and maintained by everyone. She has studied and put a lot of effort toward getting ahead. 

Because of this, she chose to enroll in CampoAlto in the Health Administration program, where she hopes to develop herself as a professional. She has had her parents’ support from the start, and they still support her.

Every day she falls more in love with her career because she feels fulfilled in what she does. In order to continue doing what she’s proposed, she works on weekends to help with her expenses. In this way, she avoids being an economic burden on her parents.

Aura Cristina makes an effort every day to progress and apply her knowledge to all that she sees. Her dream is to have a family like the one she had, but not only this; also, to be able to share her opportunities and eagerness with the her own family members.

loans.use: to complete her academic program in Health Administration with CampoAlto.

loans.name: Nora Isabel

texts.es:
Nora es una mujer joven de 20 años de edad casada, emprendedora, luchadora con muchos sueños y deseos de superarse. Ella tiene un grado de escolaridad de primaria no completado cursado hasta el 4 grado ya que sus padres son de escasos recursos económicos y no pudieron seguirla apoyando con sus estudios. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron desde muy pequeña a trabajar en el cultivo de café como ser: siembra, poda, fertilización, corta de cosecha y la mecanización del cultivo. Ella agradece infinitamente a sus padres por haberle enseñado a trabajar en esta actividad ya que ha sido medio de sustento para su familia y en la actualidad para su hogar del cual pueden cubrir las necesidades básicas como ser: alimentación, vestimenta, medicinas con muchas restricciones, etc, ya que de ella solo depende una menor de edad. Las tierras donde cultivan están ubicadas a una distancia de 100 metros de su casa de habitación y son propias por lo cual se trasladan a pie y les permite estar al pendiente de la asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos.

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizante y abono para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café ya que esto permitirá que se mantenga sano y limpio de cualquier plaga y enfermedad.

Su sueño es lograr graduar a su hija de la carrera que ella elija para su beneficio y dedicación ya que le permitirá ser mejor cada día, con mejores oportunidades en la vida, y puedan mejorar su estilo de vida ya que el trabajo de la tierra es pesado y no quiere lo mismo para su hija.
texts.en:
Nora is a 20-year-old young woman who is married, enterprising, and hardworking.  She has many dreams and desires to progress.  She partially completed grade school (up to the 4th grade).  She couldn't finish because her parents have very little money and couldn't keep supporting her with her studies.  They are the ones who taught her from her youth how to grow coffee, including sowing, pruning, fertilizing, harvesting, and processing the harvest.

She is infinitely grateful to her parents for having taught her to work in this area, since it has been a means of sustaining her family and home.  Using it, they can cover their basic necessities such as food, clothing, and medicine (to a limited extent).  This is because she only has one young child who is dependent on her.

The land where they farm is 100 meters from their house and they own it.  For this reason, the get their own foot and are able to attend to and maintain their crops. 

Currently, she is asking for help to buy fertilizer and manure for the upkeep of their coffee crop, since it will allow for it to stay healthy and immune from disease and sickness.

Her dream is to be able to send her daughter through school for the career of her choice, for her benefit.  This will let her improve every day and have better opportunities in her life.  In addition, she will improve her quality of life, since working with the land is grueling and Nora doesn't want the same for her daughter.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and manure to help grow coffee.

loans.name: Esperanza Y Progreso De Huaycan Group

texts.es: Les presento al grupo “ESPERANZA Y PROGRESO DE HUAYCAN” conformado por 6 integrantes trabajadores. Martha es conviviente con 3 hijos. Trabaja en la venta de carbón en su casa hace 8 años viene realizando esta actividad. Su esposo le apoya en la venta de carbón en el mercado de huachipa. El préstamo que obtuvo lo utilizo en la compra de más carbón. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVAPOR por el préstamo que le dio. Martha es la tercera del lado izquierdo viste con polo azul y pantalón negro.
texts.en:
This is the group "Esperanza y Progreso de Huaycan" (Hope and Progress of Huaycan).  It is made up of 6 hardworking members.  Martha is married (common-law) and has 3 children.  She works selling coal in her house.  She has been working in this area for 8 years.  Her husband supports her selling coal in the Huachipa market.

The loan that she obtained was used to buy more coal.  The group is thankful to Kiva lenders for the loan that they gave her.  Martha is the third from the left in the blue shirt and black pants.

loans.use: buy coal.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria, 32 years old, has two school-aged children. She lives in the village of Canogan, in Isabela province. To make a living, she needs to double her effort in her business. Her main business is transportation, but she is also engaged in selling vegetables in the community. Maria is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000, which she will use for maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.use: to maintain her motorcycle in working condition.

loans.name: Esfuerzo De Mujeres Group

texts.es: Buenas tardes. El grupo “Esfuerzo De Mujeres” conformado por 06 socios, la cual pasa a su 2do ciclo, son personas que han ido mejorando en el transcurso del tiempo con la única finalidad de ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida  a sus familias. Tal es el caso de Esther que a raíz de su divorcio tuvo que retomar su negocio, la cual actualmente ofrece en un mercado especierías (condimentos) y CDs. Esther de 52 años es separada con hijos independientes.  Unos de sus sueños son de implementar su negocio. Con el crédito que solicitó comprará especierías y de esta manera tener que ofrecer a sus clientes. El grupo “Esfuerzo De Mujeres” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Esther es la tercera del lado derecho y viste polo y pantalón color turquesa. Shirley no pudo estar presente por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
Good afternoon.  This is the group "Esfuerzo De Mujeres" (The Strength of Women).  It is made up of 6 members and is on its 2nd Kiva loan.  They are people who have improved themselves over time and have the end goal of offering a better quality of life to their families.  Such is the case with Esther, who had to start her business over again as a result of her divorce.  Her business is currently selling spices and CDs.  

Esther is 52 years old, separated, and has grown children.  One of her dreams is to establish her business.  With the loan that she asked for, she will buy spices to offer her customers.

The Esfuerzo De Mujeres group thanks those that made this loan possible.  Esther is the third from the right, dressed in a turquoise shirt and pants.  Shirley couldn't be present for the photo due to work.

loans.use: buy spices to sell.

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.en:
Abelardo lives at Pinopoc with his family. 58 years old, he is a farmer who grows rice to sell. He aims for better crop production; that is why he is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to pay for labor fees, fertilizers and pesticides for use in farming. These inputs will help nourish crops for healthier growth. 

Abelardo hopes to keep improving his farming practices and acquire more crop production to lead his family to income stability.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees, fertilizers and pesticides for use in farming.

loans.name: Shermahmad

texts.ru: Шермахмад холостой молодой человек. Ему 29 лет. Он живет с матерью и братом в районе Джиликуль, который расположился в южной части Хатлонской области Таджикистана. Его отца уже нет в живых, мать пенсионерка, а брат работает в банке района. Сам Шермахмад занимается земледелием более четырех лет. Он арендует земельный участок, на котором выращивает овощи, в основном картошку. В сезон посева Шермахмад уже посеял картофель. Сейчас он запрашивает кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений с целью обработки земли. Шермахмад надеется получить богатый урожай и за счет его прибыли купить компьютер.
texts.en: Shermahmad is an unmarried young man. He is 29 years old. He lives with his mother and brother in the Jilikul region which is located in the southern part of the Khatlonskiy region of Tajikistan. His father has passed away, his mother is retired and his brother works in the regional bank. Shermahmad does agriculture for more than four years. He rents out a plot of land where he grows vegetables, mainly potatoes. Shermahmad has already sown potatoes during the sowing season. Right now he is asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizer with a goal to process the land. Shermahmad hopes to collect a rich harvest and use the profit to buy a computer.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer for the potato harvest.

loans.name: Indou Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogamiques, les dix femmes du groupe Indou ont en moyenne 38 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Gachi dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. Elles font l’achat et la vente d’habits de la fripouille, de la restauration, des fruits, des céréales (mil, fonio) d’arachides et du couscous.
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Rokia (femme assise en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse d’arachide dans le village. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter un sac d’arachide à la foire de Gouassola. La revente se fait au comptant  et à crédit à domicile à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Rokia espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 5000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer le ravitaillement du foyer en condiments.
texts.en:
Married and mainly living in monogamous families, the 10 women of the Indou group have an average age of 38 and, on average, 3 children. They all live in the village of Gachi, in the Ségou region (fourth administrative region of Mali) and got to know each other thanks to neighbourly and family relationships, and marriage. They buy and sell second hand clothing, fruits, cereals (millet, fonio), groundnuts and couscous and sell prepared food. The group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their business, and are on their second group loan cycle.

Rokia (the woman sitting second from the left in the picture) is a large reseller of groundnuts in the village. She plans to use her loan to buy a bag of groundnuts at the market in Gouassola. She makes her sales for cash or credit, door-to-door, to a clientèle mostly made up of women. Rokia hopes to make an average monthly profit of 5 000 francs, part of which will be reinvested in her business and part of which will be used to supply the household with condiments.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts.

loans.name: Tougoube Siguidiya Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Tougoube Siguidiya sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Sirakorobougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de condiments (choux pommés, pates d’arachide, échalotes, poisson fumé, …) et de grains (arachide, mil, …).
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Safiatou (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des condiments de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  300kg d’échalote et des choux pommés. La revente se fait au comptant  et à crédit à domicile à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Safiatou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer le ravitaillement du foyer en condiments. Tout comme les autres femmes du groupe, Madame Safiatou a pour objectif de pérenniser ses activités dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso. 
NB : Mme Neyini  n’est pas sur la photo pour cause de décès dans un village environnant.
texts.en:
The 6 women of the Tougoube Siguidiya group are married and mainly live in polygamous families. They have an average age of 44 and, on average, 4 children. They all live in the village of Sirakorobougou in the Ségou region (fourth administrative region of Mali) and got to know each other thanks to neighbourly and family relationships, and marriage. The group members are small resellers of condiments (head cabbage, peanut butter, shallots, smoked fish, etc.) and grains (peanuts, millet, etc.). The group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their business, and are on their second group loan cycle.

Safiatou (the woman sitting on the left in the picture) has a great reputation in the sales of all sorts of condiments. She plans to use her loan to buy 300 kilos of shallots and some head cabbage. She makes her sales for cash or credit, door-to-door, to a clientèle mostly made up of women. Safiatou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 15 000 francs thanks to this loan, part of which will be reinvested in her business and part of which will be used to supply the household with condiments. As with the other group members, Safiatou goal is to use her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to further develop her business.

Note: Neyini, a group member, is not in the picture because of some deaths in a neighbouring village.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.es:
Emérita es una mujer de 29 años de edad casada y madre de 4 hijos los cuales juntos en familia se dedican a la siembra y cultivo de maíz, frijol y café. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria no completado el cual pudo cursar con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio hasta el 4 grado y no pudo continuar por falta de ayuda económica ya que sus padres son de bajos recursos económicos por lo cual las entradas de efectivo las distribuían realizando la compra de los alimentos para el sustento de su familia. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron dicha actividad la cual la ejerce hace 10 años y que hasta hoy en día sigue practicando ya que es el único medio de ingreso y sustento para su familia. El terreno que ellos cultiva lo adquirió gracias a una herencia por parte de los padres de su conyugue el cual les ha dado mucho fruto ubicado en la misma propiedad donde ellos habitan eso les facilita estar al pendiente para su mantenimiento, asistencia y limpia de sus cultivos. Su producto es comercializado y vendido por los diferentes intermediarios que llegan a la comunidad para su adquisición.

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizante y abono para sus cultivos de café el cuales les permitirá mantener limpio de plagas y de enfermedades las cuales destruyen cultivos completos de no ser tratados a tiempo.

Su sueño es seguir aumentando su cultivó para de esa manera generar más ingresos que le permitan seguir invirtiendo en su producción de café ya que uno de los más grandes desafíos es el constante aumento y el alza de los precios de los insumos mismos que son de gran ayuda para que la producción se pueda aprovechar en un 100% esto permitirá darle una mejor educación a sus hijos y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Emérita, 29, is married and has four children. The family works together growing corn, beans and coffee. Emérita could not finish primary school; right after the fourth grade, she had to quit because her parents lacked the necessary resources. Since they had a low income, they had to prioritize buying food for the family.

Emérita’s parents taught her to work with agriculture, something she has been doing for ten years and still today represents her only source of income for supporting her family. The family inherited the land from her husband’s parents, something that has helped them a lot. It is located where they live, which makes it easy for them to take care of it. Their produce is sold by different middlemen that visit their community.

Emérita is requesting help to buy fertilizer and compost for her coffee plantations, in order to keep them free of plagues and diseases, which destroy entire plantations if not stopped on time. Her dream is to expand her crops and generate more income to reinvest in her coffee production, now that rising prices of the supplies she needs in order to obtain all the benefits from her plantations represent a challenge for her. It will also help her to provide her children with a better education and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and compost for her coffee plantations.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is 40 years old and married with nine children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Marita has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rings, poplin fabric, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Jaime Orlando

texts.es:
Su  nombre es Jaime tiene 19 años, es una persona cariñosa, comprensiva, amable y prudente que se esfuerza  por hacer las cosas bien hechas confía mucho en sus aptitudes y cualidades claro que tiene defectos como todos los seres humanos; actualmente se encuentra viviendo con su familia y estudia en el institución  Campoalto  en el programa de auxiliar de enfermería segundo semestre;  estudia esta carrera porque le gusta ayudar a las personas que lo necesiten, también porque su mamá y  una de sus tías son enfermeras y me gusta la labor que ella desempeñan.
Considera que el programa que actualmente esta estudiando le va a servir mucho en la vida y va a ayudar a desarrollar actividades que pongan a prueba sus conocimientos al servicio de la comunidad.
Considera que kiva es una gran ayuda para todos;  puesto q aún depende de la colaboración económica de sus padres ya que no trabaja, y sería muy satisfactorio para el poder  ayudar  económicamente gracias a este descuento y a su ayuda por supuesto.
texts.en: His name is Jaime, he is 19, and he is a caring, sympathetic, friendly and sensible person who always strives to do things well.  He is blessed with skills and good qualities, although he obviously has some failings like all human beings.  He currently lives with his family and is in his second term studying for a nursing auxiliary qualification with Campoalto institute.  He chose this course because he likes helping people in need and also because his mother and one of his aunts are nurses and, as he says, "I like the work that they do".   He believes that the course he is currently following will be very useful to him in his life and will help him to develop activities which allow him to test his knowledge in the service of the community.  He considers that Kiva is a great help to everyone because, as he is not working, he still depends on his parents' support.  It would be very pleasing for him, therefore, to be able to use this allowance to make a financial contribution and, of course, to offer any help he can.

loans.use: to finish his nursing auxiliary course with Campoalto

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 47 years old and has four school-age children. She aims to become financially stable in order to satisfy their necessities and finance the education of her children. Due to problems and unavoidable circumstances, she is separated from her husband. Despite being a single parent, she has the strong determination to give her family a better life. 

She is engaged in buying and selling vegetables in the public market to generate income. She aims to improve the business and make it more profitable in order to generate sufficient income. 

In this regard, she is asking for an additional sum of PHP 15,000 buy more stocks of potatoes, carrots, beans, tomatoes, cabbages and sweet potatoes to sell. She is hoping that the loan will help her improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of potatoes, carrots, beans, tomatoes, cabbages and sweet potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Lando

texts.en:
Lando is 49 years old, married with five children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, he owns and operates an agriculture business, planting and harvesting rice for sale in the local community. He has been in his business for over six years and earns 16,000 PHP every month. 

He joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now he has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. His hopes and dreams are to have a better future and improve his living situation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 63 years old and widowed with seven children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Loreta is borrowing PHP 12,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Loreta has been in the pig-fattening business for four years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 67 years old, married and has six children. Francisca owns and operates a business planting and harvesting coconuts for sale to earn a living. Francisca has been involved in her business for 33 years and earns 30,000 PHP a month from it. 

In 2004, Francisca joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Francisca is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is 53 years old, married and has nine children, two of whom are in school.

Avelina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Avelina requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Avelina has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Avelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 47 years old, and married. She is currently residing in the village of Sta. Luciana. Zenaida has been selling vegetables in their village for almost two years; through this business she's earning an income of PHP 200 per day. 

She would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase vegetables to sell such as eggplants, squash, string beans, and tomatoes. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can utilize her loan for her business and to become profitable.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to sell such as eggplants, squash, string beans, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es: Doña Juana continua con su único medio de ingresos la venta de tortillas, frijoles cocidos para el cual pasa casi todo el día exponiendose al calor del fuego y el humo de la leña haciendo las tortillas, mientras su esposo labora también para aportar en los gastos de la casa y de esa manera sacan adelante a sus hijos quienes cada día van creciendo y cursando su año escolar, este cuarto crédito que solicita es para lograr terminar de construir el muro de su casa para vivir en mejores condiciones y garantizar la seguridad de sus hijos.
texts.en: Juana still has only one source of income - selling tortillas and cooked beans.  She is exposed to the heat of the fire and the wood smoke all day as she makes her tortillas.  Meanwhile, her husband also works to contribute to the household expenses and, in this way, they support their children who are growing every day and are enrolled in school.  This loan, the fourth she has applied for, will be used to finish building a wall in her home so as to improve her family's living conditions and ensure her sons' safety.

loans.use: to buy breezeblocks, cement and sand.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is now 34 years old and her four children are still doing well in school.

Lucy used her previous loan well as she was able to get a good harvest and made lots of profits. She has now applied for her fourth loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable her to buy maize seedlings, fertilizers and also pay for labor in this new planting season. She is optimistic that her farm will do better after the loan.

She hopes to work and diversify into dairy farming in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings and pay for labor.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling vegetables and spices in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables and spices to sell on her food stall.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and spices.

loans.name: Wael

texts.en:
Wael is a 32-year-old young married man and a father to one son who is two years old. For the past three years, Wael has been operating a vehicle repairs workshop, which has been a profitable project, but not enough to cover his cost of living.

Wael is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new vehicle repair kit. This will improve Wael's work quality and increase demand from his customers to repair their vehicles. This will increase his income and offer to him better living conditions. Wael is photographed in the workshop.

loans.use: To purchase a new vehicle repair kit.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda works hard to support her two children. 

Leonarda requested a PHP 1,800 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to be able to extend her business hours even after nightfall.

Leonarda is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Shoniso

texts.en:
Shoniso is married and has four children who are 25, 16, 10 and five years old. She always wanted to provide them with a good education. Since her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, Shoniso decided to start a new business of animal husbandry in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances. 

She studied on the course ‘To Get Ahead’ provided by a women’s organization and got sufficient business skills. Her children will help her with her business. She will be a very successful business woman as she is hardworking and smart. 

She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy cattle to set up the new business. She will get by using her loan, and her business will go on to be a source of income, so that her family will have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle so as to set up a new business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a 48-yearl-old married woman with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Helen buys and sells livestock in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.
Helen has been in this business for 5 years. Helen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Cistina

texts.en:
Cistina is 24 years old, married with two children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. To earn a living, she owns and operates a retail business which is selling cosmetics in the local community. She has been in her business for over three years and earns 10,000 PHP every month. 

She joined in GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell such as lotion and soap. Her hopes and dreams in life are to have a better future and to improve her living situation.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as lotion and soap.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is 55 and has four children. He started operating a transportation business 10 years ago. This source of income is sending his children to school, so Rolando really dedicates himself to his work. 

He is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy new tires and other spare parts that he needs to maintain in his tricycle. In the future, he wants to see his children finishing their studies through his occupation and his sacrifices.

loans.use: to buy new tires and other spare parts.

loans.name: Lindita

texts.en:
Lindita is requesting a loan of 100,000 Albanian Lek (ALL) to stock up on inventory items such as used shoes to sell. She has been selling such items for three years in the city’s market. Usually, such markets were built by the municipality, so that Romans & Egyptians could sell there, and now almost every major city has one.
Lindita is a 43-year-old Egyptian lady. She is married and has two children. Her children are ten and seven years old and all of them live in a main city in southern Albania in an Egyptian community.
Kindly note, that Lindita has been photographed at her home with her oldest son, Mathew, because she was too shy to have her photo taken in public.

loans.use: to buy used shoes to re-sell.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a charcoal/firewood retail business in the Philippines.
She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.
Amelita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.
NWTF is re-listing Amelita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal and firewood.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace is involved in farming together with her husband. She is 27 years old, from the village of Carmencita in the province of Isabela. She is very diligent person, she always make sure that she provides the needs of her family. She is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farming. She hopes that someday she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farming.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 34 years old, married with two children. With two children currently in school, Jennifer works very hard to provide for them.

Jennifer runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store like noodles, sugar, soft-drinks, bread, etc.

Jennifer has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, sugar, soft-drinks, bread, etc. 

Jennifer would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store like noodles, sugar, soft-drinks and bread.

loans.name: Kholod

texts.en:
Kholod is a 26-year-old married woman. She is employed in natural treatment center and her husband is a taxi driver. Their income is not enough to cover all their needs.

Kholod wants to improve her home living conditions so she is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing air conditioning. Taking this loan will offer Kholod and her husband a new air conditioning unit and will allow them to enjoy fresh hot and cold air in all seasons in their house.

Kholod and her husband have a good reputation among their friends and their clients.

Kholod appears in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase air conditioning for her house.

loans.name: Nica

texts.en:
Nica is 51 years old, married and has three children. Nica engages in the selling of school and office supplies in the market while her husband is her companion in managing their business.
Nica uses the profits from the business and invests them in their farming business. Their retail business is their source of income that provides for their needs. Nica wants to have more stock of items to sell in able to minimize her expenses in marketing the items she has available. Hence, she is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy assorted items of school and office supplies. She hopes to increase her income to invest in her farming.

loans.use: to buy assorted items of school and office supplies.

loans.name: Jeimy Catherin

texts.es:
Ella es Jeimy tiene 18 años actualmente estudia mercadeo y ventas en Campoalto está cursando segundo semestre 
Siempre ha querido salir adelante y ser alguien en la vida por eso desde los 15 años empezó a trabajar en una casa de familia donde conocían a su mama y le dieron la oportunidad de poder trabajar en un horario de 3:00 a 7:00 pm luego se destaco mucho y la recomendaron con unos familiares de ellos donde también le ofrecieron empleo en el horario de la mañana fueron personas muy buena gente y gracias a ellos   pudo ahorrar   durante un año y medio para poder estudiar una carrera técnica  luego quiso cambiar de trabajo porque empezó  a estudiar y no podía cumplir con el horario así que vendió chorizos en carnicerías y restaurantes siempre le ha gustado ser independiente y poder obtener sus propias cosas,  aunque su familia la ha apoyado  mucho en lo que ha podido y siempre han querido que ella tenga más oportunidades de las que ellos tuvieron 

Quiere poder terminar su carrera técnica en campo alto para poder conseguir un mejor puesto laboral  para así poder seguir estudiando y terminar su carrera profesional en marketing y publicidad y así ayudar a su hermana menor, para que cuando termine sus estudios de bachiller pueda estudiar una carrera universitaria y que solo se dedique a estudiar 

También ha pensado más adelante poder montar su propia tienda de ropa interior y así poder aplicar todos los conocimientos adquiridos y crear empleo al menos a una persona 
También quiere aprender a hablar idiomas y así poder tener la oportunidad de  viajar a otros países y tal vez conseguir un trabajo y un mejor nivel de vida para su familia
texts.en:
Jeimy, 18, is currently studying her second semester of marketing and sales at CampoAlto. She has always wanted to succeed and to be someone in her life, so she started to work at the age of 15 in a family home, where they knew her mother and gave her the opportunity to work from 3pm to 7pm. She really stood out and they recommended her to their relatives, who also offered her work in the mornings. They were very good people, and thanks to them she was able to save up for a year and a half so that she could take on a technical degree.

Afterwards, she decided to change jobs because she started studying and she could no longer comply with her work schedule, so she sold chorizo in butcher's shops and restaurants. She has always liked being independent and obtaining her own things, even though her family has supported her as much as they could and they have always wanted her to have more opportunities than they had.

She wants to finish her program at CampoAlto so that she can obtain a better job position in order to continue studying and finish her professional degree in marketing and advertising. This will allow her to help her younger sister, so that she can study a university degree when she finishes high school and dedicate herself solely to her studies.

She has also thought about opening her own lingerie store in the future, where she will be able to apply all of the knowledge which she has acquired and to create employment for at least one person. She would also like to learn languages and thus have the opportunity to travel to other countries, perhaps finding a job and obtaining a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to finish her CampoAlto program in Marketing and Sales.

loans.name: Bichiko

texts.en:
Bichiko is 59 years old. He lives in the small village of Khulo District with his wife, son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. Bichiko requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of their low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have three milking cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. In addition, they have 0.5 hectares of agricultural land, where different kinds of vegetables are grown. They sell the harvested products and cheese at local markets. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Bichiko requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of new a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit Bichiko will purchase a car. After purchasing a car, he will be able to serve local people as a taxi driver and increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car to work as a taxi driver.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina de 43 años, esta casada con Abdon con quien tiene una hija de 19 años. Ellos viven en una casa propia ubicada en un anexo agrícola.Delfina se dedica a la agricultura desde los 19 años. Junto a su esposo, ha conseguido muchas satisfacciones con esta actividad, “gracias  a la agricultura tengo mi casa y terrenos propios”, menciona. Ella se encarga de producir arvejas, maíz, papas, alfalfa y flores de gladiolos , por la variedad de sus sembríos siempre está ocupada y siempre tiene ventas e ingresos para su familia. Estos meses son cruciales para las siembras de todo tipo, ya que las lluvias empezaron y Delfina no se quiere quedar atrás, por eso solicita de su apoyo para sembrar arvejas, habas y papas, cuyas cosechas estarán listas para febrero del año próximo.Delfina, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos , además agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual .
texts.en:
Delfina, 43, is married to Abdon, with whom she has a 19-year-old daughter. They live in their own house, located in an agricultural settlement. 

Delfina has worked in agriculture since the age of 19. Alongside her husband, she has been very satisfied with this business activity. "Thanks to agriculture, I have my house and my own land," she says. She is responsible for producing peas, corn, potatoes, alfalfa, and gladiolus flowers. Due to the variety of her crops, she is always busy and she always has sales and an income for her family. 

These months are crucial for all types of crops, because the rains have started and Delfina does not want to fall behind. Therefore, she is asking for your help to plant peas, beans, and potatoes, whose harvests will be ready in February of next year. 

Delfina will invest these 3,000 Peruvian soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer to nourish her crops. She is also grateful for the financial support which she is receiving, and she is committed to paying her installments on time.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Ma. Lorena

texts.en:
Ma. Lorena is 36 years old, married with one child. With one child currently in school, Ma. Lorena works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Lorena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks like snack foods, noodles, bread, soft-drinks, laundry soap, etc. to sell in her general store.

Ma. Lorena has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles, bread, soft-drinks, laundry soap, etc. 

In the future, Ma. Lorena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks like snack foods, noodles, bread, soft-drinks, laundry soap, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Hai is 58 years old and lives in a rural village of Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. He is married and has three children, all of whom are still attending school. For the last two years, Hai has been buying and selling garbage in his village. The current business earns him about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need.
This is the first microloan for him with VisionFund. Now he is applying for a loan with VisionFund of 1,000,000 KHR. With this loan, he is going to buy more garbage to resell. He hopes this loan will enable him to earn more income from his current business so as to make a living better and keep his children in school.

loans.use: to buy more garbage to resell.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a basket weaving business in the Philippines.
She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy supplies for her basket weaving.
Fe successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further improve her business.
