texts.es: El Sr. Abraham  tiene 24 años, casado tiene un hijo que tienen las edades de 3 años,  el se dedica  a la elaboración y  venta de queso y leche ya que tiene ganado vacuno, el vive en la localidad de Palacoco, la gente de la población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  El Sr. Abraham  utilizara  este préstamo para la compra  de una vaca lechera y quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es no tiene dinero  para la compra ya que esto le beneficiara de gran manera  ya que  proporcionara  buena cantidad de leche y así de esta manera producir más quesos y leche y mejorar sus ingresos económicos, El Sr. Abraham  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el forraje que debe comprar cada cierto tiempo, y  utilizara los beneficios mejorar su ganado y su deseo es poder elaborar quesos por mayor y ofrecer a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de La Paz.
texts.en: Abraham, 24, is married and has a three-year-old son.  He works making and selling cheese and milk since he owns dairy cattle.  He lives in Palacoco.  People there work in agriculture and animal husbandry.  This loan is his first sequence in the institution.  Abraham will use this loan to buy a dairy cow; he wants to take advantage of this opportunity.  The reason for requesting the loan is that he lacks the money for said purchase that will be very beneficial because good quality milk will be produced so he can make more cheese and milk to improve his income.  The business challenge Abraham faces is the forage he has to buy every so often.  He will use benefits to improve his cattle.  His wish is to be able to make more cheese at wholesale and sell it to various markets in the city of La Paz.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en: As a widow and the parent of one child, Soledad works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from tailoring. Soledad is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy stocks to sell in her general store, including soap, canned goods, sugar, toothpaste and shampoo. Soledad has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks to sell in her general store, including soap, canned goods, sugar, toothpaste and shampoo.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en: Oretha is 43 years old and lives in Kakata Town, the capital city of Margibi County, which is the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is married and has seven children who are between 11 and 24. Her children are attending school, and they all live at home. For the past three years, she has been operating her business at a table in the market, where she sells dried fish. Sometimes she has fewer customers, but most of the time she make a lot of profits. She spends nine hours at her business, and she uses taxis to get her goods to her table in the local market. She is applying for a loan to buy more dried fish for her business. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for her business.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie lives in Kakata Town, the capital City of Margibi County. The county is the highest-producing rubber plantation area in Liberia. Julie is 39 years old, married, and has three children between 7 and 25 years old. Her three children are in school; only two of them live at home. Julie is a high school graduate, and for the past five years she has been selling food ingredients, like palm oil, pepper, rice and okra, in the local market. She started this business with help from her husband, and she learned this way of selling from her friends.

Julie is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more items like palm oil, pepper, rice and okra, to resell at her business. She enjoys her business and the profit she receives every day. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, pepper, rice, okra, and the like, for her business

loans.name: Samuelo

texts.en: Samuelo is a 34-year-old, married man, and a father of two children. He is a carpenter and a farmer. Samuelo is asking for a loan, which he will use to buy materials for the house renovation. The materials include items like wood, nails, varnish, and galvanized iron. With this loan, he will be able to improve his house, thus providing a good shelter for his family. In the future, Samuelo has hopes of making his business a success and saving money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy materials for the house renovation, like wood, nails, varnish, and galvanized iron

loans.name: Mamia

texts.en:
Mamia is 43 years old. He lives in a small village of Kobuleti District with his wife, daughter, and sister, who is provided with a retirement pension. Mamia requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is their agricultural business. In particular, they have a two-hectare piece of agricultural land, where different kinds of fruits and vegetables are grown. Besides the land, they have a milking cow, whose milk is used in cheese products. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Recently, Mamia requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved, in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits, with soft conditions, to rural poor people, who do not have access to other credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

With the received credit Mamia will purchase a minibus. After purchasing a minibus, he will get orders to transport different kinds of things and increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus and work in transportation

loans.name: Besik

texts.en:
Besik is 52 years old. He lives in Kutaisi, West Georgia with his 48-year-old wife Naira, 28-year-old son and 24-year-old daughter in-law. Besik requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, without any success. His loan request was rejected because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions.
Besik has rented a commercial space where he has a pub. He has been in this business for one year but the pub needs some renovation to allow for a better income.
Besik requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provisions of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country’s rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit Besik will purchase more products and expand the building to have more space. With a larger space he will be able to serve more clients and it will increase his income. As summer season is coming, beer will be more in demand among the villagers so Besik envisions his business being profitable. Part of the profit he wants to save so in the future instead of renting the space he can buy it and the other part of the profit will be used for his family’s well-being.

loans.use: to purchase materials to expand his pub.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie is 32 years old and lives in Margibi county, which has the largest rubber producing plantation in Liberia, with her husband and three children between 6 months and 12 years old. Only two of their children are in school. For the past three years she has been selling Lappa (traditional cloths) at her table in the community market. She started her business with money given to her by her husband. She makes a profit and has steady customers. She is requesting a loan to buy more Lappa for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to buy more Lappa for her business.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 26 years old. She lives in the Akhaltsikhe district with her 29-year-old husband, mother in-law and two children who are 10 years and 6 months old respectively. Nino requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, without any success. Her loan request was rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.
Nino sells perfumes. She is buying products at wholesale prices from the capital city, bringing it to her village and selling it among the locals at an increased price. Her husband is an artisan. He works on private orders and gets a small monthly salary. The total family income is not enough to cover their monthly expenses.
Nino requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provisions of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country’s rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit Nino will purchase stock of perfumes. With the increased stock she will not have to go to the capital city so often. Also she will be able to offer a better choice of products to her clients. This will decrease her expenses and increase her income. She will use part of the profit for reinvesting and expanding her business and the other part will be used to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock of perfumes.

loans.name: José Ínes

texts.es:
José tiene 67 años de edad, esta casado y tiene tres hijos. Él es agricultor de hortalizas, como: pipían. Vive únicamente con su esposa. Desde hace 50 años, cultiva pipían, aunque también siembra maíz y frijol blanco. También, tiene cuatro años de experiencia en la cría de cerdos y ganado. Para comprar los insumos agrícolas, como venenos, fertilizantes y semillas, concentrado, harinas y medicinas para alimentación del ganado para lo cual viaja treinta y cinco kilómetros, paga un vehiculo para trasladar la mercadería.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar semilla, agroquímicos; para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, también comprara cinco terneros para engorde, harinilla, concentrado y medicinas para el ganado y cerdos.

Su otro propósito, es vender y comprar vacas para recibir mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
José is 67 years old. He is married and has three children. He grows vegetables like squash. He lives only with his wife. He has been growing squash for fifty years, but he also plants corn and white beans. He also has four years of experience raising pigs and cattle. In order to buy farming supplies like poison, fertilizer and seed, as well as concentrate, feed powder, and medicine to feed the cattle, he travels 35 kilometers and pays for a vehicle to transport the merchandise.

He will use the loan he is requesting from Fundación Campo to buy seed and farming chemicals to farm 7,000 square meters of corn. He will also purchase five calves to fatten, feed powder, concentrate, and medicine for the cattle and pigs. 

His other goal is to sell and buy cows in order to obtain better income.

loans.use: to buy seed and farming chemicals to grow corn, five calves to fatten, and feed powder, concentrate, and medicine for his cattle and pigs.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is 49 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital of Margibi County, which produces the most rubber in Liberia. She is married with 10 children between 22 and 33 years old. Only four live at home and are in school. For seven years now she has been selling used children’s clothing at the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this trade from her friends. She spends 8 hours a day at her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used children’s clothing for her business. She hopes to build a house one day.

loans.use: to purchase more used children's clothing for her business.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Agée de 41 ans, Madame Fatoumata est mariée et mère 5 enfants, elle réside avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Bougoula Ville, le centre ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Fatoumata après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée depuis plus de 10 ans à l’activité d’achat et vente de vêtements, de pagnes wax, de chaussures et de tissus brodés, qu’elle achète à Bobo Dioulasso (au Burkina Faso). Elle mène son activité à son domicile et de façon ambulante dans la ville de Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y’a maintenant cinq an avec laquelle elle a bénéficié de plusieurs prêts solidaires dans un association des femmes de son quartier. Elle est actuellement  à son onzième prêt individuel,  tous ses prêts précédents ont été tous correctement remboursés.
 Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt 15 pièces de pagne wax, 10 complets de tissus brodés et 30 paires de chaussures différentes. Ses marchandises sont vendues en détail de façon ambulante au comptant et à crédits à une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 110 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatoumata is 41 years old, married and has five children. She lives with her husband and their children in a large traditional extended family in Bougoula City, in the center of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

After conducting many unsuccessful activities, Mrs. Fatoumata was introduced over 10 years ago to the business of buying and selling clothes, pagnes wax (colorful West-African fabric), shoes and embroidered fabrics, purchased in Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso).

She works from her home and as an ambulant vendor in the city of Sikasso, where she is in high demand by her customers for the quality of her products.

To satisfy an increasing number of customers, she decided  to join the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution five years ago, and since then has been granted several solidarity loans as part of a women's association from her neighborhood. She is currently on her eleventh individual loan, and all previous loans have been repaid in full.

She intends to use this loan to buy 15 lengths of pagne wax, 10 full sets of embroidered fabric, and 30 different pairs of shoes. Her goods are sold on the street at retail prices, for cash or on credit, to mostly women customers.

She hopes to achieve monthly profits of 110,000 FCFA which she will use to contribute towards family expenses, pay interest on the loan and invest the remainder in her business activity.

loans.use: buy pagnes wax (colorful West-African fabric), embroidered fabrics and shoes

loans.name: Arlen María

texts.es:
El sauce es un bello Municipio ubicado a 86 Km del departamento de León, es aquí donde existen personas emprendedoras con espíritu de superación como es el caso de Arlen María. 

Arlen María se llama la Joven de 34 años edad Luchadora por su vida y la de su familia, brinda su servicio como maestra de educación primaria. 

Cuenta con una Hija bajo su Cargo y su esposo, sus labores los realiza en una comarca ubicada a 23 Km del Municipio de el sauce, no tiene transporte a su trabajo, se traslada pidiendo raí, al verse con la gran necesidad de trabajar.

 solicita a Ceprodel Y Kiva que le financie un crédito para la Compra de una motocicleta, esto sería de muchísimo beneficio de poder seguir trabajando obtener un transporte propio y vivir en mejores condiciones. 

Es de su gran conocimiento que Kiva y Ceprodel vela por este tipo de personas emprendedoras y luchadoras por su vida.
texts.en:
El Sauce is a beautiful town that is located 86 kilometers from the department of Leon.  Here there are enterprising people who have a spirit of cooperation, such as Arlen Maria.

Arlen Maria, 34, strives to provide for herself and her family, working as an elementary school teacher.  She and her husband have a dependent daughter.  They work in a district that is 23 kilometers from the city of El Sauce.  Arlen does not have transportation to her job; she gets there by hitchhiking.  Since she really needs to work, she is requesting a loan from Ceprodel and Kiva to buy a motorcycle.  It would be a great benefit to Arlen if she could continue to work using her own means of transportation; this would improve her living conditions.  

Arlen Maria knows that Kiva and Ceprodel look out for the interests of enterprising people who are struggling to improve their lives.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Otgonbaatar

texts.en:
Otgonbaatar is 36 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on his sister's plot of land. His wife has been working as a checker at a supermarket and recently has taken maternity leave. Otgonbaatar has a taxi service for local people, which he has been doing for four years. 

Otgonbaatar is requesting a loan for 2,000,000 MNT, which he will use to purchase furniture such as a sofa, drawers, and chairs. As a result, his family can live in comfortable place. He is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase a sofa, drawers, and chairs.

loans.name: Joanna Maria

texts.es:
Bueno todo empieza cuando ingreso al jardín, la verdad no se acuerdo mucho de  cuantos añitos tenia, pero siempre fue muy compañerita, tenía muchos amiguitos y le gustaba mucho la ensalada de repollo con zanahoria y piña, se acuerdo mucho q le decía a su  mama q la llevara al jardín por q le gustaba la ensalada de zanahoria.
Luego en la escuela, la verdad no ha sido muy buena para el estudio, pero le gustaba mucho todo lo que tenía que ver con los deportes y el baile, jugaba baloncesto y con el tiempo aprendió a jugar voleibol, algunas veces jugaban con los compañeritos futbol.
En danzas se destaco bastante puesto que le gustaba estar bailando a toda hora y aparte de todo en los descansos colocaban grabadora con buena música para cantar y bailar un rato.
En cuanto a los compañeros: siempre hay un niño bonito o el simpático, una niña q es la feíta, la charlatana, el consentido, la niña bonita y los demás. Ella era de los charlatanes, no la regañaban todo el tiempo pero si de vez en cuando le daban quejas a la mami que  charlaba mucho en clase pero las notas bien.
En el bachillerato la verdad no le fue muy bien, cómo era la consentida de papa, pues se podrán imaginar pasar de una escuelita a un colegio fue tenaz para ella, le dio muy duro, lloraba bastante y se la montaron por llorona. Perdió octavo y la sacaron del colegio en donde estaba, la llevaron a otro y ese era femenino pues allá la cosa no era muy diferente por que igual lloro cuando la dejaron sola en ese sitio.
Bueno,  en las practicas  que tenían que hacer un grupo de compañeras y ella dictaron un cursos de danzas a los alumnos de un colegio, al principio fue algo complicado porque les toco desde los más pequeños, hasta los más grandes, se acuerda mucho que le enseñaron a bailar el mapale, un baile llamado las vueltas, joropo, sanjuanero , cumbia y no otros que no recuerda, ha aparte de eso estuvo en  una velada cultural y ellas bailaron el jarabe tapatío con unas faldas hermosas que las hacían lucir divinas.
Luego termino 11 y la se dedico a trabajar y nada más.
Hasta este año que tomo la decisión de retomar los estudios y como le gusta  la cocina, considera q lo hace bien y le gustaría aprender más de las personas q saben cómo los maestros. 
Aunque su papa no está vivo sabe que le hubiera gustado verla en este momento, haciendo lo que le gusta y lo que a él le gustaba. Gracias a su mama y hermanos q la apoyan en este proceso espera llegar a montar su casa de banquetes o un buen restaurante 
Gracias a ustedes
texts.en:
The story begins with her entering Kindergarten although she doesn’t remember exactly how old she was then but she was always a very good fellow student; she had lots of friends and liked cabbage, carrot and pineapple salad very much.  She remembers asking her mother to take her to kindergarten because of how much she liked the carrot salad.

Later in school the truth is that she wasn’t very good at studying but liked everything to do with dancing and sports; she played basketball and in time learned how to play volleyball; sometimes she even played soccer with her male classmates.

She stood out quite a bit in dance because she liked to dance at all times and besides that during recess they’d set up a tape player with good music to sing and dance for a while.

As for her little classmates, there’s always the cute or pleasant little boy, or the little girl that’s not too good-looking, the talkative one, the teacher’s pet, the pretty girl and all the others.  She was one of the chatty ones.  They didn’t always scold her for this but sometimes did send reprimands home to her mother because she chatted too much during class; her grades were good however.

In secondary school she didn’t do too well but she was her father’s favorite.   You can well imagine that going from a little elementary school to a secondary school was quite a shock for her; it hit her hard.  She cried quite a bit and they punished her for being a crybaby.  She failed 8th grade and they took her out of the school she was attending and transferred her to another one.  Even though that one was all girls that didn’t change things for her because she cried there too when she was left alone there.

So, for the practical courses they had to do, she and a group of fellow students taught dance classes to students in a school.  At first it was a bit complicated because they got from the smallest to the biggest ones and she remembers that they taught them to dance the ‘mapale,’ and dances called ‘las vueltas,’ ‘joropo,’ ‘sanjuanero,’ ‘cumbia,’ and others she does not remember.  In addition to that she participated in a cultural evening where she danced the ‘jarabe tapatío’ wearing beautiful skirts that made her feel fabulous.  

When she completed 11th grade she decided to go to work and that was all until she decided this year to return to school and since she likes to cook she thinks she’ll do it well and would like to learn more from people, like the teachers, who know more.

Although her father is no longer living she knows that he would have liked to see her at this moment doing what she likes and what he enjoyed too.  Thanks to her mother and siblings who support her in this process she hopes to reach her goal of establishing a banquet hall or a good restaurant thanks to you.

loans.use: to complete her chef's course.

loans.name: Tete

texts.en: Tete is 51 years old. She lives in Margibi county, which has the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She was unfortunate in attending school, but she has been involved in business for the past twenty years and now she is selling Lappa (fabric). She is married and has seven children between 25 and 35 years old. Only one lives with her and goes to school. Her husband worked with Firestone. She is requesting a loan to purchase Lappa (fabric) for her business. She spends eight hours on her business, and most of the time she uses a taxi to get her goods to her shop. She hopes to build a house for herself and her children.

loans.use: to purchase Lappa (fabric) for her business.

loans.name: Juventud Unida Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Juventud Unida” conformado por 05 socios entusiastas y comprometidos, que por medio de sus negocios siguen mejorando cada día. Isabel una de las integrantes es casada con 02 hijos en etapa escolar. Ella cuenta con una tienda en su vivienda, gracias a los créditos obtenidos pudo invertir y así emprender su propio negocio. Se siente orgullosa pues gracias a su perseverancia y dedicación ha mantenido su negocio. Su actual crédito lo destinará para la compra de abarrotes y golosinas. Terminar de construir su vivienda es su mayor deseo. El grupo “Juventud Unida” agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso. Isabel es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste polo blanco. Teresa está ubicada en la parte superior al lado derecho.
texts.en:
This communal bank “Juventud Unida” (United Youth) comprises 5 enthusiastic, dedicated members, who keep improving through their businesses. Isabel, one of the members, is married and has two school-age children. Thanks to loans, she could start and invest in her own business, a grocery store in her house. She is proud to have maintained the business through perseverance.

She will use this loan to buy groceries and candies. Her greatest desire is to finish building her house. The communal bank “Juventud Unida” is grateful for the loan that has made its progress possible. Isabel is the first person on the left and is wearing a white t shirt. Teresa's photo is at top right.

loans.use: to buy groceries and candies.

loans.name: Los Louchadores De Ramon Castilla Group

texts.es:
YESSENIA MARGOT, tiene 33 años de edad, ella es socia del grupo "Los Luchadores de  Ramon Castilla" formado por siete integrantes, éste es un grupo nuevo, que se unieron para poder conseguir juntos sacar adelante sus negocios.
Yessenia Margot, desde hace cinco años se dedica a atender su negocio, es una bodega que esta instalada en su domicilio, su negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo, el préstamo que recibió lo invertirá en la compra de productos para su bodega como abarrotes y bebidas.
texts.en:
Yessenia Margot, 33, is a member of the communal bank "Los Luchadores de  Ramon Castilla."  The group has 7 members.  It is a new group that got together so that they could jointly get ahead with their businesses.

Yessenia Margot has been tending to her grocery store business for 5 years.  The business is set up in her home, and it has been growing gradually thanks to her efforts and hard work.  Yessenia will invest this loan in the purchase of products for her store, such as groceries and drinks.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 39 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She lives in in Margibi county, which is the largest rubber producer in Liberia. For 15 years, she has been involved with a business in the market. Her aunt taught her how to sell and assisted her with money. She established her business in the market, selling red oil. 

Esther is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more red oil to sell. Her plans are to expand her business and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase red oil to sell.

loans.name: Anderson Fabian

texts.es:
En su corazón y mente está el anhelo de obtener el conocimiento posible para poder ayudar a la gente que más lo necesita así acabar con muchos problemas e inconvenientes que hay en la sociedad, entre las familias, pensamientos y en el mundo, si no lograra realizar esto contribuirá a lo anterior para que otra persona en un futuro lo realice por él, que pueda recopilar y poner en práctica cada uno de los principios y valores que la vida le va mostrando.
Principalmente la meta será entrar a una entidad del gobierno para así poder ver y conocer que es la justicia entregando un respeto por los valores de la mejor manera posible, colaborando con el ambiente clandestino que hay en las calles para que la gente puede salir con sus familias que se sienta segura y sin miedo, que no haya riesgo como siempre, acabando con hurtos, corrupción, narcotráfico y demás. 
Su mayor anhelo es que la buena integridad de la sociedad no sea interrumpida.
texts.en:
In his heart and mind, Anderson wishes to acquire all the knowledge he can to help the most needy overcome the problems and obstacles that exist in society, between families, and in global thinking. If this can't be achieved, one person may contribute so that someone else will achieve it for him by compiling and putting into practice each of the principles and values that life points out to him. 

Anderson's first goal is to become part of a government body so that he can see and understand what justice is. He would bring, to the best of his abilities, a respect for values and work undercover so that people can go out with their families, feeling secure and without fear. There would no longer be risk, and robbery, corruption, drug dealing, and other crimes would end. He great desire is that social integrity does not break down.

loans.use: to finish his legal studies.

loans.name: Besim

texts.en:
Besim is married and has three children. His wife is a housewife. To earn a living, Besim started his career working as a facade-constructor. Now Besim is planning to open his own company as a facade-constructor. He is planning to work on a freelance basis with multiple projects. From his previous experience working for other companies, he developed a lot of clients with whom he is planning to work. 

Besim is applying for a loan to buy a machine to make facades. He needs equipment in order to build a good business reputation and to satisfy his customers. With his business income, he will be able to help his family expenses. Besim is very ambitious and he intends to work harder to enhance the family’s way of living and to help them meet their needs. He wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to buy machine for facade-constructing.

loans.name: Janet Nyamalo

texts.en:
Janet is 37 years old,  married, and has five children. She has been farming for 15 years with a monthly income of 40,000 KES. 

Janet is requesting another loan from KADET for 60,000 KES, which she will use to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She is also hoping to purchase goats and sheep. With the anticipated profit, Janet will expand her business and educate her children to the university level. Sher hopes to have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy tools for her husband's tube well-drilling business.

loans.name: Kamah

texts.en: Kamah is 33 years old and lives in Margibi county, which has the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She has four children between 6 and 14 years old. They are attending school and live at home. Her husband is a businessman. For the past eight years she has been selling charcoal in the market. She is happy with her business because she is respected in her family and also is the mother in a supportive home. Some of the problem she is facing is that she doesn't have a good location for her selling place. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her plans are to expand her business and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Natig

texts.en:
Natig, age 43, owns and operates a small car repair business.  He is a a hard-working, enthusiastic man who puts all of his hard work into getting ahead in life. 

Natig opened his small business on his own initiative and with his spouse's support, repairing cars that are not functional and re-selling them at a profit. His business has been profitable because people in his district generally do not have the money for a new car. Natig believes that his business is going well because of the quality, good prices, and friendly treatment he offers his customers.

Natiq lives with his wife and their two school-aged children.

He has applied for a loan in the amount of 1500 AZN. With this investment, Natig will be able to buy broken-down cars to repair and offer for sale. He is confident that he will increase his sales as well as his income. He is very grateful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy old cars to repair and offer for sale

loans.name: Yulbasar

texts.ru: Йулбасар житель района Джиликуль, расположенный в южной части Хатлонской области Таджикистана. Ему 47 лет. Он женат и у него двое сыновей и две дочери. Старший сын уехал на заработки в заграницу. Сам Йулбасар занимается земледелием и садоводством. Он занят в этих сферах более 5 лет. В его деле ему помогает семья. Йулбасар имеет земельный участок, где он выращивает сельскохозяйственную культуру, а также имеет фруктовый сад. Сейчас Йулбасар запрашивает кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений с целью обработки посеянной пшеницы. За счет прибыли с урожая он планирует расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Yulbasar lives in Jilikul, which is located in southern Khatlon Province in Tadzhkistan. He is 47 years old, is married, and has two sons and two daughters. His oldest son has gone to work abroad. Yulbasar has been working in farming and gardening for more than 5 years. His family helps out with the business. Yulbasar has a plot of land where he grows crops, and also has a fruit garden. He is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer to treat the wheat he has planted. He plans to use the profits from the harvest to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his wheat crop

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en:
Zakir, aged 41, is married and the father of two children. His wife is a homemaker and helps him in the husbandry business. 

Zakir is a pensioner on disability now, and his main occupation and income is animal-fattening. For the past 12 years, he has been in livestock activity, looking after his animals and selling dairy products at the local market of a nearby small town. 

He is content with the earnings he has been generating from his business. His dream is to have a grazing area. Indeed, each time he has to rent land for his livestock, and this is difficult and expensive. Zakir works hard to reach his goals. He is sure that his progress will guarantee the future of his children.

Zakir is currently trying to expand this animal-fattening business. This is why he has turned to Kiva partner VFAC; he really hopes to receive help from this organization. Zakir is requesting a 1,600 AZN loan to buy a dairy cow with its calf to add to his existing herd.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow with its calf.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie, age 37, earns a living by selling food items such as soft drinks, rice, oil, and Vita. She started her business with money given to her by her husband and has been engaged in her venture for 15 years. During that time, she has made her business profitable and has built up a stable base of regular customers.

Mamie lives with her husband and their three school-aged children in Margibi county, which is the largest rubber-producing plantation in Liberia. The children are currently enrolled in school.

Mamie is requesting a loan in order to buy more food items such as soft drinks, rice, oil, and Vita to offer for sale. 

Her goal is to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy food items such as soft drinks, rice, oil, and Vita to offer for sale

loans.name: Ravshan

texts.en:
Ravshan is 40 years old. He is married and has three children. 

Ravshan is a person who always falls in a story. Twenty years ago, he went to his friend’s house and saw a big cow which nearly knocked him over with his horns. Ravshan was frightened and overwhelmed. Returning to his home, he decided to get money through the animal that scared him. In this way, he began his own business with animal husbandry. Now, he is one of the best and most successful businessmen in the local market. He buys cows, cares for them for two or three months, and sells them to local people. Thanks to his efforts, his cows are fat and attract a lot of customers. 

Ravshan wants to buy more cows to develop his business, but he does not have enough money for it. He is asking for a loan of TJS 6000 (somoni) to buy cows and feed. In this way, he will provide his family with high-quality living conditions. Moreover, he will enter his children in good schools. He promises to make his payment on time. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cows and feed for his developing business.

loans.name: Karbah

texts.en:
Karbah, age 38, earns an income by selling soft drinks. She has been engaged in this venture for 20 years. Her husband works for Firestone. They live with their three children in Margibi county, which is the largest rubber-producing plantation in Liberia. 

Karbah's children are between the ages of two and 18 years old, and the two youngest live at home and attend school. She herself was unfortunate in that she was unable to attend school, but she is determined to see her own children educated. 

Karbah is requesting a loan in order to purchase soft drinks for her business.  

Her goal is to build a house for the family and to ensure the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks to offer for sale

loans.name: Carmen Denny

texts.es: La Sra. Carmen sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de ropa,  cuenta que le fue con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de material de construcción,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería ropa por mayor ya  que incremento sus ventas y es necesario para incrementar sus ganancias, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Carmen continues to sell clothing. She says she used her previous loan to pay for building materials. She will use this loan to buy wholesale clothing to increase sales and profits. She is happy with and grateful for the chance to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.ru: Абдулло 30 лет. Он женат и имеет пятерых детей. Абдулло со своей большой семьей проживает в районе Джиликуль, который расположен в южной части Хатлонской области Таджикистана. Абдулло обеспечивает семью занимаясь земледелием и садоводством. Он в этих сферах уже 5 лет. Абдулло арендует земельный участок, на котором выращивает сельскохозяйственную культуру. В сезон посева Абдулло уже посеял пшеницу. Сейчас он запрашивает кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений с целью обработки посеянной пшеницы. За счет прибыли с урожая Абдулло хочет улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en: Abdullo is 30, married, and has five children. He lives with his family in Jilikul, in southern Khatlon Province in Tadzhikistan. Abdullo provides for his family by farming and gardening. He has been doing this kind of work for five years. Abdullo leases the plot of land on which he grows crops. During sowing season he planted wheat. He is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer for treating his wheat crop. Abdullo would like to use the profits from the harvest to improve his family's financial position.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his wheat crop

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
Sargis is 56 years old and lives in Yerevan, with his wife and two sons. Sargis has completed only secondary school. He was dreaming of becoming an engineer and studying in the State Engineering University. But, after his service in the Soviet Army, Sargis got married. Soon his first son was born. So, Sargis started to work as a laborer in one of the factories in Yerevan, in order to sustain his newly-created family.

After the Soviet Union collapsed, that factory closed. Sargis started to work as a driver. But about 10 years ago, Sargis and his sons launched their own business, in a rented place. They sell flowers and bouquets in the store. This business was profitable, and soon they increased sales volume. This activity enables them to provide for their family's needs. With their business profit they bought a new flower shop. Sargis is very pleased by his activity. As he confessed, to work with flowers and other plants is a great pleasure for him, and he combines business with pleasure.

Recently, Sargis decided to begin fruit and vegetable trading, outside of his flower shop. It will be a seasonal business, but at the same time, profitable. So Sargis needs a 600,000 Armenian Drams loan, which he will use to buy potatoes, apples, cucumbers, tomatoes and pears, for his newly-created food trading. Sargis will use the anticipated profit for organizing his son's wedding.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, apples, cucumbers, tomatoes and pears, for his newly-created business line, trading fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia earns an income by selling palm oil in the local market. She has been engaged in this business for 10 years. She is pleased with her customers' positive response to her business and is happy that she has managed to make her venture profitable.

Patricia lives with her husband and their four children in the airport area of Magibi county, which is the largest rubber-producing plantation in Liberia. Her husband has his own business. The children are between the ages of 10 and 20 years old.

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more palm oil for her business.

In the future, she plans to buy her own land and to build a house for the family.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil to offer for sale

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos, es casado y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de su suegra ocupando una habitacion pequeña con paredes de adobe y el piso de tierra, la  casa se encuentra ocupada en villa Concepcion de la zona sur de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente Carlos trabaja por más de diez horas y hasta altas horas de la noche con su vehículo de transporte de pasajeros ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para pagar el costo del mantenimiento de su vehículo ya que es su única fuente de ingresos para mantener a su familia.
El sueño de Carlos es mejorar sus ingresos para conseguir una casa en anticretico (es una figura legal por la cual el inquilino da un monto de dinero por adelantado al dueño de casa para poder vivir por un plazo no mayor a dos años en la casa, departamento o habitaciones en anticrético, al cabo del cual el dinero será devuelto al inquilino y éste deberá desocupar el inmueble) para tener más seguridad, comodidad y también poder ahorrar para una posible compra de casa y de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Carlos is married and doesn't have any children.  He lives in his mother-in-law's house, in a small room with adobe walls and a dirt floor.  The house if located in Concepcion, which is in the southern part of the city of La Paz.  Currently, Carlos works (in transportation) more than 10 hours a day, often late into the night.  He works these hours because he has to cover the cost of food and the basic needs of his family.

He needs this loan to pay for the cost of maintaining his vehicle, since it is the only source of income to sustain his family.  Carlos' dream is to improve his income so he can obtain housing via anticretico.  Anticretico is a legal term signifying that the tenant gives a sum of money to the owner in advance to be able to live in the house for no more than two years.  In the end, the money lent for the sections of the house or rooms on anticretico is returned to the tenant, who then leaves the property.  He wants to do this to have greater security, comfort, and also to be able to save up to possibly buy a house and in this way improve his quality of life.

This is the first time that he has asked for a loan with Impro and Kiva.

loans.use: pay for maintenance on his taxi.

loans.name: Irenea

texts.es: La  Sra. Irenea tiene 40 años,  casada con tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, se dedica a la venta de variedad de artículos de primera necesidad como abarrotes y variedad de artículos en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona de la Mutualista,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la  Sra. Irenea va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de abarrotes como  arroz por mayor para surtir su negocio y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la  Sra. Irenea va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, ya que esta época es de mucha demanda,  su deseo para su negocio es tener un almacén y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela, la  Sra. Irenea se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
Irenea,  40, is married and has three school-age children. She sells a variety of basic items such as groceries at her stand in Mutualista. This is her first loan cycle with the institution. Irenea will use the loan to buy a variety of groceries like wholesale rice to stock her business and offer her customers a selection of products. The purpose of the loan is to keep growing her business.

Irenea will use the profits to keep buying merchandise to increase her earnings, since demand is high right now. She would like to have storage so that she can offer her customers better service. Irenea is happy to have this chance, since she supports herself through this business.

loans.use: to buy wholesale groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow for resale.

loans.name: Kaysar

texts.en:
Kaysar is a Lebanese, married man. He’s 40 years old, and has two children. He’s really attached to his wife and children. Cooperating together, Kaysar and his wife were capable to cover their heavy expenses, in order to live a respectable life. He started his business as a car mechanic many years ago. He had to work really hard to prove that he’s a capable support for his family. He has gained a fair number of customers asking for his services. As for his wife, she works in a local company.

Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l. He will use the loan to purchase the needed quantity of car lubricants in order to respond rapidly to his clients’ problems. He believes that acting promptly is really essential to attract more and added customers. He seeks to develop his work in the near future, and better support his family.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of car lubricants for his car repair business

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali, age 63, lives and supports her family on a small retirement pension, which is 110 Laris (GEL) per month. This is hardly enough to provide food for the family which, according to Credo estimations, belongs to the "subsistence poor" category. They live in a small village in Mtskheta District.

Lali wishes to start up a chicken husbandry business so that she and her family members can generate income. She has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up purposes, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Lali has now requested a loan from Credo to start up this family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Lali will purchase chickens. With this investment, she will begin her animal husbandry business and sell eggs. She will be able to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase chickens

loans.name: Norma Veronica

texts.es: La Sra. Norma  tiene  27 años y es casada con 1 hijo que tiene la edad de un año, ella se dedica a la actividad de la agricultura, siembra papa maíz y yuca en su parcela que se encuentran en la localidad de Betanzo,  ella es cliente nueva de la institución,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Norma    va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de semillas y preparado de la tierra para la siembra de papa y así de esta manera aumentar su producción,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de dinero para la época de siembra, la  Sra. Norma  enfrenta retos en su negocio que esta temporada de frio ya que en muchas ocasiones arruina la siembra y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Norma is 27 years old and is married with a one-year-old son.  She works in farming.  She grows potatoes, corn, and yuca on her plot of land that is located in Betanzo.

She is a new customer with this field partner and this loan is her first with it.  Norma will use this loan to buy seeds and prepare the land to grow potatoes.  In this way, she will increase her production.  Her reason for asking for this loan is a lack of money for the planting season.

Norma faces challenges in her business during this cold season, since her crops are often ruined.  She will use the profits to improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: pay to plant her potato crop.

loans.name: Simona De Los Angeles

texts.es: Doña Simona, mujer trabajadora que ha sacado adelante a sus hijos quienes hoy en día ya son independientes y trabajan por su propia cuenta, tiene el apoyo de su esposo quien continua viviendo en el país vecino en donde pudo obtener un empleo con el que ayuda a su familia, mientras doña Simona por su parte sigue con el lavado y planchado desde hace muchos años. Ella está optando por un séptimo crédito para infraestructura, esta vez para la construcción de otro muro perimetral de su casa, que poco a poco ha venido construyendo de pared en pared, con el apoyo de financiamiento de Afodenic y Kiva, por el cual está muy contenta de ir avanzando con la mejora de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Simona is a hardworking women who has provided for her children, who are now grown and working. Her husband lives in a neighboring country where he got a job to help support his family and his wife. Meanwhile, Simona does the washing and ironing, as she has for years. 

She has applied for her seventh construction loan. She will use this loan to add a perimeter wall to her house, which she is slowly building wall by wall with funding from Afodenic and Kiva. She is happy to be able to continue improving her house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, and cement blocks and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Majid

texts.ru: Дом, где живет Маджит и его семья  не отвечает стандартам жилья и он срочно должен отремонтировать свой дом. Он очень добрый и трудолюбивый человек. Маджит женатый мужчина, и на воспитании имеет 3  детей. Дети все девочки. Они учатся в средней школе и всегда просят родителей отремонтировать их дом, но их доход от выращивания сельхоз культур, как огурцы и чеснок и скотоводства не достаточно для этого. Он должен заменить окна и двери, так как зимой они не держат теплоту дома внутри, а в Таджикистане зима довольно холодная. Из-за не удобства дома, у девочек всегда насморк зимой.  Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, окон и дверей для ремонта дома.  Маджит и его дети ждут вашу доброту.
texts.en: The house that Majid and his family live in is in substandard condition and he needs to repair his house as soon as possible. He is a very kind and hardworking person. Majid is married and has 3 children, all daughters. He teaches at the high school and his parents are always asking him to fix the house. But the income they get for growing such crops as cucumbers and garlic, and for raising livestock is too little for this. He has to replace the windows and doors, which don't insulate the house during winter -- and winter in Tadzikistan is quite cold. Because of the poor living conditions, his daughters always catch colds in the winter. He is asking for a loan in the amount of 3000 somons to buy building materials, windows, and doors to repair the house. Majid and his children await your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy building materials and windows and doors for repairing his house

loans.name: Nugzar

texts.en:
Nugzar is 51 years old. He lives in the city of Rustavi with his wife and two children, who are going to school. Nugzar requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is Nugzar’s monthly salary. He has a truck and works on transporting different kinds of cargo on private orders.

Nugzar requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit Nugzar will purchase cement for his workshop making cement blocks for construction, which is not functional at the moment. With the cement Nugzar will start producing cement blocks and sell them to the local resellers. This will significantly grow his income. Nugzar will reinvest part of the profit to develop his business and make more products. Another part he will use to provide future education for his children and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase cement for his workshop making cement blocks for construction

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 24-year-old, married woman. She lives with her husband, Sleiman, and their only child. Despite her older age, Fatima is obliged to work continually, as she is responsible for supporting her husband with their family expenses. Their child is attending school.

Fatima started to sell clothes from her home, to avoid the rent expenses. She provides her customers good quality products, at fair prices. She is satisfied with what she has attained so far, although she wishes to enhance her family’s way of living even more. That’s the reason why she’s asking today for a youth loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l, which she will use to purchase a new collection of clothes and enlarge her business.

In the near future, Fatima wishes to open her own clothing shop, and maybe hire new employees to help her accomplish the work tasks, and therefore earn higher income.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of clothes and enlarge her business

loans.name: Vazgen

texts.en:
Vazgen is still engaged in selling vegetables. His parents are very old and pensioners, which is why he has had to work hard to sustain his family.

For over twenty years Vazgen has plied his trade in Ijevan Central Market. His profits have enabled him to buy furniture for his home and a car. At first he was selling only cucumbers and potatoes. Then he expanded to various other kinds of vegetables such as tomatoes, cucumbers, zucchini, pumpkins, peppers, eggplant, green beans, etc. He sells from the back of his car.

Now Vazgen is applying for a 650,000 AMD loan from Kiva lenders through Nor Horizon to start selling fruit. He expects more in profits from this deal. He will use the anticipated income on his house, which has not seen any repairs in more than 25 years.

loans.use: To buy large amounts of fruit to sell.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar, age 49, operates a business selling convenience foodstuffs. She has been engaged in this venture since 1995. She is a graduate of Yerevan State Industrial College and worked for many years as a technician in factories in Sevan city. However, after the collapse of the Soviet Union, Armenia was in difficult economic conditions. This is when Gohar decided to launch her own business. Her shop is in a remote area of Sevan city where there are few other shops, and this is why she has so many clients. Her business is going well and she is very pleased. 
 
Gohar lives in Sevan city with her husband and their two daughters. Her husband travels to the Russian Federation when seasonal work is available. Her eldest daughter is a teacher, and the younger daughter is a student at Yerevan State University, studying in the department of philology. 
  
Gohar is requesting a loan in the amount of 400,000 Armenian drams, which she will use to add fresh vegetables and fruits to her inventory. Gohar believes that her clients' time is valuable and that they will respond favorably to the convenience of being able to buy their fruits and vegetables at her store. 

She is confident that she will receive a good profit from this new activity.

loans.use: to buy a large number of fruits and vegetables to offer for sale in her shop

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 34 years old and lives in Magibi county which has the largest rubber-producing plantations in Liberia. She has six children between 9 and 14 years old. They are attending school and live at home. Her husband is a businessman, and for the past seven years she has been selling fresh fish in the local market. She is respected in her family and also a mother of a supportive home because of her business. One of the problems she is facing is that she doesn't have a good selling place. 

Rebecca is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh cassava fish, butternose fish, bonnie fish, etc., for her business. Her plans are to expand her business and build herself a house.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh cassava fish, butternose fish, bonnie fish, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Maria tiene 40 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de sombreros para mujeres de polleras, para las cholitas,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia en  la institución, la Sra. Maria va a usar este préstamo para la compra de sombreros para  su negocio ya que por esta fechas que se acerca el varias fiestas, aniversarios de zonas y tiene mucha venta, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incremento de capital de trabajo, la Sra. Maria enfrenta retos en su negocio que son surtir su mercadería y va a utilizar los beneficios e seguir comprando por mayor.
texts.en: Maria is 40. She sells traditional hats for indigenous women. This will be her first loan cycle with the institution. Maria will use the money to buy hats to stock her business for upcoming festivals and regional anniversaries when sales are good. She has applied for a loan to increase working capital. It is a challenge for Maria to stock merchandise, and she will use her profits to keep buying at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy men's hats.

loans.name: Ingrit Tatiana

texts.es:
Nació siendo la menor de las hermanas, vivía con su mama, hermanas y su sobrino. 
Gracias a Dios nunca falto la comida y siempre tuvo una muy buena comunicación con su familia, aunque ella casi no compartía con su mama era su mejor amiga. 
Su papa les visitaba cuando podía siempre se esmero por ser un gran padre y ayudar a sus hijas y esposa.
Mientras cursaba sexto grado su papa murió de un paro cardio-respiratorio y fue un golpe muy duro para todas ellas, desde ahí las coas se hicieron más difíciles, su mama de ahí en adelante se encargo de todos los gastos de la casa.
Tiempo después ellos pudieron comprar una linda casa, esto les ayudo mucho, ya que los gastos disminuyeron.
Mientras cursaba grado décimo tuvo la oportunidad de hacer un Técnico en el Sena y la aprovecho, el programa desempeñaba destrezas en Manejo de Maquinaria para la confección de ropa exterior, el cual pudo terminar con éxito al lado de su grado de bachiller.
Cuando salió del colegio no había medios para entrar a estudiar, así que se inscribió al Sena para realizar un programa en Confección de ropa interior lo termino y realizo exitosamente sus pasantías. 
Sacando provecho a esto se dedico a trabajar confeccionando vestidos de baño y ropa interior, alguien quiso colaborar en su estudio y le dio la noticia de que estudiaría en CAMPOALTO.
En la actualidad está cursando Administración Hotelera poniendo mayor esfuerzo de su parte ya que su mama es quien le paga su estudio.
Sus metas terminar sus estudios profesionales y poder desempeñarse satisfactoriamente en ese campo, lograr una estabilidad económica y demás.
texts.en:
Being born the youngest of all her sisters, Ingrit lived with her mother, her sisters, and her nephew.  Thanks to God, she never lacked food, and she always had good communication with her family.  Her mother was her best friend, although she was not able to spend a lot of time with her.

Her father visited them when he could, and always took care to be a great father and to help his daughters and his wife.

When Ingrit was in 6th grade, her father died of a heart attack.  This was a blow to all of them.  From this point on, things became more difficult.  Her mother had to take charge of all of the household expenses.

Sometime later, the family was able to buy a nice house.  This helped them a lot, because the expenses decreased.  In 10th grade, Ingrit took the opportunity to get a technical degree from SENA (a public vocational education program).  In this program, she developed skills in working with machines to make coats and jackets.  She successfully completed this program along with her high school degree.

When Ingrit left school, she had  no means to further her education, so she enrolled in a SENA program to learn how to make underwear.  She finished this program and also successfully completed an internship.

Taking advantage of her training, Ingrit started working making bathing suits and underwear.  Someone wanted to work in her studio, and so she gave notice that she would study at CAMPOALTO (a technical college).

Now Ingrit is studying hotel management, putting in maximum effort on her part, because her mother is paying for her tuition.  Her goals include finishing her professional degree, being able to work satisfactorily in her field, and achieving economic stability.

loans.use: to complete her studies in kitchen management in the hotel management program of CAMPOALTO

loans.name: Loucine

texts.en: Loucine is a 28-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and one sibling. She faced bad circumstances and lived in unpleasant financial conditions. This is why she struggled and worked hard to show her perseverance in being able to enhance her way of living. So in 2005, she started to work as a beautician. She works at her house and also visits customers wherever they are located to provide them with her high-quality beauty services. She is very thankful for the results attained so far thanks to the previous loan she took from Kiva. Today, she is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase beauty products and cosmetics so that she can improve her business operations and follow up on the new fashions. In the near future she plans to open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products and cosmetics

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
La señora Dora   de 45  años de edad,  tiene  un hijo que depende de ella, vive con su esposo, en su casa propia, en la comunidad de  San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras.
Doña Dora se dedica desde hace 06 años  al negocio de venta de frescos, golosinas y ropa interior nueva, su venta la realiza de forma ambulante, visita a los pobladores de su comunidad para ofrecerles sus productos.
Doña Dora también vende tacos, enchiladas y refrescos los días sábado y domingo, es una señora trabajadora que lucha día con día para sacar adelante a su familia.
Doña Dora está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de plátanos, papas, yucas, cebollas, tomates, patastes, arroz, queso, mantequilla etc. y también quiere comprar  ropa interior para la venta,  con el apoyo del préstamo  espera  que mejore un poco su situación económica  está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Doña Dora su sueño es mejorar su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2013
texts.en:
Dora is 45 and has a dependent son. She lives with her husband in their house in San Lorenzo is southern Honduras. For six years, Dora's business has been selling beverages, candies, and new underwear as a street vendor, visiting local residents to sell them her merchandise. Dora also sells tacos, enchiladas, and beverages on Saturdays and Sundays. She is hardworking and strives every day to provide for her family. 

Dora is applying for a loan to buy bananas, potatoes, yucas, onions, tomatoes, patastes, rice, cheese, butter, and underwear to sell. She hopes to improve her financial situation with this loan. She is pleased to continue working with Prism. Her dream is to make improvements to her house.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2013

loans.use: to buy bananas, potatoes, yucas, onions, tomatoes, patastes, rice, cheese, and butter for her business.

loans.name: Koba

texts.en:
Koba is 48 years old. He lives in Kutaisi, West Georgia with his son Revaz, 21, and Natia, eighteen; they both are students. Koba requested a start-up loan several times from local financial institutions but without any success. He was rejected due to his low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

Koba has an iron workshop. He gets small orders for the production of iron goods. His income, however, is too small to cover monthly expenses.

Then Koba applied for a 1200 USD loan from Credo. His loan request has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. Their start-up loan program will provide credit to the rural poor, who do not have access to loans for those regarded as high-risk borrowers due to their low incomes.

With his loan Koba will buy more iron for his workshop. As he is very experienced and well known among the locals, with a bigger stock he will be able to get more orders and produce such goods as gates, beds and railings. The increase in business will bring more income to the family, enabling Nugzar to reinvest in his workshop and cover more of the family’s monthly expenses.

loans.use: to buy more iron for his workshop.

loans.name: Kamah

texts.en:
Kamah is 29 years old, married to a businessman, and the mother of three school-going children in Margibi county, the location of the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. For the past seven years Kamah has been involved in business, currently selling palm oil, an activity she learned from her mother.

Walking to the village to buy palm oil, Kamah likes how her customers are often waiting upon her return to purchase her products. She is now requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, and plans to build her house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu is 26 years old and lives in Magibi County, which is the largest rubber-producing plantation area in Liberia. Fatu is married and has two children aged 5 and 10 years. They live at home, and the two children attend school.

For the past seven years, Fatu has been running a table market, where she sells fresh fish in the community market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and she learned this way of selling from her mother. She is appreciative of her business, because it keeps her saving every day and makes her popular. Her plan is to build a house. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh fish, to resell at her business table.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish for her business

loans.name: Sonnie

texts.en:
Martha is 46 years old and lives in the area of Airport in Margibi County, which has the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia, With little income from her husband who works as a security guard at Robert International Air Port, this mother of six children between the ages of 11 and 31 is determined to make their lives better through the sale of rice, soap, charcoal, vita, pepper, oil, etc. In business for 12 year now, Martah enjoys the interactions with her customers.

Martha is requesting a loan to purchase more ice, soap, charcoal, vita, pepper, oil, etc. to expand her sales. Her dream is to expand her business into a store in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more ice, soap, charcoal, vita, pepper, oil, etc. to expand her sales.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is married. She has four children who are adults. She lives with her husband who is a carpenter.

Catherine is an artisan who has been involved in weaving since she was very young. This gives her a good income. She learned this profession from her mother, who used to teach her so that she would have the same skill. She has been weaving for 15 years.

Catherine says she has very good hands for handicrafts. She says that she sells her products in Mombasa and also has orders from Nairobi. Her neighbors say she is responsible and hardworking, which are important values for making progress.

She is applying for the loan in order to purchase thread, needles, dyes and additional materials that are essential for weaving. She is thankful to Yehu Microfinance for the opportunity it has given her.

loans.use: To purchase thread, needles, dyes and additional materials that are essential for weaving

loans.name: Yorleny

texts.es: Yorlenny, tiene la edad  de 39 años, está casado, vive con sus hijos y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra dos  vacas con buenas características para la producción de leche y que estén al menos de primer parto para asegurar que den una cantidad de leche diaria aceptable. La idea es aprovechar el espacio que tiene de pasto y las buenas condiciones de terreno y clima para poder tener estos animales y a la vez obtener  leche y desarrollar los terneros para en el futuro venderlos para carne y las hembras dejarlas para la producción de leche siempre y cuando cuenten con buenas características para la producción de leche. Con esta compra podrá desarrollar más la actividad, y a la vez tener un ahorro que le permitirá ir teniendo más animales e invertir más en la propiedad.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Yorlenny is 39 years old, married and lives with her children and husband, who are her greatest priority.  With her loan she plans on buying two cows that are well-suited for milk production and have had at least one calf.  This will make sure that they give a good amount of milk every day.  Her idea is to take advantage of the grassy space that she has and the good condition of the land and also the good climate so as to be able to have these animals and also get milk from them.  She also hopes to raise the male calves for meat and the females for milk (if they have the traits needed for milk cows).

With this purchase, she will be able to develop her business activity and at the same time save some money that will allow her to have more animals and invest more in her property.  This is the first loan that she has received from Fudecosur.  She hasn't gotten loans from other communal banks, but Fudecosur has offered her a loan with greater ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: buy milk cows.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La Sra. Maria sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de Variedad de DVS y CDs, cuenta que le fue con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de un televisor para la muestra de sus productos,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de otro televisor ya  incremento sus ventas y es necesario para incrementar sus ganancias, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
María continues with her same job selling a variety of DVDs and CDs.  She says it went well with the previous loan because she used it to buy a television set to show her products.

She's requesting this loan to buy another t.v. because she increased her sales and she needs to increase her profits.

She's happy and grateful about this opportunity to grow in her business.

loans.use: to buy a television set

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cloth, put designs on it (tint it) and resell it

loans.name: Valodia

texts.en:
Valodia is 55 years old. He lives in Chechela village, Adigeni district, with his 47-year-old wife, Nana. Valodia requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.
 
The main source of income for the family is their agricultural activities. They own a plot of land, where they grow potatoes. The family also has four milking cows, a calf, and eight sheep. They milk the cows to make dairy products, and from the sheep they get wool and also cheese. Harvested potatoes, with the dairy products, are sold locally at the market.

Recently, Valodia requested a loan from Credo to restart a family business. His loan request was approved, in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits, with soft conditions, to rural poor people, who do not have access to other credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

With the received credit, Valodia wants to start trading in household goods and clothes. He and his wife had a business like this, a few years ago. Because they are already experienced in this field, Valodia decided to restart the business. The loan will be used for purchasing a stock of household goods and clothes at the wholesale price, which will be distributed at the local markets.  The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To buy a stock of household goods and clothes, with which to restart their business trading in those kinds of products

loans.name: Jamungu

texts.en:
Jamungu is from Tiribe, Mombasa. She is married but has not been blessed with children. 

Jamungu has a store in her home with a well-established customer base. She is very hardworking and an excellent client of Yehu Microfinance. Her husband is employed at a hotel, and the two of them help each other so that they can get ahead. 

Jamungu is requesting this loan to buy sugar, noodles, flour, rice and other products to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles, flour, rice and other products to stock her store.

loans.name: Arayik

texts.en:
Arayik is 51 years old and lives with his wife, son, daughter-in-law, and two grandchildren, in Ijevan city. He has also two daughters, who are married and live separately from their parents.

Arayik works as an auto mechanic. He has many years of work experience in this sphere and a good repute in Ijevan city.  He implements his orders perfectly, and all customers are very pleased with his work. As he confessed, the secret of his work's good results, is that he does his work with great pleasure, although his salary is not much. Arayik's son works in the border troops of Armenia. His wife is engaged in clothes trading. His daughter-in-law doesn't work, apart from taking care for her children.

Arayik says that it is too hard to meet his family's needs in Ijevan city, even when his wife and son share their family expenses. So Arayik needs a loan, which he will use to buy some auto repairing materials and tools, for his activity.

loans.use: To buy some materials and tools for his work repairing autos

loans.name: Kebbeh

texts.en: Kebbeh is 41 years old and lives in Magibi county, which has the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is married with four children between 3 and 19 who live at home and attend school. For the past five years she has been selling red oil in the market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from her mother. She spends eight hours a day with her business, and most likely she uses a pickup to have her red oil at her shop. She is appreciative of her business because it keeps her saving every day. Her plan is to build a house. She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is married and very hardworking. She lives with her partner, and they have four children. They have been living in Tiribe for ten years.

Saumu has a posho mill which she uses to grind maize into flour. She says her job is very demanding because she is the only one in the family who works.

Saumu is applying for a 50,000 KES loan from Yehu to invest in various tools such as drills, spanners and fuel. Her dream is to buy a small lathe in order to do other types of work and so progress every day.

loans.use: to invest in various tools such as drills, spanners and fuel.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is 32 years old and lives in Margibi County which has the largest  rubber-producing plantation in Liberia. She is married, and she has four children between 6 and 13 years old. They are currently in school and live at home. For the past six years she has been selling red (palm) oil in the local market. She enjoys the profit-making in the business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil for her business. Her plans are to build herself a house and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more red (palm) oil for her business.

loans.name: Ega

texts.en:
Ega is married and has three children, two of whom still attend school.

She has had a grocery store for three years. She started with the help of her husband, who used his earnings from growing crops to help start the business. The income from this business now covers the household expenses as well as school fees.

Ega is seeking a loan in order to buy noodles, flour, oil, herbs, cookies, candy and drinks, which are the top-selling items in her business. This will enable her to offer a greater variety of products to her customers and allow for the possibility of increasing her income.

loans.use: to buy noodles, flour, oil, herbs, cookies, candy and drinks.

loans.name: Siah

texts.en: Siah is 49 years old, married, and lives in  Margibi County, which has the largest rubber-producing plantation in Liberia, with her six children who live at home. Only three of them attend school. Her husband is a nurse. From 1984 she has been involved in business and currently she sells cosmetics. She says she likes how her customers walk to get to her when she is selling, especially when she has new goods on hand, and she enjoys how supportive she is to her family.
